loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Sheryl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
 
Sheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Kenia Lizeth

texts.es:
Kenia, de 28 años de edad, vive en una aldea  fuera de San Pedro Sula. Lleva 9 años de casada con su esposo y tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad.  

Llevan cuatro años trabajando duro. A Kenia siempre le ha gustado costurar y aprendió a elaborar sabanas para  camas. Ahora es su negocio que le genera los ingresos para vivir en mejores condiciones que antes.

Su esposo la apoya mucho con la venta de las sabanas quien sale a ovenderlas a varios lugares y aprovecha a vender también  accesorios para celulares como diversificación del negocio.

Ha solicitado un  quinto préstamo a ODEF  para compra de telas para elaborar sabanas y accesorios para teléfono celulares, ya que viene la temporada buena de navidad donde va expandir mas el negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Kenia, age 28, lives in a village outside of San Pedro Sula.  She has been married for nine years, and she has two children, ages six and seven.

She has been working hard for four years.  Kenia has always liked to sew, and she learned how to make bed sheets.  Now it is her business, and it generates the income for better living conditions than before.

Her husband supports her a lot with the sale of the sheets.  He goes to various places to offer them for sale.  He makes the most of it by also selling cell phone accessories to diversify the business.   

She has requested her fifth loan from ODEF.  The loan is to buy fabric to make sheets and to buy cell phone accessories.  The good Christmas season is coming up, and she will expand her business more and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sheets and to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: 06.11.06-Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thanh has a stall selling household appliances. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more household appliances to resell. The main harship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thanh is 43-years-old and she is married with 4 children. Thanh lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thanh is the group leader of the 06 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and to buy more land.

loans.use: to purchase more household appliances to resell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel es soltero se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida ya que tiene una pensión no tiene hijos y se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzo, el vive en casa familiar en la casa de su mama, ubicado en la zona Oroncota, el préstamo será destinado para  para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su restaurante, es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación, con el tiempo desea tener un  restaurante mas grande y atender a mas clientela ya que tiene muchos clientes por la buena comida que se prepara en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel is single and has no children. He has a diner where he sells food. Miguel spends his time preparing lunches. He lives in the family home with his mother in the District of Oroncota.

This loan will be used to buy tables and chairs so that he can expand his restaurant. Miguel is a young entrepreneur who has the drive to succeed. In time, he wants to have a large restaurant so that he can serve more customers. He already has many customers because of the good food that he serves in his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de alegre y sociable, es conviviente con Rosendo, fruto de esa unión tienen cuatro hijos de 24, 18, 16 y 10 años, habitando cómodamente una casa de su propiedad, que es una herencia de sus padres. El negocio que tiene Elva es un multiservicio donde brinda servicio de cambio de aceite de motor y mototaxi, además de la venta de repuestos de todas las marcas y artículos de ferretería, todo esto instalado en su propia casa, negocio que tiene desde hace 10 años, contando con la ayuda de su hijo en la atención a los clientes. Lo que le gusta de su negocio en el poder contar con un ingreso económico con el cual apoya a su pareja, con los gastos de su hogar, además que la distrae, le gusta tener su propio ingreso y sentirse independiente. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, se siente cómoda con su grupo, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de un andamio para la exhibición de sus productos, como repuestos, aceites para vehículos y otros artículos de ferretería, asimismo comprará repuestos para motores.
texts.en:
Elva, age 54, is a hard working and strong-willed woman. She is also cheerful and friendly. She lives in common law with Rosendo and they have four children ages 24, 18, 16 and 10. They all live comfortably in their own house, which they inherited from her parents. 
Elva has a multi-service business offering oil change for motorbikes and mototaxis, as well as spare parts of all brands and hardware items. She has had her business for ten years. It is located in her house and one of her sons helps her serving costumers. What she likes about her business is being able to have an income to contribute to the household, besides having something to spend time on. What she likes about the business is to have an income and be able to help her partner with household expenses. Further, it is a distraction, gives her her own income and makes her feel independent. This will be her fifth loan with our institution and she feels very happy with the economic support she has received to advance in business. Therefore, she promises she will repay on time, just like on previous loans. On the other hand, she is very happy with her group and considers its members are responsible and supportive. With the 1,500 New Soles Elva is asking for, she will buy a display case in which to exhibit her products, such as spare parts, motor oil and other hardware items that she herself will purchase.

loans.use: to buy a display case to demonstrate items for sale, namely spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Maria Neris

texts.es:
La señora Neris  vive en el municipio de Larreynaga en León donde se desempeña como maestra de primaria de un colegio municipal, se siente muy contenta porque el trabajar con los niños le ha enseñado muchas cosas y se siente satisfecha con 23 años de ejercer dicha labor.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como piedra cantera, cemento, hierro, arena y cerámica para mejorar la condición actual de su vivienda porque requiere realizarlo y así proporcionar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida ya que el objetivo principal es de favorecerse con el financiamiento y realizar la obra a lo inmediato para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Neris lives in the town of Larreynaga in León, where she works as a primary school teacher in the municipal school.  She feels very happy because working with children has taught her many things and she has been satisfied with this work for 23 years.

She is asking for this loan to purchase construction materials such as stone, cement, iron, sand, and tiles to improve the condition of her home.  She needs to do the repairs and it will provide her family with a better quality of life.  Her main goal is to benefit from the loan, and do the work immediately for her own benefit and her family's.

loans.use: to purchase stone, cement, iron, sand, and tiles.

loans.name: Chhev

texts.en: Chhev, 52, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Chhev and her husband sell groceries and produce traditional baskets to sell. Chhev is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store and to help her son to repair his house. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to expand her grocery business. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store and to help her son repair his house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida así como amable y alegre, es conviviente con Félix quien también es agricultor, vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad a los que quiere mucho. Comenta que por el momento están habitando una casa alquilada. La actividad que realiza Ruth es la agricultura dedicándose específicamente en la siembra de yuca, sobre los terrenos de sus suegros, quienes le prestaron un espacio de 7 hectáreas. Además alquila a un vecino 2 hectáreas adicionales pagando por alquiler 400 soles por hectárea producida. Estando en este negocio desde hace 2 años y contando con el apoyo de su pareja y 02 peones a los que paga un jornal de 20 nuevos soles, ha logrado salir adelante y darle lo mejor a sus hijos. Se siente a gusto con su trabajo, pues lo considera una actividad sana y tranquila, además de gustarle la vida de campo ya que no tolera la vida en ciudad. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos de motocicletas en la ciudad de Pucallpa  viendo que ese negocio tiene bastante demanda. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el crédito anterior  que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la siembra de más hectáreas de yuca contratando peones para esta actividad.
texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old. She is a hardworking, determined woman, as well as happy and friendly. She lives with her partner, Felix, who also is a farmer. Ruth lives in the company of her partner and their children, who are seven and two years old, and who they really love. She says that at the moment she is living in a rented house. 

Ruth works in agriculture, specifically planting yuca on the land of her in-laws, who have loaned her seven hectares of land. On top of this, she rents two additional hectares from her neighbor, paying 400 soles of rent for each producing hectare. 

Having been in this business for two years and with the support of her partner and two laborers who they pay 20 nuevos soles daily, she has managed to get ahead and give her children the best in life. She is pleased with her job, since she finds it healthy and calm. Furthermore, she likes country life, since she cannot stand life in the city. She has plans to expand her business and open a store for motorcycle parts in Pucallpa city, seeing that there is enough demand for this business. 

This will be her second loan with the MFP institution. She hopes for a small loan so that she can meet her goals. On the other hand, she promises once again to make her payments, like with the last loan she had. Furthermore, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in the planting of more hectares of yuca, contracting laborers for this job.

loans.use: to contract laborers.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia es socia del Banco Comunal Casaorco, tiene 55 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, ovino y porcino, es madre de 7 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años.
Otilia aprendió en Finca a poder ahorra y así cumplir todo lo que se proponía, le encanta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque le ayudan a poder mejorar sus relaciones familiares y en su negocio, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de vaquitas para hacerlas engordar, también invertirá en pasto.
texts.en:
Otilia is a member of Casaorco Community Bank. She is 55 years old and a mother to seven children. She makes a living buying and selling sheep and pigs. Otilia has worked with FINCA Peru for five years. 

Otilia learned at FINCA how to save and to accomplish everything she sets out to do. She enjoys the training she receives from her community bank because it helps her improve her family relationships and her business. Now she will use this loan to purchase calves for fattening, and will also invest in pasture.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 65 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with  four children. 

Apolonia has a pig-raising business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig-raising business. 

Apolonia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Apolonia hopes to own an agrivet supply business to earn money. Apolonia is proud of being a member of PMPC because they can answer her problems in terms of money.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Kasifah

texts.en:
Kasifah is a 34-year-old married woman living in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in the produce business, buying and selling maize and beans to her customers. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport. She is limited by capital and poor roads, which make delivery of her products to customers difficult. Despite the limitations, she has a dream of expanding her business into new market areas.

Kasifah intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: This loan helps Madan Paul get connected to her local prepay microgrid. Madan Paul is a 78-year-old mother of six. She runs a small business and lives in a small white and pink house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid, and to get reliable electricity at home. Mainly, she is looking forward to being connected, as it will allow her to save money. Madan Paul and her family will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, and clean power source. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This microgrid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Donald Rogelio

texts.es: Don Donald es Ingeniero Eléctrico, no ha tenido mucha suerte en desempeñar su profesión, antes trabajaba en el área de construcción, ahora ha formado su propio negocio de pulpería que atiende junto a su esposa ubicado en su casa de habitación, de vez en cuando realiza trabajos de electricidad. Don Donald se ha auxiliado con los créditos para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para así brindarle a su familia un hogar digno, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para cerrar las paredes con plycem de un pequeño solar que ha adquirido para sus hijos.

loans.use: Don Rogelio solicita el crédito para construir las paredes de su vivienda que está realizando para sus hijos.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter S. is a father of three, and he owns a business, selling all types of goods for the home and library. Since he was very young, he has sold home items, and when he married, he continued to do so with his wife’s help. He decided to work out of the home to help his wife Katy raise their children. With over fifteen years of experience, Walter has become well-known throughout this neighborhood. He has been able to purchase an air conditioner, which is always welcomed by his loyal patrons, and is know for his fair prices. His wish is to find capital to fund the growth of his business and start doing custom orders for his clients. Some of the items that customers demand are home furnishings, cookware, tools, and clothing.


Mifex offers our clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Expand business to on-demand goods such as home furnishings, cookware, tools, and clothing.

loans.name: Aytakin

texts.en:
Aytakin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, Seyidli village. 

Aytakin is married and the mother of 3 children. She works at her store which she opened 5 years ago.

Having borrowed $400 she bought a refrigerator.
In order to increase the variety of consumer goods, she is requesting a loan of $800.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods in her store

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Luisa is a 33-year old woman and married with three small children. Luisa and her husband tend a small taro plantation and the crop is their only source of income.  Luisa works hard on the plantation every day. Developing this land into a sustainable source of income is her way of ensuring that her children can have a good education and a future full of opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase plantation equipment:  knives, wheelbarrow, and fertilizer

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is a widow who supports herself and her 17-year-old son with a business that sells drapes and window decorations. She started her company four years ago, when she was unable to find a stable job but came across a good business opportunity where there was not a lot of competition. Since that time, she has built a strong reputation in her trade. Customers appreciate being able to purchase the items they need, the home-decorating advice and expertise Svetlana offers and her calm demeanor and ability to relate to people. Svetlana has asked for a loan to help purchase new inventory so that she can continue to provide high-quality products to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Silvia has a small store that she runs with her husband. It was her husband who suggested that they open the store after he found himself without work. Nowadays, they not only run the store but they also have placed three telephone booths in their business where all types of calls can be made.

.

Loan Use

They will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for the store. Also, they wish to purchase cards for reloading minutes onto cell phones, which are very much in demand in businesses that offer telephone services.

Personal Information

Silvia is 31 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. They have a stable family life and a house made out of cement. Her primary goal is to have a private school serving her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Silvia tiene una despensa que administra junto con su esposo quien fue el que le propuso que pusieran ese negocio a raíz de que se quedo sin empleo. Actualmente no solo tiene la despensa sino que además han logrado poner un locutorio donde tiene tres cabinas para realizar llamadas de toda índole,

.

Uso del Préstamo

Ellos necesitan el crédito para comprar mas mercadería para la tienda además necesitan comprar tarjetas para recargar minutos en los celulares pues son muy solicitadas el la zona por el servicio que ellos prestan

Información Personal

Ella tiene 31 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudia su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta poder tener una unidad educativa al servicio de su comunidad

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and prepaid cellular phone cards

loans.name: Siaivao

texts.en: Siaivao is one of the oldest members for Vailoa Aleipata Centre. She is 65 years of age and married with two grown children. This will be Siaivao’s second loan with SPBD, and she is very thankful for the opportunity to develop her family business. With her second loan Siaivao is looking forward to growing more crops in addition to taro, and she is planning to export her crops overseas so that she might earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and other supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a young 23-year-old retail shop owner. She has operated her business for one year. She takes great care in her appearance as well as the neatness of her business. Her business is located in the Kyebando District of Kampala. Like many districts surrounding Kampala, there is a blend of economic conditions. Within sight of Kyebando on the hillside are million-dollar homes owned by government officials, people running NGO’s, and expat’s. (This is a topic which is absolutely fascinating, very much misunderstood, but is beyond the scope of this article).

In Kyebando there are no paved streets, buildings are poorly-constructed, and people navigate along pathways with the occasional whiff of open sewage. It should be noted that there is a very wonderful spirit in these districts. There is vitality to the “street scene” that is lacking in communities of more affluence. In Kyebando, everyone knows their neighbors, and mothers watch after their children as they play openly and relatively safely along the paths. As most people are without jobs, much time is spent visiting, laughing and telling stories. There are many small businesses. One reason for this is that starting your own business is the only chance you have to get a job. You may not make much, but you will make something, if you start a business.

At Ester's store, she sells soap, toilet paper, candles, dry cells, and soft drinks. She also has a scale where she weighs dry staples from 50kg sacks. From the sacks, she sells rice, flour, salt, etc. With her loan, she plans to expand her inventory of the items she sells.

loans.use: Ester plans to use her loan to buy more soap, soft drinks, and sacks of rice and flour for her retail store.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: My name is Azra B. and I am a widow with four children: three sons and one daughter. One of my sons is a turner and possesses his own lathe. His business is our major source of income. He would like a loan of $175 to expand his business. I will save the profits to help my children marry. I currently supplement our household income by selling cloth and crockery from my home.

loans.use: To expand her family's business

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor is a member of the Las Mercedes community bank and the owner of an animal hospital located in the Carhuaz district and province in the department of Ancash.

With the loan valued at 2,000 sols, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase 5 boxes of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamins and D.-worming agents to prevent anthrax.

Flor is 54 years old, the mother of 3, and her husband also contributes to the business. Their income allows them to pay for their children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Flor pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes, tiene una veterinaria que está ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 5 cajas D. vacunas, antibióticos, vitaminas y desparasitantes para prevenir el ántrax.

Flor tiene 54 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos, es casada y su esposo la apoya en este negocio. Sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use:
Purchase of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamins, etc.

Compra de vacunas, antibióticos, vitaminas, etc

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda belongs to the communal bank "Bellavista," located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is 46 years old, and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a brickmason and a painter. Hilda decided to invest in selling beverages. Currently she runs a small general store. In the morning, she performs her household chores with the help of her children, and in the afternoon, she devotes her attention to her business until 10pm. Then she rests up for her work the next day. With this loan for $700, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase 20 cases of soda, various candies, groceries, and will remodel the business. Hilda is very pleased to belong to the Manuela Ramos family, where she has met some dear friends. She has also shown herself to a punctual businesswoman with her payments for the good of her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Hilda pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Manco Cápac N° 179, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años, es madre de 3 hijos y su esposo es pintor y albañil. Hilda decide invertir en la venta de bebidas. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega, en las mañanas realiza las tareas domésticas con la ayuda de sus hijos y en las tardes se dedica a la atención de su negocio hasta las 10 p.m., luego descansa para el trajín del día siguiente. Con el préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 20 cajas de gaseosas, golosinas, abarrotes, y remodelará el negocio. Hilda se siente muy feliz de pertenecer a la familia de Manuela Ramos, ahí conoció grandes amigas y también manifiesta que es una socia puntual con sus pagos para el bien de su banco comunal.

loans.use:
Compra de gaseosas, golosinas y abarrotes
Purchase of soda, candies, and groceries.

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.es:
LIsbeth, Martha and Liz have belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for three years, one year, and four months, respectively.

Lisbeth is married, 20 years old, and is expecting her first child. She has a small hardware store in a rented shop, a task she has performed for a year now. With this loan, she will improve her business more.

Martha, on the other hand, lives with her partner, is 26 years old and has one five-year-old son. Martha sells food in a rented stand, and she only sells in the evenings.

Liz, meanwhile, lives with her partner, is 20 years old and has one two-year-old daughter. Liz sells food in the community of Huayllapampa, in the Pacaycasa district. Liz plans to expand and stock her store more.

Lisbeth, Martha, and Liz need loans for 1000 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles ($925 total) that they will invest in buying tools, tables and chairs, meats, and soft drinks.

The dreams of Lisbeth, Martha and Luz including having her own house, having a car to transport merchandise, running a grocery store, and sending their children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Lisbeth, Martha y Liz pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 3 años, 1 año, 4 meses respectivamente.

Lisbeth es casada, tiene 20 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Lisbeth tiene una pequeña ferretería en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza hace 1 año, con el préstamo que obtendrá implementará más su negocio.

Por otro lado Martha es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo de 5 años, Martha vende comida en un local alquilado, sus ventas lo realiza solo por las noches.

Mientras que Liz es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hija de 2 años, Liz vende comida en su comunidad de Huayllapampa, Distrito de Pacaycasa. Liz tiene proyectado ampliar y surtir más su negocio.

Lisbeth, Martha y Liz necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 1000 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de artículos de ferretería, mesas, sillas, carne, gaseosa.

Los sueños Lisbeth, Martha y Liz son tener casa propia, un carro para trasladar su mercadería, una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Invest in the womens' businesses, including buying tools, tables and chairs, meat, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Her whole life Julia has dedicated herself to the household chores and looking after her family’s wellbeing. Even so, at times, when they have had the opportunity, her kids have bought her merchandise to sell from home to family and friends. When her husband died she really felt the need to be able to earn some money herself, as apart from just the household costs she also has a son who has heart problems, and has been unable to get up for 4 years.

It was only 3 years ago that Julia, with the money that she had saved, decided to open a shop, and she bought a little to start off with. This is how is started, and she achieved a part of her dream of having a business. Now she wants to enlarge it and make it more productive. Happily, she has a lot of support from her eldest kids, without their help it would be very difficult for her to go on.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Translator

Durante toda su vida Julia se ha dedicado plenamente a los quehaceres del hogar y al bienestar de su familia. Aunque por temporadas, según había la oportunidad, sus hijos le compraban mercadería pequeña para que la vendiera dentro de su casa a amigos o familiares. Cuando su esposo falleció sintió más la necesidad de contar con un recurso propio, pues aparte de tener los gastos de la casa tiene a su cargo un hijo quien padece de problemas cardiacos y está en reposo desde hace cuatro años. Fue recién hace tres años que Julia, con un dinero ahorrado que tenia, se animo por abrir una tienda y compró lo poco que podía para poder empezar. Y así fue, cumplió parte de su sueño de poder tener una tienda ahora sus planes esta en ampliarla y hacerla más productiva. Felizmente recibe el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, sin la ayuda de ellos se le haría muy difícil poder continuar por su cuenta.

loans.use: To stock her small shop with more merchandise/Abastecer de más mercadería su pequeña tienda

loans.name: Nasrulloeva

texts.ru:
H. is 37 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works as a doctor in the town hospital. H. has been selling on the market Panshabe in the town of Khudjand for the past 10 years. She sells things like socks, undergarments, towels. She needs a loan to increase commodity circulation on her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хафиза женщина в возрасте 37 лет, замужем имеет 2 детей муж работает мед врачем в городской больнице. Хафиза уже 10 лет как торгует на рынке Панш анбе, гор.Худжанда.Она продает, носки, нижнее белье, полотенца.Для увеличения оборота она решила взять кредит.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru:
Even though Dilovar is only 22 years old, she has been doing business for many years. She sells all kinds of clothing: men's, women's and children's. She does not have a permanent vendor space so she travels over to surrounding regions and sells where there are markets available. She travels to the wholesale markets to buy the goods. She lives with her parents and the profits from the business no matter how small make a decent investment into the family budget. Dilovar dreams about the time when she will save enough money to open her own little shop so then she will not have to travel to the outside villages. Even it will be small, but her own store.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хотя Диловар исполнилось всего 22 года она уже много лет занимается бизнесом. Продает она все виды одежды - мужскую, женскую и детскую. Постоянного места торговли у нее нету и она ездит по окрестным районам где есть базары и торгует на них. За товаром она ездит на оптовые рынки. Живет вместе с родителями и прибыль от бизнеса приносит хоть и небольшой но все же вклад в семейный бюджет. Диловар мечтает о том времени когда она сможет накопить денег и открыть маленький магазинчик, и тогда не надо будет ездить по окрестным деревням. Это будет маленьки но все же свой магазинчик.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom Y., a 48-year-old widow with a child employed in a garment factory, is a healer in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province.  Although she and her child have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. Since her child's job is far from home, Mrs. Sarom Y. spends a lot of money on transportation, so she is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her child to travel to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to travel to work.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
29-year-old Mariam is married and has a 4-year-old child. Each day, she works at her food vending business, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil R. is a 49-year-old farmer who breeds sheep. He is married and has five children. He is a purposeful person. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them. Being in this business for 7 years, he knows very well how to choose animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up very early in the morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.

As this is the only source of funding in Fazik`s family, it is very hard to cover his family's basic needs. He needs to purchase 20 sheep to achieve a stable financial situation in his family and be able to expand his business. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD. He believes that a KIVA loan will help him and for today it is his only hope for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Walde

texts.fr: Mm D. est une femme teinturiére  .Elle exerce ce metier depuis longtemps  dans cadre de son entreprise familiale.le boubou teinté est tres demendé au sénégal surtout à l 'occasion des fetes Le pret sollicité lui permetra de renforcer ses activités de production  .
texts.en:
Mrs. D. specializes in dyeing cloth. She has been doing this work for a long time as a family business. Hand-dyed boubous (flowing robes worn by men and women) are very much in demand in Senegal, especially around the holidays. The requested loan will allow her to increase her production of hand-dyed cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Bùi 50 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997, chị sinh được 3 con, 2 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 1 con đang sống cùng chị và đang đi làm thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng, chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhập bình quân 60.000đ/ ngày. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi và trồng cây ăn quả. Hiện tai gia đình chị có hơn 300 gốc cây ăn quả bình quân môi năm thu nhập 40.000.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ mua thêm 500 con giống cây trồng và phân bón.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Bùi is 50 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 1997. She has 3 children, 2 of which are married and have their own family. The last one holds a job making 1.500.000 VND a month and still lives with her. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver, he makes 60.000 VND a day. All her loans are invested in raising animal and cultivating fruit plants. Today she and her family have more than 300 fruit plants. Their revenue from this is about 40.000.000 VND a year. This time she is seeking a loan of 10.000.000 VND to buy 500 new plants and fertilizer.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de una niña y otro bebe que viene en camino, ella vive junto a su conviviente, quien la ayuda mucho, sobre todo en su negocio. Ella se dedica a vender abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad dentro de su vivienda, lo que le gusta de su labor es vender mucho y dar un buen trato a sus  clientes. Le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y es la única persona que vende estos tipos de productos por donde vive, lo que quiere decir que le va muy bien. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar el espacio que usa para su negocio y comprar más productos para surtir mejor su bodega.
texts.en:
Rosana is 41 with one daughter and a baby on the way. She lives with her partner, who is very helpful to her, particularly in her business. She earns her living selling groceries and household staples from her home. What she likes about her work is getting a lot of sales, and treating her customers well. The business is profitable because it is located in a good area, and Rosana is the only one selling these types of products in her vicinity, so she feels things are going well for her. This will be her third loan with MFP, and she has already proven herself responsible with respect to the payments. She will use the money to expand the space for her buiness and to stock her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of space for her grocery store

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells kerosene and has been in this business for a long time. The demand for her kerosene is high. She is a LAPO client. Toyin needs the loan amount of 140, 000 NGN to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Pisal

texts.en: Mr. Pisal H. is a villager in Kampong Svay village in Kandal province. He is single, lives with his parents, and is a construction worker who contributes a small income to support his family. His neighbor has a piece of land for sale at a very good price. Mr. H. is requesting a loan so he can buy the land and re-sell it for a small profit.

loans.use: To purchase land for re-selling

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en: A very young woman best describes Jovy L., 23 years old, married, and living at Buenavista, Oroquieta City. She has two children. Her husband is a mere laborer. At a young age, Jovy already knew that life is not that easy! She tried her best to provide for the needs of her family; that’s why she engaged herself in charcoal making and selling, appearing dirty physically, but earning sufficiently. In order to have enough capital, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in October 2007 and was able to start her business. Jovy has already availed other loans several times. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy coconut shells to be processed into charcoal. In the future, she wants to buy a motorcycle to be used as transportation to go to and from the market. Jovy will be fulfilled as a parent if all her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy coconut shells for charcoal production

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng P., 39, lives in the Siem Reap province with her husband and four children. She and her husband are farmers, making US$3 a day, and are supported by her child who is a worker making US$2 a day. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Leng P. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase wood to sell. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase wood to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi L., 34, is married with two children.  She has three years of experience in the pancake and ice cake business. She sells to the villagers and general public for seven days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 125 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Naomi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase cordial, milk, sugar, flour, yeast, plastic cups and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bibiola

texts.ru: Хасанова Бибиола проживает в городе Яван. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж работает подсобным рабочим на стройке. Сама клиентка занимается шитьем. Шьет национальные покрывала и вышивает их вручную. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка, которого она сможет откормить и продать по более выгодной цене. Полученный доход сможет использовать для ремонта дома.
texts.en:
Bibiola H. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a construction worker. Bibiola is involved in sewing. She makes traditional blankets and embroiders them by hand. Bibiola wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase a bull that she can feed and sell at a more profitable price. She wants to use the profit to make repairs to her house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna S. est âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant avec un petit fils dont elle a la charge. Elle vent sur étal des légume à son domicile. Elle souhaiterait promouvoir cette activité pour mieux soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Maïmouna S., 53, is married and the mother of one child with a grandchild for whom she is responsible. She sells vegetables on a small scale out of her home. She would like to expand this business so as to help her husband better in supporting their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables and various condiments out of her home

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy sells provisions and drinks. He is 35-years old and married with three children. He is requesting a loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. Increasing his inventory will improve his income by enabling him to service more customers and build a bigger customer base. He says thank you all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in the junior high while others are in the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Joyce is a food vendor. She fries and sells yam and beans in her locality. She sells by the roadside in the afternoons. Joyce wants a loan to buy tubers of yam and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. Joyce has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Margarida Jaime

texts.pt:
Margarida Jaime A. tem 41 anos de idade, nasceu na cidade de Maputo, casada e mãe de uma filha de 12 anos de idade e freqüenta escola. 
Margarida estudou ate sete classe e interrompeu devido a problemas de saúde.
Vive na cidade da Matola com seu marido e mais uma irmã que esta sob sua responsabilidade.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo no ano de 1986 com sua família (marido, filha e sua irmã).
Começou a fazer negocio no ano de 2000, é dona do negocio e ainda não tem empregado. Vende mais iogurte que compra em quantidades maiores e tem bastante aceitação no mercado.
Rende 10.000,00MT mensalmente com os quais consegue alimentar a família e poupar algum dinheiro par os momentos de crise.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema e já teve outros num banco comercial concorrente na praça.
Margarida conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de informações obtidas com suas colegas na zona.

Com o valor de 20.000,00mt pretende reforçar o volume do negocio e responder a demanda.
Espera pagar o credito de acordo com o plano de amortização para no futuro mais breve aceder a novos empréstimos com o mesmo fim.
texts.en:
Margarida Jaime A. is 41 years old. She was born in the city of Maputo. She is married and has a 12-year-old daughter who is in school. Margarida went to school through seventh grade, and dropped out because of health problems. She lives in the city of Matola with her husband and a sister for whom she is economically responsible. She left Maputo in 1986 with her family (husband, daughter, and sister). She started her business in 2000. She owns the business but still doesn't have an employee. She sells yogurt, which she buys in large quantities, and she has made inroads in the market. She earns 10,000 meticals a month, which she uses to feed her family and save some money for emergencies. This is her first loan from Hluvuku-Adsema, and she's received other loans from a commercial bank near the plaza. Margarida heard about Hluvuku-Adsema through information provided by colleagues in the area. She will use this loan of 20,000 meticals to expand her stock and increase her sales volume, and to respond to demand. She intends to pay off the loan in keeping with the payment plan, so in the near future she can request other loans to be used for the same purpose.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El señor Marcial F. G. esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que le brindaron con el crédito anterior con el cual pudo poner una parte del techo pero le está haciendo el techo en un de los cuartos.
Solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poder terminar el cuarto y así poderlo habitar lo más pronto posible ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan su privacidad en la casa.
Don Marcial trabaja en una tortillería en el aria de producción, este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia, y con el cual una parte será para pagar esté nuevo préstamo.
 Cunado se realizo la visita a la vivienda del señor Marcial el se encontraba en su trabaja quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Carmen Hernández y uno de sus hijos quienes aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Marcial F. Garcia is very thankful for the help which they gave him with his previous loan with which he wa able to put up part of a roof, but he is making a roof on one of the rooms. He is asking for a loan again to be able to finish the room and so be able to occupy it as soon as possible now that his children are growing and need their privacy in the house. Marcial works in the production area of a tortilla factory, which is the income he has for his family, and with part of which he will pay this new loan. At the time of the visit to Marcial's home to take his picture he was at work, so his wife Carmen Hernandez and one of his children appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putting up a roof

loans.name: Siloma

texts.en:
Siloma S. is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Tafitoala. She is married with five school-aged children. Siloma owns and operates a business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Siloma has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2005, Siloma joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Siloma has successfully repaid a previous loan, to purchase fertilizers such as manure, of 1750 WST from SPBD. Siloma is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used for the same purpose. The loan will be her fifth loan from SPBD. Siloma plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane A. is a simple resident of Isidro Paredes in Diffun Quirino. She is already 28 years old and married to Warlito. They help each other in making their mushroom production business become progressive. Their harvested mushroom is being sold in the market by Mary Jane alone. According to her, the product is really in demand though it is a little bit expensive. The product is organically produced that explains why most of their customers/buyers are those in the middle class and high class families in their province. 

For her to further make the business progressive, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from Kiva lenders that will be of big help in making their business grow for the welfare of their family especially their children in the future.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: Francisco René M. M. tiene 64 años, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que es un buen cliente y también un hombre muy responsable. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que dio inicio desde muy joven ya que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios ha logrado tener lo necesario. Ahora el está solicitando un financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar los productos necesarios. Su mayor sueño es seguir con esta actividad y obtener su propio ingreso para sufragar los gastos personales y cumplir con su responsabilidad.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años, es un hombre trabajador y entusiasta, pues siempre ánima a su familia a perseverar para lograr sus metas. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. La actividad que realiza es la carpintería, negocio que lo acompaña desde hace 10 años. En sus inicios tuvo muchos problemas para instalar su taller y tuvo que trabajar en diversas empresas para conseguir el dinero suficiente para comprar su maquinaria, con el tiempo logró instalar su taller dentro de su casa y ahora es el carpintero más reconocido de su localidad, pues los trabajos que realiza tienen un acabado de calidad. Lo que más le agrada a Juan de su trabajo es barnizar los muebles, pues así obtienen una belleza especial; por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil de su labor es realizar los muebles grandes para salas, pues beben tener acabados perfectos, pero también son muy rentables porque el costo de producción se incrementa por el tiempo invertido. Para futuro, Juan desea ampliar su taller y adquirir nueva maquinaria que le permita agilizar su trabajo.
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y tiene todo el ánimo de trabajar responsablemente con cumpliendo de sus cuotas de pago. Con los mil seiscientos soles que viene solicitando comprará algunas herramientas para trabajar con madera con mayor exactitud.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old. He is an enthusiastic and industrious man, and therefore always encouraging his family to preserve to achieve their goals. He lives in his own house with his wife and his three small children. He has worked as a carpenter for ten years. In the beginning he had many problems installing his workshop and had to work in diverse business to obtain sufficient money to buy his machinery. With time he managed to install a workshop inside their house and is now the most recognized carpenter in the region, because his works are of the highest quality. What pleases Juan most about his work is varnishing the furniture, which causes the furniture to obtain a special beauty. On the other hand, he considers the most difficult part of his work making large furniture for rooms because they have to be finished perfectly, however large furniture is also very profitable because the cost of production is increased for the time invested. In the future, Juan desires to expand its workshop and to acquire new machinery that will permit him to expedite his work. This is his first credit with Microfinanzas PRISM, an affiliate of Kiva, and he intends to work responsibly and comply with his payments. With the 1600 soles that he is requesting, he will buy tools to work with wood with greater accuracy.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy woodworking tools

loans.name: Top

texts.en: Top V., 52, is a widow with one of her children and resides in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling boil beans at the local market and is able to make US$2 of profit every day. She is also aided by her daughter who works as garment factory worker, earning US$2 per day. Top V. would like to take out a loan of US$300 so that she can sell huge amount when the ceremony take place in her village.

loans.use: To purchase more beans to sell.

loans.name: Deselyn

texts.en:
Deselyn R. is from the village of Zamora. She is 40 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a hog raising business. Deselyn has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Deselyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Deselyn is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
--------------------
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.\n\n*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora  ROSMERY tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia tiene estudios hasta 4º de secundaria, no logró culminar sus estudios porque salió embarazada, actualmente tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 3 años, los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Rosmery se dedica a la venta de ropa en los alrededores de su casa y en los mercados mas cercanos del distrito. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró ropa de la ciudad de Lima, como: pantalones de hombre, casacas para el invierno, faldas y chompas para mujeres.  
Con este crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles comprará ropa en la ciudad de Tacna, en donde es más económico ya que es ropa de la frontera, lo cual le permite tener más ganancias. 
Rosmery sueña con tener su propia tienda abastecida con ropa para toda ocasión, para todos los gustos para hombres y mujeres, adultos y niños.
texts.en:
ROSMERY, 31, lives in the FLORENCIA DE MORA district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She finished tenth grade but was unable to graduate because she became pregnant. She currently has two children, 12 and 3 years old, who depend upon her financially. Rosmery sells clothing in her neighborhood and in the nearest district markets. With her first 300 sol loan she bought clothing in the city of Lima like: men's pants, Winter coats, skirts and women's sweaters. With this 600 new sol loan she will buy clothes in the city of Tacna where it is less expensive because it is a border city which will allow for higher profits. Rosmery dreams with having her own store well-stocked with clothes for all occasions for men, women, adults, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol T., 29, lives with her husband and their only child in Parola, Tondo, Manila – a shanty town at the edge of Manila Bay.  

Carol has been in business since she was a child.  Now, her sari-sari (general) store is very successful.  She hires an assistant to look after her business.  She earns more than P22,000 in monthly profits.  She saves much of her earnings in preparation for her child’s education.  She is also providing maintenance medications for her sick father.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the summer of 2007.  She has been enjoying the camaraderie of her fellowship group since then.  She is now on her sixth loan cycle.  She has just finished repaying her loan of P15,000 and she has applied for a new loan of P17,000.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

Carol aspires to see her store grow big so she can help employ more people in her community.

 

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice P. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials to make more alcohol to sell.  Joice is 29 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has two children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en: Ludivina G. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 60 years old, is widowed, and has three adult children. Ludivina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Ludivina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor R. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old and is single. Miraflor owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks like "puto" rice cakes, hot cake and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Miraflor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Miraflor is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Afonso

texts.es: Alfonso F. J. de 57 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Paz. Vive únicamente junto a su esposa, quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Alfonso es un señor muy humilde, quien trabaja a diario por brindarle a su esposa una vida digna, suplida de todas las necesidades básicas. Él brinda sus servicios de transporte públicos, ya que posee un pick up, en el cual se encarga de hacer viajes por las diferentes ciudades y pueblos de La Paz. De esta manera el trasporta personas de un lugar a otro, transporta frutas, verduras, muebles y todo lo que sus clientes le pidan. De esta manera el se ha ganado la vida durante mucho años, lo que le permite ser muy conocido en el lugar y contar con la confianza de las personas, ya que lo reconocen como a un hombre muy trabajador quien siempre está dispuesto a dar más para su trabajo con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias. Alfonso solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar algunos repuestos para su automóvil, ya que para él es de mucha importancia mantener lo mejor posible el estado de su pick up, ya que es este el que le permite contar con un trabajo.
texts.en:
Alfonso F. J., 57, lives in the La Paz department. He lives alone with his wife, who devotes herself to taking care of the house. Alfonso is a very humble man who works everyday to give his wife a decent life with the basic necessities. He has a pick up, which he uses to offer public transportation services. He makes trips to the different cities and towns of La Paz. He takes people from one place to another and transports fruits, vegetables, furniture, and everything his customers request. He has earned a living this way for many years. It has allowed him to become very well known in the area, and people trust him. They consider him to be a very hard-working man who is always prepared to put more into his work in order to earn more. Alfonso is asking for a loan to be able to buy some replacement parts for his automobile. It is very important to him to maintain his pick up in the best possible shape. His pick up is what allows him to have work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for his automobile

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena L. is from the village of Letican in Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Azucena is single. To make a living, Azucena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Azucena has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Azucena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Azucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Azucena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Azucena's 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zanfina, un des villages de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe qui se sont connus à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté  font essentiellement l’achat et la vente de produits alimentaires  tels  les grains de céréales  et  les condiments alimentaires.
Ces femmes du groupe Sabougnouma  sont à leur  premier  prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une grande quantité de grains de céréales sèches ( petit mil, maïs) et un important stock de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement auprès des producteurs et grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Fana, à domicile,  généralement au comptant, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 9.000FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouma are all married. They average 38 years of age and four children each, and they live in traditional extended families in Zanfina, a village of Fana, prefecture of Dioila, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women of the group know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they essentially buy and sell food items, such as grains and condiments. The women of the group are now on their first solidarity loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They intend to use this loan to buy a large quantity of dried grains (pearl millet, corn) and a major stock of condiments. Supplies are gotten essentially from producers and wholesalers. Sales are made at the Fana market and at home. Generally cash is accepted from customers composed of women and men. The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 9,000 francs CFA that will be used to provide for the family. The rest will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food items

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a business man. He has a motorcycle that he uses to convey his passengers from one location of his city to another. He has been in this business for three years. He is doing well in his business and family. As a hard working man, he also sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices. He hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell.  He is married with children and he hopes to lift his family and business above poverty. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Crisilda

texts.en:
Crisilda C. is from the village of Bulwa, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Crisilda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconut fruits for sale. Crisilda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Crisilda joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Install security bars

loans.name: Margaret Wambui

texts.en:
Margaret Wambui K. is 38 years old. She is married to Ben and she is the mother of two young children. 

Margaret has a vegetables business that she has been running for the last three years on a busy street in Narok Town.

Margaret learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her fourth loan. She is planning to increase her supplies with the loan. With the profits that she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to open another shop and create employment for other people.

Margaret’s future dream is that she will be able to build her store and her own house. She believes she is hardworking and that she can attain her goal by having access to credit.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the town of Fugu Jones. She is 47 years old. Marilou is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 14000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Rafael Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo de 31 años de edad forma parte del banco comunal Los Tamarindos en la capital manabita Portoviejo, el señor Arturo esta recién casado y se dedica al comercio de ropa,realiza este trabajo desde hace 4 años en la ciudad de Portoviejo; hace 2 ciclos forma parte del banco comunal, le va muy bien con los créditos y el negocio lo ha sabido administrar muy bien,  cada mes viaja  la ciudad de Guayaquil a realizar las compras de la ropa. Por las noches es profesor de un colegio en el cantón  Rocafuerte motivo por la cual se ha tenido que ir a radicar en ese lugar de donde es su esposa, la cual también es maestra.

El señor Arturo con el crédito que va a recibir de la Fundación podrá surtir su negocio; durante estos años de trabajo todo ha marchado muy bien, tiene clientes fijos con los cuales trabaja a crédito dejándoles en dos y tres pagos dependiendo del monto que compren. Con los dos trabajos nuestro socio ha podido solventar los gastos en el hogar, el sueño de Arturo es tener un almacén propio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Arturo, who is 31 years old, is part of the Los Tamarindos communal bank based in the Manabi province capital of Portoviejo. Arturo recently got married and works as a clothing merchant in Portoviejo. He has been in this line of business for 4 years and has been a member of the communal bank for the last 2 seasons. He is doing really well thanks to the loans and his capable management of the business. Every month he travels to Guayaquil to buy clothes. In the evening he teaches at a school in the Rocafuerte region. Because of his job he has relocated to this area where his wife, who is also a teacher, is originally from. With the loan from Fundación Arturo will be able to stock up his business. Over the last few years his work has been going well. He has regular customers to whom he sells on credit, allowing them to pay him back in two or three instalments, depending on the amount purchased. With both jobs he has managed to cover household expenses. Arturo's dream is to have his own, well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses, t-shirts, trousers and children's clothing.

loans.name: Gbotima Group

texts.en: Meet the members of the Gbotima Group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 500,000 leones each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Hawanatu S. K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with two children who are attending primary school. Hawanatu was born in Bo, a city in Southern Sierra Leone. Hawanatu sells fried food: fried fish, potatoes, cassavas roots, etc. She has been in this business for five years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy oil, fish, tomatoes, cassavas roots, etc., to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy oil, fish, tomatoes, cassavas, etc., to add to her business

loans.name: Fanny Vladys

texts.es:
Fanny de 45 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella vende productos químicos, como shampoo, desinfectante, etc. 

Cuando se separo de su esposo ella decidió continuar con el negocio de químicos que los dos habían empezado, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Ella hace shampoo, desinfectante, aromatizante, y los llena en envases plásticos. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mas químicos para hacer sus productos, en el futuro quiere tener su propia distribuidora de químicos y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Fanny is 45 years old and lives along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil (a periurban area that is surrounded by a salt marsh). She sells chemical household products such as shampoos, disinfectants, etc.

When she separated from her husband, she decided to continue the household chemical business that the two of them started. She now works every day from 8am to 9pm. Fanny makes shampoos, disinfectants, and air fresheners and sells them in plastic containers.

With this loan, she wants to buy more chemicals for making her products. In the future, she wants to open her own distribution center and finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household chemicals

loans.name: Simon Mpayiani

texts.en:
Simon Mpayiani T. is a 28-year-old single man.  He is a farmer, and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last seven years. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

This will be Simon’s first loan with KADET.  He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member. Simon is planning to spend ten thousand on ploughing, ten thousand on harrowing, five thousand on seeds, and five thousand on planting five acres of wheat. His dream is do large-scale farming, buy a bigger piece of land and attain financial independence. He hopes to use the profits generated from this loan to take the first step toward achieving this dream by expanding his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

loans.use: to plough and harrow his soil, and to buy and plant seeds

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos 4 Group

texts.en:
Jisela is the coordinator of her group, Unidas Venceremos 4 (United we'll win). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and 3 children. She plans to continue to enjoy sourcing stock to make business sales.

Jisela is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 8 months. She started it when she realized the need to have more income. She started selling underwear, which improved after her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different clothing. She will use the profits to expand her business by adding more products.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she really want to do business and she found in Esperanza the help to. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities include a free trading zone and a cement factory.
