This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Marjolyn

texts.en:
Marjolyn B. is married to Leonardo B., who is a 24-year-old farmer. They have no children. The couple lives in Hacienda Bino in Barangay 1, a part of Kabankalan City in the Negros Occidental province of the Visayas islands. Marjolyn runs two businesses: fattening pigs and selling food.

Marjolyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her and her husband. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marjolyn has been incrementally lifting them out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 6000 PHP, uplifting their standard of living.

This time, for her sixth loan cycle, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase feed and vitamins for the pigs that she is raising. Marjolyn aspires to save up for the future security of Leonardo and herself and so that she will be able to expand her business. Marjolyn B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maura Katalina

texts.es: La señora Maura Katalina C. O., tiene la edad de 58 años es casada, y su esposo es agricultor, son una familia de 5 hijos mayores de edad, casados y habitan en sus casas particulares con sus familias, y apoyan económicamente a sus padres, ella es agricultora con más de 16 años de experiencia, fue con el apoyo económico de su pareja que logro adquirir un terreno para comenzar a sembrar hortalizas, con el tiempo se han enfrentado a diferentes enfermedades y plagas que disminuyen la productividad de las cosechas, que afectan a  la economía del hogar, es por eta razón que solicita un préstamo ara la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, abono e insumos vegetativos que brinden un optimo mantenimiento a sus tierras, un aumento en las ventas y la mejora continua de sus niveles de vida, la tranquilidad a sus hijos que sus padres evolucionan en sus negocios y la posibilidad de incursionar en nuevos mercados.
texts.en: Maura Katalina C. O. is 58 years old and married.  Her husband is a farmer and they have five children who are older, married, and have houses with their families.  Their children financially support them.  She has been a farmer and has more than 16 years of experience.  It was with the financial support of her husband that she was able to acquire a piece of land to begin planting vegetables.  Over time, she has faced different diseases and pests that diminish the productivity of the crops and affect her household economy.  This is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, fungicides, manure and other products to provide her lands with good maintenance.  This will increase her sales and continuously improve their qualities of life, providing their children with tranquility that their parents are progressing in their businesses and the possibility that they can enter new markets.

loans.use: To provide maintenance to her farming lands.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are house rent and school fees.

He has been operating his laundry business from home for the last 11 years. Previously he was employed at an oil company. He hopes to open a boutique to sell clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase a washing machine. Alex decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Brenda Rocio

texts.es: La sra. Brenda Rocio utilisara su credito en la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes ya que ella es madre soltera y sus hijos estan pequeños por lo cual ella no desea separarse de ellos y ve en la apertura de la tienda la solucion ya que estaria en su casa y al pendiente de sus hijos y a la  vez generaria un ingreso mas ya que ella vende platillos los fines de semana y los prepara en su domicilio y ella es muy conocida  y apreciada en su colonia y por la ubicación de su casa ella piensa que es lo que en su sector se necesita ya que las tiendas estan muy retiradas de donde ella vive por  lo tanto cree que es la mejor opcion.
texts.en: Ms. Brenda Rocio would use the loan to open a grocery store. Since she is a single mother with young children, she does not want work to separate her from them.  The grocery store would be the solution, as it would allow her to be home to watch her children and earn an income in addition to the meals she sells on the weekends.  She also prepares meals for home delivery and is well known and appreciated in her neighborhood.  Due to the location of her home, she thinks an in-home store would be needed as the other stores are too far removed from where she lives, therefore her store would be the best option.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock a store

loans.name: Guisella Ines

texts.es: La señora A. B. Guisella Ines, tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa de familiar, con direccion Av. Moscu 660 La Tinguiña, casa de material noble de una planta. Se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora hace mas de un año..El señora tiene metas  trazadas y obejetivos, en futuro quiere tener su propio puesto comercial, con el credito piensa invertir en el negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. A. B. Guisella Ines, is 41 years old, and lives with her 3 children. She lives in a family home, at the address: Avenue Moscu 660 in La Tinguiña. Her house is made of noble plant materials. For more than one year, she's been selling a line of clothing. She has long- and short-term goals. In the future she wants to have her own business stand, and with the loan she plans to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her clothing business

loans.name: Maria Piedad

texts.es:
María de 48 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Donde ella vivía no había una tienda o lugar donde comprar víveres fue por ello que sus amigas le insistieron para que la tenga y así mantendría a su hijo. En la actualidad tiene su tienda de víveres y trabaja sola desde las 07h45am hasta las 18h00pm vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. 

Su casa aun no está bien construida por eso ella quiere comprar cemento y bloques para mejorarla y también mejorar su tienda ya que queda en la parte delantera de su casa. 
Sus aspiraciones para el futuro es tener una papelería y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
María, 48 years of age, has a grocery store in the back portion of her house.  She lives in a peri-urban area that has all of the basic services.  The area is located on the perimeter of Guayaquil, in a zone surrounded by an estuary.

Where she lived there were no stores or places to buy groceries, which is why her friends insisted that she open one that would also help her support her son.  Currently, she runs the store and works alone from 7:45 am to 6 pm, selling rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, etc.

Her house is still not well constructed, which is why she would like to buy cement and cinderblocks to improve it and her store, which is in the rear portion of the house.  Her goals for the future are to have a bookstore and to finish building her house.

loans.use: To purchase cement, cinderblocks.

loans.name: Kov

texts.en: Kov C., 52 years old, owns a small shop located beside a road where she sells soft drinks and palm juice produced by her husband, who is very skilled at climbing the palm trees located right behind their house. On a typical day, she earns about $1.50 in profit. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are married. She is doing well because she provides good customer service, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers and to buy a ladder for her husband because this will make it much easier for him to climb palm trees.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell to her customers, and a ladder for her husband to use when climbing palm trees.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años, de estado civil casada tiene 06 hijos  independientes, realizo estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja hace  más de 01 años con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 dinero, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados como ovejas y vacas.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando un toro.  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo.

Sueña tener más capital para terminar de arreglar su casa y mejorar su condición de vida.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y estar alegres con las socias.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Huancheñas” in the District and Province of Huancané, Department of Puno. She is 60 years old, married, and has six children who are independent. Yolanda has an elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for more than a year. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and was invested in her business of buying and selling livestock, such as sheep and cows.

Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of a bull. She and her husband work together. Her dream is to have more capital so that she can finish repairing her home and improve her living conditions. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and being happy with the other members.

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Tuzamurane Shyara Group

texts.fr: Marie Claudine M. est commerçante, et elle est un membre du groupe Tuzamurane Shyara.  Elle est née à Ruhuha, Rwanda, elle a 36 ans, mariée, et elle a 4 enfants entre 2 ans et 15 ans.  Elle a fini deux ans d’école secondaire, et 2 de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Elle est client d’ACB depuis 2010, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des haricots, sorghos, riz, et arachide.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer ses activités actuelle de commerce.  Elle voulait construire une maison, et payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Marie Claudine M., an entrepreneur, is a member of the Tuzamurane Shyara group. She was born in Ruhuha, Rwanda. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children from 2 to 15 years of age. She finished two classes of secondary school, and two of her children go to school. She has been a client of ACB since 2010. She will use her loan to purchase beans, sorghum, rice, and peanuts. Her business strategy is to improve her sales. She would like to build a house and pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: Purchasing  beans, sorghum, rice, and peanuts

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena E., 53, is married to a farmer. She owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector planting and harvesting rice and vegetables. In addition, to support her family needs, she runs a sari-sari store and also sells "ukay-ukay" (used clothes). Elena works hard to support the studies of her three beautiful daughters. 

Elena is in need of additional fertilizer and capital for her store. She applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP from Kiva partner CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest and store.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Peter Kuria

texts.en:
Peter has been in the pool/snooker business for the last three  years.  He is 47 years old, married to Leah Wanjiru, and they have five children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this  loan amount to open a retail shop which his wife will run.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow both businesses to increase his income.

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

La señora Violeta es socia fundadora del Banco comunal es la presidenta del banco y le gusta porque los socios de su banco son muy cumplidos y por la seriedad de la institución. Tiene 50 años de edad, hace algún tiempo atrás su esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene  cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una linda chiquilla de 16 años la cual estudia en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven con ella.

Se dedica al comercio vende aliños y especias, además también vende sobrecamas, carteras, ropa entre otras cosas, tiene un pequeño local en el cual vende un solo dia a la semana ya que los otros días se desplaza a otras ciudades a las diferentes ferias que hay en esos pueblos todas las semanas, los productos los compran en Santo Domingo, se dedica hace varios años a lo que es venta de sabanas y carteras pero lleva dos años con el negocio de los aliños.

Este crédito es para comprar aliños, carteras, sabanas entre otras cosas. Su sueño es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic most of whose residents raise animals and farm because it’s an area with much vegetation.

Violeta is a founding member of the bank and its President.  She likes it because the members of her bank meet their obligations and because of the formality of the institution.  She is 50 years old and has been a widow for quite some time; she has four children, three whom are adults and a lovely, young, 16 year old daughter who is in high school.  Three of the children still live with her.

She is a merchant selling seasonings and spices.  She also sells bedspreads, purses and clothing, among other things.  She has a small locale where she sells just one day a week because the other days she goes to markets in other cities that occur every week.  She buys her merchandise in Santo Domingo.  She has been selling the sheets and purses for several years now but she’s only been selling the seasonings for two years.

This loan is to buy seasonings, purses and sheets, among other things.  Her dream is that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: To buy seasonings, purses, sheets, bedspreads, etc.

loans.name: Maame Afia

texts.en:
Maame Afia G.' work days take place at the market in Jukwa near Abura which is close to Cape Coast. After getting there in the morning, she arranges her goods like rice, canned tomatoes, fried fish or groundnuts and starts selling. Maame Afia went through junior high school and has been a market woman for the past seven years. She is married to a teacher and has two children with him. 

With the money she makes she assists her husband in the payment of schooling materials for their children and utility bills. Her dream for her children is a high school education. In order to make sure this is going to happen, she wants to use the money from the loan to grow her business and increase her profit. To achieve this goal she will buy more goods and offer her customers a greater variety.

loans.use: to buy more goods and offer her customers a greater variety.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm N., 57, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a housewife and her husband is a teacher, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Each month, the family spends USD 30 on food and USD 40 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of USD 250 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair the house

loans.name: Teresa Ermelinda

texts.es: Teresa Ermelinda G. M. D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida en Ilopango departamento D. San Salvador. Ella tiene una venta D. productos D. uso personal y belleza, es con esto que ella sostiene su familia. Teresa es una excelente vendedora y es muy servicial, la gente prefiere sus productos porque son D. muy buena calidad y a un buen precio. La demanda D.  parte D. sus clientes ha aumentado últimamente y esto la motivo a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, cosméticos entre otros. Teresa como toda mujer dedicada está dispuesta a sacar adelante su negocio para que en un futuro este le ayuD. a darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa Ermelinda G. M. is 43 years old.  She lives with her life partner in Ilopango, in San Salvador department.  Teresa sells personal care products and beauty products in order to support her family.  Teresa is an excellent saleswoman and is very helpful.  People like to buy her products because they are good quality and a good price.

Teresa's customer demand has increased recently and so she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow her to buy more creams, perfumes, deodorants, cosmetics and other products.  Teresa, in common with all dedicated women, is keen to get ahead in her business so that, in the future, it will help her to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, deodorants and cosmetics

loans.name: Umiyavi

texts.ru: Хасанова Умияви проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 51 год. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Её дети и муж находятся в Москве. Она два года как занимается торговлей. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Ее бизнес приносит доход. На сегодняшний день в свободное время она хочет заняться животноводством. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en: Umiyavi H. lives in J.Rumy. She is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Her children and husband are in Moscow. She has been working in trade for two years. She has a shop that sells a variety of goods.  Her business brings in her income. In her leisure time, she would like to work in animal husbandry.  So, she is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jelyn works hard to support her family.

She runs a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling livestocks.  Jelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell in her used clothing business.

Jelyn has sustained her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase of additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María,vive con su esposo y un hijo D. 21 años D. edad, Doña María tiene un molino D. nixtamal, desD. hace 6 años con un horario D. 5:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para darle mantenimiento al molino y otra parte para materiales para hacer pan, este préstamo le ayudara a tener en buenas condiciones el molino para continuar brindando el servicio a los clientes.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte, cancelar este préstamo D. una forma ordenada y estar junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and a 21 year-old son.  She owns a mill which is used for grinding cooked corn.  She has owned this business for six years and works from 5.00am to 4.00pm.

María is currently requesting a loan to have maintenance work done on her mill and also to buy materials for making bread.  This loan will help her to keep her mill in good condition and continue providing a good service to her customers.

María's goal is to work hard, repay this loan correctly and spend time with her family.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on her mill and to buy flour, sugar, yeast and eggs

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela is 63 years old and lives in Brgy. 3, Tabgub City in the Philippines. She is married. To earn a living, Miguela has a business selling "puso," rice stuffed in a heart-shaped coconut leaf and cooked. She earns about Php 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 9,000 to use to purchase rice and coconut leaves. She has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Miguela would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase rice and coconut leaves.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 43 years old and married with three children between the ages of 15 and 20. She runs a boutique in Tengbeh Town, just outside of Freetown. Salamatu has been in this business for five years and sells shoes, bags, clothes, and hair products at her store. Her business helps increase her savings and improve the family income. Salamatu says that her main business challenge is inflation. 

Salamatu is requesting a loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more boutique items. She says that the extra income from her loan will help her educate her children. In the future, Salamatu would like to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boutique items, such as shoes, bags, and dresses

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is  35 years of age, married with 6 school age children. Teresita is a farmer working in the Philippines who grows root crops. She has been doing it for almost 10 years.and earns PHP 3,000 per month. 

Teresita is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In the future, Teresita hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to have a higher income to finance the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and married, with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jocelyn has operated a variety store in the Philippines for 10 years. She also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has already borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF. Jocelyn hopes to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary  vive en el municipio de Soledad y en su condición de viuda tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 21 a 25 años. Ella se dedica a la producción de uniformes de oficina y especiales anti fluidos que son utilizados en clínicas y hospitales lo cual funciona con contactos de su hijo que es médico, y su hija quien es auxiliar de vuelo. Mary para iniciar su negocio contó con mucha experiencia en el sector de las confecciones, ya que trabajó durante un tiempo con importantes diseñadoras de la ciudad.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domino, con el comprará una maquina fileteadora. Realizar adecuaciones locativas a su negocio y comprar telas, hilos botones y correderas, para aumentar la calidad de sus productos y el volumen de producción.
El negocio de Mary muestra sus los estados financieros  con buenas condiciones para la inversión, ya que el volumen de ventas es compensado por calidad y precio;  además de manejar cuentas por cobrar de sus clientes que ya son fijos, y de las confecciones sobre medida que le solicitan clientes en su propio barrio. Los indicadores financieros, muestran una estabilidad en el negocio, y condiciones favorables para la inversión. Su sueño es lograr el pleno crecimiento de su negocio, lo mismo que una sostenibilidad futura que responda totalmente al aumento de su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Mary lives in the town of Soledad.  She is a widow and has three children aged 21 to 25.  Mary makes work uniforms and especially medical uniforms which are used in clinics and hospitals.  She works with contacts from her son, who is a doctor, and her daughter, who is a flight attendent.  Mary already had a lot of experience in the dressmaking field when she set up her business as she worked for some time with important designers in the city.  This Kiva loan is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy an overlock sewing machine, to carry out some structural work and to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and zippers, to increase the quality of her products and her production volume.

Mary's business shows good financial conditions for this investment since her sales volume is offset by her quality and price.  She also manages accounts receivable from regular customers as well as from the custom-made pieces that customers in her own neighborhood request.  Her financial indicators show a stability in her business and favorable conditions for investment.  Her dream is to manage to fully grow her business and have a future sustainability that reflects an increase in her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, to carry out some structural work and to buy fabric, threads, buttons and zippers

loans.name: Kobenkoun I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe KOBENKOUN I sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont essentiellement le riz, le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, NIEDIE , la première assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F CFA environs  en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the KOBENKOUN I group are married women who have an average age of 39 and on average five children. They mostly live in traditional families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are essentially rice, millet, and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, NIEDIE, seated, first on the right, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice. 

The crops are sold at the village market, the Banco market and the N’Golobougou market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Niedie expects to make an average profit of 60,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Kapaito

texts.en:
Kapaito is 33 years old and married to Lilian. They are blessed with one child who is nine months old. He has been selling milk for the last thirteen years. He has been loaned KES 30,000, which he plans to use to buy more goats,

With the anticipated profit, he plans to start a dairy in Kitengela. In the near future, he hopes to become a milk supplier to Kenya Creameries Company to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.ru:
Кодирчон добрый, умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Более 6 лет Кодирчон занимается выращиванием и продажа сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает картошку, лук и морковь. Его любящая жена и брат помогает ему в данном бизнесе. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством.  Кодирчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальный прибыль с целью улучшения его жилищное условия. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5800 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений, семена, горюче смазочные материалы и скота.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Kodirjon is a kind, smart and goal-oriented person. He is married and the loving father of two. For over six years, Kodirjon has been growing agricultural produce for resale. He grows potatoes, onions and carrots. His loving wife and his brother help him in the business. In addition, he raises farm animals. Kodirjon would like to expand his business and maximize his profit in order to improve his living conditions. He is requesting a loan of 5800 TJS in order to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, machine oil and farm animals. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel, machine oil and farm animals

loans.name: Kandelesia Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Esther and the Kendelesia group in Chwele!  Esther is the Kendelesia group facilitator.  She and her group have just finished harvesting the maize from the recent season, and are in preparations for the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Esther and her co-group members rely on maize as their main staple crop and a key source of income throughout the year. 

Esther takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to help her educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had a good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Esther was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 acre of land.  As she has more than doubled her harvest through the One Acre Fund program, Esther has been able to improve her family's financial stability.

With income from the maize sales, Esther will educate her children and invest in her business.

In 2012, the members of Kendelesia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 33 years old and has five children who are between 4 and 12 years old. They are all in school. She works with her husband selling foodstuffs in the market. They have been doing this for five years, which has enabled them to build a house and send their children to school. They would like a loan to buy more foodstuffs in order to make more profits. They will use these profits to buy another house to rent out as supplemental income.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Realyn

texts.en:
Realyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Realyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
 
Realyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Realyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Hugo Dario

texts.es:
Don Hugo tiene 43 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace más de 15 años, empezó vendiendo primeramente las orquídeas con su mamá, mientras que su señora administraba una pequeña despensa en su casa,  y con el pequeño ahorro que pudo juntar de sus ganancias y hacerse de capital propio, empezó a comprar las orquídeas y formar su propia clientela que hoy por hoy se encuentra centralizada en Argentina.
 El Sr. Hugo comenta que sus ingresos son muy buenos y sus ventas aumentaron ya que cumple con la exigencia que su clientela requiere. El solicita el crédito para la compra de flores (orquideas) para poder seguir con su negocio. Don Hugo agradece a fundación paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo constante que les brinda para fortalecer su microempresa y a la vez espera recibir siempre tan valioso apoyo.
texts.en:
Hugo, 43, is married and has two children.  He has been a businessman for more than 15 years.  He first began selling orchids with his mother, while his wife ran a little store in their home.  With the little savings he managed to get together from their profits and turn into his own capital, he began to buy orchids and get his own clientele, which at the moment is centralized in Argentina.

Hugo comments that his income is very good and his sales increased, since he satisfies his customers' demands.

He is requesting the loan to buy flowers (orchids) to be able to continue with his business.

Hugo is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their constant support to strengthen his micro-business.  At the same time, he hopes to always receive such valued support.

loans.use: to buy orchids for later sale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 39 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She is residing in Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. 

Myrna is engaged in the agricultural business sector. Her primary activity is planting and harvesting flowers for sale. She sells her flowers to her contract buyers in the market. She has been in this business for four years. She earns Php 2,600 every month. Myrna is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase manure for her flower farm.

In 2011, Myrna join GDMPC. Myrna's future plan is to expand her business. She plans to purchase a vehicle for the delivery of her flowers to the buyers.

loans.use: to purchase manure

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Silverio, con quien se caso desde hace 14 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, de los cuales murieron 2 por lo que cuida de 6 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Aymará.  Ella se siente orgullosa, pues tiene el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes después del colegio. Dedican su tiempo libre a las labores del campo. “con su apoyo, puedo avanzar y obtener mejores ganancias”, comenta muy alegre. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, olluco, avena y oca. Según cuenta ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en la agricultura lo que obtuvo hasta el momento gracias a su esfuerzo es su pequeña casa, que desea mejorarla. Además de acondicionar un establo para sus animales. Cuenta que posee 40 ovejas, cerdos y burros; los cuales cuida y engorda para después vender a los carniceros que visitan su casa. Le va muy bien en sus actividades, por ello agradece a Dios por la familia que le brindó. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “romero” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Lucia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus próximos sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Lucia, 48, is a simple woman who has lived with her husband, Silverio, for the past 14 years in their own house in the village of Aymará.  They had 8 children, but 2 died and that left them with 6 to care for.  She feels proud to have help from her children after they come home from school.  They spend their free time on farm work: “with their help, I can advance and get better money”, she comments happily.  

Her main crops are potatoes, olluco (a Peruvian tuber), wheat and oca (another type of indigeneous tuber). She tells us that she  has 5 years experience in agriculture and thanks to her effort, it has provided her with a small house that she wishes to improve, and also to set up  a stable for the animals.

She says that she has 40 sheep, pigs and burros.  She cares for and fattens them to later sell them to the butcher that come to her house.  The work is going well and she thanks God for the family that he gave her.  She belongs to the group “Romero” and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is hoping that with their help, she can go ahead with her plans.  She promises to make all the payments on time.  She also is glad to be part of the association because all of the members are responsible and united.  Lucia will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizer to spread among her next potato crop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria tiene 44 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.

Ella tiene 9 años D. dedicarse a la venta D. ropa en un mercado cercano a su vivienda, antes Candelaria se dedicaba a realizar las actividades en su hogar, pero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, ella tomo la decisión D. trabajar en otra cosa, y una amiga le dio la oportunidad D. vender con ella en su puesto. Con el tiempo ella fue instalando su propio negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa, para toda la familia.

Candelaria tiene que viajar, una vez por semana a la capital del país, para comprar la mercadería a precio más barato. El préstamo que esta solicitando será invertido en la compra D. mayor variedad D. prendas D. vestir, para toda la familia. Con esto ella dispondrá D. diferentes prendas D. vestir, lo que le ayudara a tener más clientes y a incrementar sus ventas y esto le generara mejores ingresos para su familia. Candelaria desea tener un lugar más amplio donD. vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 44 years old, married, and has two children.

She has been selling clothing in a market near her house for nine years now.  Before that, Candelaria was a housewife, but she decided to do a different kind of work to help her husband with their expenses and a friend offered her the opportunity to sell with her in her stall.  In time she set up her own business buying and selling clothes for the whole family.

Candelaria has to travel to the country's capital once a week to buy merchandise at a lower price.  She will use the loan she is asking for to buy a greater variety of clothes for the whole family.  This will put different clothing items at her disposal, which will help her get more customers and increase her sales, which will generate more income for her family.  Candelaria wants to have a bigger space in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make fried snacks

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a resident and a farmer in her home area of Kitale where she lives with her family of two children, ages one and four. She has been in farming for four years and currently produces maize and vegetables, which she sells to the local market. Farming is her sole source of income for her family's upkeep.

Emily has made a loan request of 50,000 KES and she states that she will use the loan to establish a new poultry business by buying poultry birds. She adds that she will be running a mixed farming business, but wants to focus more on poultry due to the high turnover and ready market for the products.

She is, however, worried about the high costs of transport and and low returns for the produce.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
Avelina nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (El distrito peruano de Huayllabamba es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú). 

Avelina tiene 41 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella tiene tres actividades económicas principales que realiza durante todo año y estos son: ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, agricultura y ganadería. Ella durante los meses de abril hasta octubre se dedica cultivar y sembrar maíz, zapallos, zanahorias, tomates y otras verduras pero durante los meses de octubre a marzo se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras y a la venta de choclo. Ella lleva sus choclos a vender a la ciudades de Juliaca y Arequipa y los distribuye a los diferentes mercados mayoristas de esas ciudades. En esta oportunidad Avelina requiere el préstamo para comprar más choclos, pasto y zapallos. Su sueño de Avelina es comprar un camión para poder transportar sus productos pues actualmente lo que hacer es alquilar un camión para llevar sus productos.    

Avelina es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en la ciudad de Yucay. El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Avelina was born in the city of Huayllabamba and lives in the same city where she was born. (The Peruvian district of Huayllabamba is one of the seven districts of the Urubamba Province, located in the Department of Cusco, which belongs to the Cusco Region in Peru.)

Avelina is 41 years old and is in a commonwealth marriage from which she has three children. She has three main economic jobs that she does during the year, and they are: selling fermented beverages, agriculture, and stockbreeding.  From April to October she cultivates and plants corn, pumpkins, carrots, tomatoes, and other vegetables, but from October to March she makes a living selling vegetables and selling corn. 

She brings corn cobs to sell to the cities of Juliaca and Arequipa and distributes them to different wholesale markets in these cities. At this time, Avelina needs a loan so that she can buy more corn, fodder, and pumpkins. Avelina's dream is to buy a truck so that she can transport her products, since right now what she does is rent a truck to take her products. 

Avelina is a member of the communal bank, “Virgen Natividad,” and the group is made up of 15 members, some living in the city of Huayllabamba and others in the city of Yucay. The Peruvian district of Yucay is one of the seven districts in the Urubamba Province.

loans.use: to buy more corn, fodder, and pumpkins.

loans.name: Francis Raiza

texts.es:
La socia Francis pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 39 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18, 10 años de edad; la socia se dedica  a la cosmetología, la socia también paralelo a este negocio  se dedica  a la elaboracion de tortas, panetones, y tiene su stand en el mercado en el cual expone sus deliciosos pasteles y tortas, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y en esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus tortas y de panetones que a la fecha le siguen pidiendo sus clientas.




La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This member, Francis, belongs to the communal bank "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA."   The bank is located in the province of Calca, belonging to the department of Cusco, an hour from the city of Cusco.

She is 39 years old and married with 3 children ages 20,18, and 10.  She works in cosmetology and also runs a business making cakes and pastries.  She has a stand in the market in which she displays her delicious cakes and pastries.  This member is a very hard-working woman and on this occasion, she wants to invest in the purchase of supplies for making her cakes and pastries that to this date, her customers continue asking for.

This member is grateful for the loan and promises to complete the payments in the established time.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of supplies for making cakes and pastries that to this date, her customers keep asking for.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 35 years old, and supports her two children ages twelve and six years. She has been in the salon business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 20, 000. 

Caroline has requested for a loan worth KES 30,000 to allow her to add more salon equipment like blow dryers, and a hair dryer to improve her services to her customers. 

The anticipated profit would help her future. Caroline's dream is to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment like a hair dryer,and blow dryers

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn is 39 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband (who is shown in the picture) is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. One of her children is a security guard who earns about $3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Rorn is requesting a loan of $500 per day. This purchase would enable her to use the  money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Ramatulai

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Ramatulai from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of two years old and seventeen. Two of her children attend school. 

Ramatulai runs a general merchandise store in a busy market area. She sells cigarettes, Ovaltine, milk and sugar. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day expect holidays. Her business is the only source of income she has. She describes her biggest challenge as high incidence of theft in Waterloo.

Ramatulai has requested a loan in order to buy more cigarettes, Ovaltine, sugar, books and pens, as it is now school holidays. Parents would buy these things for their children when school reopens. The extra income from this loan will allow Ramatulai to educate her children and expand her business In the future; she plans to become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Sheriff from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more cigarettes, Ovaltine, sugar, books and pens

loans.name: Agali Awamu Women's Group

texts.en:
Judith is a divorcee aged 48 and the mother of three children who are in different elementary schools. She is a group member of Agali Awamu Women’s Group, which is located on the outskirts of Kyotera town. The group is composed of five women. She is a businesswoman who owns a retail shop near the town centre. She supplements her income with some money from rentals which she inherited with her sisters from her father. She works seven days per week, and each day she works for 16 hours to maximise profits. 

The main reason she started this business is to take care of her family, since she was a single mother. Judith says she has been in this business since 2006, and through this business she has been able to educate all her children and build them a house to stay in. She has acquired this loan in order to restock her business and be able to serve her customers. Her main clients are local people around her home area. She hopes to educate her children to the higher levels of education. However, she faces the challenge of late payments by her customers and lack of capital to stock goods on time.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman and encourages lenders to reduce the interest rate for poor people. In the photograph are four people who make up 80% of the group. The fifth person was not available during the time of disbursement but signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy retail stock for resale.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Jelyn has a buy-and-sell rattan business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional rattan to sell.

Jelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa ties to sell

loans.name: Silverio

texts.en:
Mr. Silverio S. Domínguez is a Tailor and he has been dedicated to this activity for more than ten years. He would like to renew his sewing machine becauseit is very obsolete and does not work rapidly enough to keep up with the demand.

He spends time fixing the machine instead of working faster. His business is located at the entrance of two habitational residential places and this is an advantage because it generates a good flow of customers.

His future plans are to grow this business and hire another person, and together make more repairs and new clothes. Mr. Silverio is requesting a loan of $900,00 USD payable in a term of 6 – 12 months. He wants to use this amount for a new sewing machine and buy supplies. This will allow him to make any type of clothing that is requested by his customers, and will increase his production, therefore making a better familiar entrance.

ESPAÑOL

El Sr. Silverio S. Domínguez se adedicado por mas de 10 años a la satreria elaborando ropa y costuras . El quisiera renovar su equipo del trabajo porque sus máquinas son obsoletas y no puede trabajar rápidamente, se pasa el tiempo arreglando las maquinas y en consecuencia no obtiene el ingreso que quiere y necesita.

Su negocio está situado en la entrada de dos complejos habitacionales , ésto es una ventaja porque genera un buen flujo de clientes. Sus planes futuros son ampliar el negocio y contratar a otra persona para que juntos hagan mas prendas de vestir y mas reparaciones de ropa.

El Sr.Silverio está solicitando un préstamo de $900.00 USD de pagaderos en un Plazo de 6 - 12 meses. Él desea utilizar esta cantidad para una máquina de costura nueva y comprar materiales, ésto permitirá que él haga cualquier tipo de trabajo y aumentará su producción y clientes, por lo tanto una major entrada familiar.

loans.use: sewing machine and supplies

loans.name: Lumuna

texts.en: Lumuna is a local resident and she has her own business. She rents a booth in the local market and sells clothing. She is one of the active clients of Normicro Beylagan branch. She borrowed four times, first amounting $200, the last in the amount of $800. She has a good repayment history. Now she needs $1200 to expand the business more and increase her income.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Tauva

texts.en: Tauva is a single woman who works hard to contribute to her family’s income.  She spends most of her time making clothing and decorative handicrafts for re-sale at the local flea market.  After all expenses, she can clear about ST 140 a week (about USD 55), and of this income, some goes to savings and the rest she willingly gives to her parents and siblings to help make small improvements in the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Buy materials for making handicrafts

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleuteria is married and has two sons: a 12 and a 5-year-old. She is originally from San Luis Potosi, later she moved to Guadalupe, in Nuevo Leon state, in search of better opportunities. She has been selling clothes for the last four years. She went into this field because her sister would give her clothes as gifts. She would, then, sell the ones that did not fit to generate an extra income and, slowly, she began receiving more orders and needed more merchandise.

Fortunately, demand for merchandise is up and she has outlets in different street markets where she has had good profits. In order to acquire more merchandise for the new season, Euleteria needs a loan in the amount of $250.00, which she commits to repaying in three months. Your help can help improve her family's life and contribute to the growth of her business. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Eleuteria es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 12 y 5 años de edad, ella es originaria de San Luis Potosí, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades se mudó a la localidad de Guadalupe, en el estado de Nuevo León. Eleuteria se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace cuatro años, inició porque tiene una hermana le regalaba ropa y al no ser de las tallas correctas, para no dejarlas sin uso y obtener un ingreso extra, las vendía, poco a poco fue recibiendo pedidos y comenzó a surtir mas mercancía.

Afortunadamente la demanda por sus productos es buena y ahora se establece en algunos mercados, donde logra tener altas ventas. Para poder surtir más mercancía de la nueva temporada, Eleuteria solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete devolver en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en: Fenumiai is 60 years old, a widow, and a grand mother of twelve. She has been running her flea market for almost two years. Fenumiai always supports her children even during tough times. This is her 4th loan but she only wants $750 to expand the place. She is one of the happiest mother in Malie Centre, and her business is running good. She also has something to occupy her time as she always works hard at what she does.

loans.use: To buy inventory and supplies for her flea market business

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur R. is a 21 year old trader who owns a shop where he sells spare parts. His shop is in big demand by car enthusiasts in the  Imishli region. He is single and started his business in 2006. He has applied for a  700 USD loan to purchase modern spare parts and  move to a big, bright place. He also wants to enlarge his workplace. Teymur believes these improvements could attract more clients and increase his sales.

loans.use: Going to purchase modern spare parts

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: My name is Suriya B. and I'm from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan.  I am married and a mother of two children: a son and a daughter. My daughter has just completed 14th grade and my son has completed 10th grade. My husband works at a lawyer’s office as an accountant and I sell clothes. I buy clothes from Peshawer, a mountain town which is famous in Pakistan for inexpensive clothes. I would like a loan of $175 to buy  more clothes in bulk for my business.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk for resale in her business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
A year ago Maria purchased a “cuy” (Guinea Pig) for dinner. Fortunately for the animal, Maria has a friend dedicated to the raise these animals and she advised Maria to the same. With a lot effort she managed to purchase two more and start the business of selling “cuyes”.

With the support of EDAPROSPO, Maria purchased a good cage in which she raises her 40 “cuyes”. With this new cage the quality of the animals she raises has improved greatly. She has a great clientele in different zones of Lima.

Maria wants to expand her business by purchasing more “cuyes” and more cages.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace un año, María había comprado un cuy (roedor típico D. los andes peruanos) para su consumo. Para suerte del animal, una amiga que se dedica a L. crianza D. esta especie le aconsejó que incursionara en dicho trabajo. Con mucho esfuerzo, María compró otros dos he inició, así, su negocio D. venta D. cuyes.

Con el apoyo D. EDAPROSPO, María pudo comprar una buena jauL. en donD. cría a sus 40 cuyes. D. esta manera, L. calidad D. L. crianza D. sus animales ha mejorado prueba D. ello es L. gran clienteL. que María está comenzando a tener en distintas zonas D. Lima.

María quisiera poder ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más cuyes y jaulas.

loans.use:
Expand her business

Ampliar su negocio

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo is a baker with 30 years of experience. He inherited the business from his father, and dedicates himself to the creation of a wide range of bakery goods. His business is located in Waspan Sur, and has been growing over the years, with a team of people who help make the bread and distributors who deliver it to the markets, cafes, general stores and private homes. Through his business, Rodolfo has generated employment for others, even though he has only a small number of employees, he has supported them and helped them.

With his profits, he would like to buy some equipment which would allow him to offer his bakery goods in the various plazas and centers of Managua. Right now the costs of the business and the ingredients are high and the cost of bread is also higher. The demand has not diminished, but it's more difficult for him to buy the necessary ingredients. Rodolfo is requesting a loan to purchase necessary ingredients, enabling him to produce the same quantity needed to meet his customers requests.

Rodolfo es un panadero con muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad, inicia desde las cuatro de la mañana, el negocio fue una herencia de su padre, el cual hoy en día administra y se dedica a elaborar una gama de panes como pan dulce, simple, tostado, picos, galletas tostadas, entre otros. Tiene 30 años de tener su negocio, el cual se encuentra ubicado en Waspan Sur, este ha ido creciendo con el pasar de los años, cuenta con personas que le ayudan en el proceso de elaboración así como también distribuidores que se encargan de repartir en pulperías, mercados, cafetines y casas particulares las bolsas de pan. De esta forma ha contribuido a la generación de empleos, ya que a pesar que su personal es mínimo, le ha sido de mucho aporte al crecimiento del mismo. Con sus ganancias tiene el deseo de comprar un equipo rodante en el que puedan ofrecer su pan en las diferentes plazas y centros de Managua. En estos momentos los costos de los insumos de trabajo o ingredientes se encuentran a precios altos, aumentando el precio del pan pero por ser este de mucha demanda la venta no disminuye pero la capacidad de compra de ingredientes si se hace mas difícil, es por eso que el señor necesita un préstamo con el cual pueda adquirir su materia prima y así producir la misma cantidad con la que esta trabajando para satisfacer de esta manera la demanda de sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FLOUR, YEAST AND OTHER INGREDIENTS FOR HIS BAKERY.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is originally from the Achuapa area of León, Nicaragua, and is a dedicated housewife who cares for her school-age son. Her husband breeds livestock and works every day from very early in the morning until nightfall with the sole objective of putting food on the table.

Achuapa is very rural and currently does not receive electricity. To remedy this, Mercedes has acquired a solar panel to power two lamps and a television set. In doing so, she took on a debt that she wishes to erase, and is requesting a loan to pay it off so she and her family can make the most out of the energy and take on household chores.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Mercedes C. es originaria del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León y se dedica a la labor de ama de casa y cuido de su pequeño hijo en edad escolar. Su esposo se dedica al negocio de ganadería trabajando todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta que anochece con el único objetivo de llevar el alimento a su mesa y así poder sobrevivir en la vida

El municipio de Achuapa actualmente tiene la problemática de que no posee energía eléctrica por su ubicación a una larga distancia de la zona urbana. Al atravesar esta necesidad, la señora Mercedes ha adquirido un panel solar que le permite tener acceso a dos lámparas y un televisor. Al adquirirlo ha adquirido una deuda el cual debe de cancelar y es por dicho motivo que hoy acuda a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita cancelar la deuda y así ella y sus hijos puedan aprovechar la energía para llevar a cabo las tareas del hogar.

loans.use: Pay for solar panel / Pago de panel solar

loans.name: Iris Beltsy

texts.es:
Iris lives in the Riguero neighborhood, is a 30 year old businesswoman, married and mother to 1 year old twins. She has been selling cosmetics such as perfumes and other items in the market for 10 years. With the loan she will invest in products to sell and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Iris reside en el barrio Riguero , es comerciante tiene 30 años de edad es casada tiene un par de gemelos de 1 año de edad el producto que distribuye al mercado es la venta de cosméticos como perfumes y encargos que le soliciten, ya son 10 años lo que tiene de vender y con el préstamo quiere invertir mas en sus ofertas y mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica A., 39 and married with four children currently schooling, owns and operates a little grocery shop selling items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. at the local market. She wants to use this loan to buy rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand her business. She hopes to make good income from the expanded business to finance her children’s education to provide them with life opportunities better than what she had.

Monica belongs to the community group called Faith Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Arnoldo Javier

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega Arnoldo L. has a business selling used clothing which he sells in his own house. It's worth noting that he started off as a mobile vendor that had to work in all weather conditions, but as time has passed he has improved his economic situation.

The reason that he is requesting a loan via Ceprodel is for the purchase of a pack of clothes to sell. He is the father of one son that he has to take care of and provide the basic necessities that will allow him to have a proper childhood.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Arnoldo L. se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada comercializándolas en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por sus clientes. Es de interés destacar que desde que inició su negocio el vendía ambulantemente y a la intemperie pero a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ha mejorado su condición económica.

El motivo por el cual solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es para la compra de una paca de ropa para comercializarla puesto que es padre de familia con un hijo que mantener y con el deber de proporcionarle todas las condiciones necesarias para que este se desarrolle.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Zulfira

texts.ru:
Zulfira K. lives in the J. Rumy region. She is 44 years old, is married and has 4 children. Zulfira has a high school education. She has a sales location at the local market where she sells fruits and vegetables. This business is the only source of income for her large family. Zulfira purchases vegetables from wholesale suppliers and then sells them at a higher price. Local residents know that they can always purchase quality products from Zulfira. She would like to expand her business and needs a loan to do this. She has decided to take out a 3 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Касумова Зульфира жительница района Руми .Возраст 44 года,замужем,имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается имеет торговую точку на местном рынке.Где торгует овощами и фруктами. Этот вид деятельности является единственным и основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Зульфира скупает у оптовых поставщиков овощи дешевле ,а затем реализует в розницу. Местные жители знают,что у Зульфиры всегда можно купить качественный товар. В данный момент клиентка хочет расширить свой бизнес, для чего ей нужны деньги .И она решила взять криедит сроком на 3 месяца.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Fatma's Tuwe Sote 1 Group

texts.en:
Fatma, 40 years old, is married and has a 19-year-old child. She has been selling charcoal and coconuts since 2006. Each day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajuma and Mkasi.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.

Beatriz es casada, tiene 68 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Beatriz venD. carne en un puesto del mercado F. Vivanco que se encuentra en el centro D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza desD. las 6 D. mañana hasta las 6 D. la noche, Beatriz o su esposo viajan a las ferias D. la región D. donD. compra los animales que luego los transportan a Ayacucho y lo benefician en el camal D. la ciudad. Además Beatriz se dedica al engorD. D. animales en el distrito D. Chiara, con el apoyo D. campesinos que realizan el pastoreo y reciben un pago por su trabajo.

Beatriz necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. vaca y cerdo. Beatriz sueña con incrementar su negocio, engordar más animales y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Banco Comunal Legion community bank.

Beatriz is married, is 69 years old and has 9 children, four of whom still live with her. Beatriz sells meats in a stand in the F. Vivanco market located in the heart of the city of Ayacucho. She runs her business from 6a.m. to 6p.m. every day. Beatriz or her husband travel to the fairs in the region where they purchase their livestock and transport them back to Ayacucho where they are processed.

Furthermore, Beatriz also raises livestock in the district of Chiara with the help and support of local farmers who shepherd the livestock and receive pay for their services.

Beatriz requires a loan in the amount of 2100 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of a cow and a pig.

Beatriz dreams of expanding her business, to raise more livestock, and she dreams of seeing her kids as young professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beatriz needs a loan in the amount of 2100 soles, funds that will be used to purchase a cow and a pig.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Christian, de 24 años, es un hombre activo, es padre de un niño de tres añitos de edad, quien es su luz y motivo para seguir adelante en lo que se propone, y de velar por su educación.  Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, su pareja Magali se siente orgullosa de tener un hombre como él, es por eso que lo apoya en todo y siempre pide al Todopoderoso que los bendiga. Sin  embargo, Christian quiere mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo, su motocarro, para seguir trabajando duro y sin preocupaciones, para ello necesita de un préstamo que solicita con mucha responsabilidad. Apoyemos a este joven padre, que con talento y esfuerzo trabaja arduamente por seguir surgiendo.
texts.en:
Christian is 24 years old and he is an active person, a father of a little boy aged 3 years. He is the light of his eyes and the reason to keep going in everything he does. He dreams of giving him an education. He provides transportation to passengers and he has been doing so for very long. His partner Magali feels so proud to have a husband like him, and she supports him in everything and always prays for their blessings. Nevertheless, Christian wasts to improve the condition of his work tool, his motorcycle, so that he can keep working hard without these worries. For this he is requesting a loan and he does so with a great deal of responsibility. Let us support this young father, that with a great deal of talent and hard work he keeps going arduously.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to fix the motorcycle.

loans.name: Mrs. Cheang Im Sreng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank [solidarity borrowing group] consists of nineteen people and is located in Preak Reang Kandal Province. Mrs. Cheang Im S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a Khmer cake seller who can make a small income through her business. Her husband, Mr. Khlar Bunthong, is a farmer and pig breeder. Because the second business is going well, he wants to expand it. So Mrs. Cheang Im S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Mrs. Cheang Im S. is 41 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local schoO..

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Koletha J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Koletha M. from Kyela. She is married with two children, ages 9 and 10. Koletha has been running a butcher shop since 1997. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more cows to butcher. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Koletha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for her butcher shop

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is married and has one daughter. She has been in the business of selling hats and women's underwear for 10 years now. She got involved in selling these particular types of goods because she just loves nice clothing. She started small, but now she has 3 business locations plus one seasonal (summer) location. She works at two locations herself, and has a hired person at the third one. Her monthly gross income is 22,500 UAH, and the net profit is 6,500 UAH.

Zhanna is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She would like a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase 100 hats and 100 underwear sets. This would allow her to increase her sales and profits. Zhanna's personal goal is to increase her profits so she can fix her parent's house and move there from the small apartment where she now lives with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: To purchase 100 hats and 100 underwear sets

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: Mrs. Lanh S. was born in 1960 and she now lives in the Wat Svay village in the Takeo province. She has six children: four of them are employed in a garment factory, while the others attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Phou Sun, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living. Although they try to work hard, they still earn only a small income from their rice, not enough to provide a better life for the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Lanh S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a simple entrepreneur, hoping for a progressive life for her family. She manages a rice vending business in their village as her source of income. She is married to Jerwin, and their daughter Lea is now three years old.

She has wanted to request a loan of PHP 4,000 to support her rice vending business for almost one year. She intends to use the loan to purchase at least two sacks of rice that she will sell at retail prices. Her business generates a weekly income of PHP 1,200 and she budgets it for their immediate needs and as rolling capital. To achieve her business goals, Catherine said that she must work hard and always be humble and patient.

loans.use: To  buy two sacks of rice

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ty B., 51, is a widow and lives with her daughter in Takeo province. She has been a teacher since 1984, and is able to make US$2.50 per day. Her daughter stays at home and sells grocery items and makes US$20 in revenue. Ty B. would like to take out a loan to expand the grocery store by adding more products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To expand grocery store.

loans.name: Aayda

texts.en:
Aayda is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her parents. Aayda has been selling women's accessories since 2008. She also sells beauty products. Aayda requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and beauty products. This is the first time that Aayda has requested a loan.
Aayda is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and sells nice accessories. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to work. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and beauty products.

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke B. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicines to her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. Foluke hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Yosra Group

texts.en:
The group, named Yosra, consists of four ladies who live in the region of Bekaa, Lebanon. Foziah, a 34-year-old married woman with six children, raises livestock and produces milk, both very much in demand by the people in her region. She is requesting a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua to expand her livestock and her milk production.
