This is the first time that Foziah has requested a loan, and in the future she plans on further expansion of her livestock.

Shama, a 42-year-old married woman with nine children, has been raising livestock for about 20 years, with many clients in her region. She is requesting a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to expand her livestock. This is the first time that Shama has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

Fadah, a 41-year-old married woman with five children, has raised livestock for several years and has many clients in her region. She is requesting a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to expand her livestock. This is the first time that Fadah has requested a loan, and in the future she plans on improving her business.

Zahra, 18, owns a livestock and is requesting a loan of $00 from Al Majmoua in order to expand her livestock. This is the first time that Zahra has requested a loan, and in the future she plans on improving her work by additional expansion.

About Group Loans In a group loan, each member receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Yosra group will use the loan to increase their livestock.

loans.name: Kyarwabuyamba A Kisembo Sifah Group

texts.en: K. Sifah is age 30 and married with four children, all schooling. She sells produce, so far for five years. She is using the loan to purchase produce (beans, maize, rice, millet and ground nuts) thus adding stock to her business. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house and own a car.

loans.use: To purchase produce to add stock to her business

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Mr. Virgilio B. is 64 years old and is a self-employed construction worker. He was married for almost 38 years to his wife, Catalina Simon, who passed away three years ago. They had four children together, all of whom are older and have their own families.

When Virgilio's wife was alive, the couple owned a small grocery store in their house, which his wife attended to, while Virgilio worked in his profession in order to pay the living expenses. Virgilio then decided to start his own business with his sons, providing lighting for large events. One of his children had already been working in this industry for years.

According to Virgilio, the business has had a lot of success in its few years of operation. Working with the Fundación, Virgilio has been able to purchase a truck for transporting his equipment to places where his services are needed. The credit given to him will go to tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and acessories for lighting

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Anitha R. from Mwanza. She is married with one child the age of one year old. Anitha has been running a poultry business since 2007. Her business is a Poultry/kuku business. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients.

Kuku means "chickens" in Swahili and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Anitha currently earns about 220 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more chickens. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Anitha thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Herolyn

texts.en: Herolyn T. is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old, married, and has a school-aged child. Herolyn owns and operates a business selling fish and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Herolyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco LAS EMPRENDEDORAS, trabaja en nuestra Institución desD. el 2008, la mayoria D. las participantes a trabajado desD. sus inicios, el banco se caracteriza por trabajar en el comercio y servicios.Es un grupo solidario y participativo. 
                                                                   MARIA CARMEN C., es la presidenta, se dedica a la venta D. pan en la Ceja D. El Alto, con el prestamo a logrado apoyar la actividad D. su esposo, quien es conductor asalariado, con el tiempo tienen planes D. ahorrar y poder comprarse una movilidad propia y así poder mejorar su calidad D. vida.                                                                                                                     VICENTE C.,ocupa el cargo D. secretario, es uno D. los fundadores del banco,  tiene un negocio D. amplificación y con el prestamo a podido implementar un negocio más, una tienda D. barrio que le permite mantener a su familia que esta compuesta por 6 miembros, con estas dos actividades a logrado mejorar sus ingresos y tener estabilidad económica. 
                                    CINDA G. B.,se dedica al comercio D. viveres en la zona D. Villa Victoria, con el prestamo a logrado tener un pequeño capital, el que es utilizado para la venta D. comida los fines D. semana, ella tambien es una D. las fundadoras del Banco, tiene una familia numerosa y piensa ahorrar más para los estudios D. sus nietos.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedoras group has been working in our microfinance institute since 2008. The majority of its members have been with us since the beginning. This is a very active and unified group that provides goods and services.

MARIA CARMEN C., the group president, sells bread in La Ceja D. El Alto. With these loans, she has been able to help out her husband, who works as a wage-earning driver. In time, they plan to save enough money to be able to purchase their own vehicle so that the can improve their quality of life.

VICENTE C., the group secretary, is one of the group’s founders. He owns a sound equipment rental business. With these loans, he has been able to launch yet another business—a corner market—which helps him to support all 6 members of his family. With both of his businesses, he can increase his earnings and have financial stability.

CINDA G. B. sells provisions in the Villa Victoria zone. With these loans, she has managed to amass some working capital, which she uses for weekend food sales. She is also one of the founding group members. She has a sizable family, and she hopes to save more money for her grandchildren’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and spare parts

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en: Leoncia A. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Leoncia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling firewood in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Leoncia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Leoncia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
El señor Herminio M. es padre de familia, tiene una hija adolescente que actualmente estudia.
Con dos créditos anteriores con FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto, para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planean pagarlos con los ingresos que obtienen el como albañil (construcción y reparación de casa) y el de su esposa la señora Teodora Bautista que trabaja como ayudante de cocinera en una escuela, estos son los ingresos con el cual pagaran el crédito.
Su deseo es que su hija tenga su propio cuarto y viva mejor.
texts.en:
Herminio is the father of an adolescent daughter who is currently studying. The past two loans he had with FVP was used to construct a room in his house, but one that lacks a roof. He has a plan to construct a concrete slab so that the house can be safer and more durable.

He is requesting a loan for this construction and plans to use the income he makes as a builder (constructing and repairing houses) and that of his wife, Teodora, who works as a kitchen assistant at a school, to pay off his loan.

His wish is for his daughter to have her own room and to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put a concrete slab in the ground floor of his home

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon L.'s main source of income comes from selling fruit in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has four adult children. She is from the village of Casusan. Corazon has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 pesos a month.

In 2007, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Nhan T. B. (id: 010107060017) was born in 1968. She lives in Xuan Canh, Xuan Trach, Dong Aanh, Ha Noi, with her husband and two of her children, both of whom still going to school. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. Her family life is difficult, so she wants a loan to develop her business. She needs 300 USD for her small business.

There are four other participants in her group:

Van B. N. (id: 010107060018) is 30 years old. She is a cook. She wants to borrow 300 USD to open a small restaurant.

Hue T. P. (id: 010107060020) is 26 years old. She is a hairdresser. She wants to borrow 300 USD to invest her hairdressing salon.

Thanh T. N. (id: 010107060015) is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 300 USD to start a small business.

Quy T. T. (id: 010107060019) is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 300 USD to buy goods to sell in the market.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Đăng's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Đăng (10114010045) is a 41-year-old man who lives in Đông Anh - Hà Nội. T. is the leader of a 6-member loan group sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Oai 1 (6).

T. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, T. operates a family member's livestock business, where he raises and sells cattle. T. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.876.000 VND from SEDA. He used the previous loan to buy calves to raise and sell in the future. He is now requesting a new loan of 5.886.000 VND that he will used to buy more calves. This will be T.'s 6th loan from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

  • Nguyễn Thị C. (10114010046) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her business raising crops.
  • Trần Thị H. (10114010031) is a 54-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.
  • Nghiêm Thị D. (10114010032) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her general store.
  • Trương Thị P. (10114010033) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her business raising crops.
  • Nguyễn Thị N. (10114010034) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.578.000 VND loan to support her livestock business.
About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Nguyễn Đăng (10114010045) là 41 tuổi nam. Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Trung Oai 1 (6). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.876.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.886.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị C. (10114010046) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. 2. Trần Thị H. (10114010031) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nghiêm Thị D. (10114010032) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 4. Trương Thị P. (10114010033) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực. 5. Nguyễn Thị N. (10114010034) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.578.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase calves raise and sell

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es: La señora  ROSARIO DEL PILAR M. C. , tiene  29 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella presenta estudios técnicos de contabilidad , y  tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad  quien dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a dar servicio de cabinas de Internet que tiene en su casa y  con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro insumos alimenticios como: arroz,  papas, fideos, menestras, etc porque se dedicaba a vender menús.  Con este crédito de 2,000  nuevos soles  comprará teclados, 1 impresora, melamine para la fabricación de sus cabinas de Internet. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio para obtener  mayores ganancias .
texts.en:
ROSARIO DEL PILAR M. C., 29, lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SANTA ELENA II communal bank. She has studied accounting and has an 8-year-old son, who depends upon her financially. She has set up Internet access cubicles in her home and with her initial, 300 new sol, loan she bought food items like rice, potatoes, pasta, vegetables, etc. because she used to work selling prepared meals. With this 2,000 new sol loan she will buy keyboards, a printer, and laminate to build her Internet cubicles. She dreams with expanding her business in order to earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy keyboards, a printer, and laminate to build Internet cubicles.

loans.name: Metuli

texts.en: Metuli S. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Fagasa. She is married and has five school-aged children. Metuli owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200 WST a month. In 2008, Metuli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Metuli is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will again be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily B. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Emily is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling snacks and vegetables. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. Emily is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Emily from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nerlyn

texts.en:
Nerlyn B. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon, Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Nerlyn operates business selling home made amakan (bamboo mat) products to tourist and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nerlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was use to invest in expanding her business.

Nerlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer and soda for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita P. is from the village of Seti in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Florita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Florita makes and sells mats to local community members. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Florita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be Florita's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional materials to make mats

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric S. J. is twenty-six years old, married, and has one child aged three months old. They hope to give their child a good education to the university level. 

Eric's business is located at Kitengela, just behind Kitengela market, and it is known by the name Matinyani Furniture Mart. He sells chairs, wall units, sofa sets, tables, tools and others to the local people. He has been in this business for the last five years and has four employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints and that wood is not readily available. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Eric is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more materials for making sofa sets. He hopes to expand his business. He is very hard-working, honest and determined.

loans.use: Materials for sofa sets

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 36 years old and is married with five children, her youngest being 4 years old. Her children attend school and this gives her joy.

Rebecca sells drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers and loves this business because of the profits she makes. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

Rebecca hopes that her business expands to be big and strong. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en:
Edna B. is from the village of Libag Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 33 years old. Edna is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Edna is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Florencia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Florencia Z. de 64 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Su esposo le ayuda en la papelería ellos tienen 5 hijos que ya están casados. 

Florencia desde que se caso tenia la idea de tener su propio negocio pero como la situación económica de su familia no era buena decidió esperar  ahorrar lo suficiente, después de algunos años ella y su esposo invirtieron dinero en algunos cuadernos, plumas y hojas y comenzaron a venderlos en su casa, poco a poco fue incrementado su capital. 

Florencia arreglo la parte delantera de su casa y la convirtio en una tienda- papelería, por esa buena decisión ahora tiene un buen negocio, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, hojas y arroz para su tienda/ papelería. 

En el futuro quiere que su tienda/ papelería se convierta en un Minimarket y poder asegurar la vejes de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Florencia Z., 64, lives in an urban zone of El Guasmo, Guayaquil (named after a species of tree, Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo is a popular, low-income neighborhood that used to be a hacienda). Her husband helps out in their grocery/stationery store; they are married and have five children. Since Florencia got married she always wanted to have her own business but, because her family’s economic situation wasn’t very good, she decided to wait until she had saved up enough. After a few years, she and her husband invested money in a few notebooks, pens and sheets of paper and started selling them from home. Gradually, their capital increased. Florencia converted the front part of her house into a grocery/stationery store. That good decision has led to her having a profitable business; she works from early in the morning until nightfall every day. She will use the loan to buy notebooks, paper and rice for her grocery/stationary store. In the future, she would love to convert her grocery/stationary store into a Minimart to insure her and her husband’s old age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks and sheets of paper.

loans.name: Funmiayo

texts.en:
Funmiayo sells drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks and a fridge.  She hopes this will help cool her drinks which will also attract more customers. 

Funmiayo is 30 years old and she is happily married with 2 children. Her husband is a farmer and he also supports their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and a fridge

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
S. Khurshed is 44 years old. He sells household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and many others. He has been in this business for more than ten years. Because of his rich experience, Khurshed is able to choose goods that meet the requirements of his clients, whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates the stable income that allows Khurshed to improve the living conditions of his family and to make his children happy. 

Today Khurshed is requesting 10,000 TJS. He is planning to use the loan to purchase new household goods to sell, thus enlarging the range of goods. With your help, this will be possible. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To enlarge the range of goods.

loans.name: Socheata's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Socheata S. has been selected by five people who are villagers in Preaek Samraong village, in Kandal province. This group loan is made up of all the members who will each use a small portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Socheata S. was born in 1980. Now she is a cane juice and gasoline seller at her home. She can earn some money from these businesses to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Cham Rung Noun, is a tailor. Although this couple tries to work hard with their businesses, they earn only a little money. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Socheata S. is asking for a loan to buy some cans of gas to resell to start a new business. She is a mother of three children: one is enrolled in the local public school while the youngest two are only five years old and eight months old.

loans.use: To buy some cans of gas to resell.

loans.name: Santos Esxequiel

texts.es: El señor L. se dedica al servicio de Taxi con el ingreso que obtiene de este trabajo logra mantener la alimentación de su mamá y él, con CEPRODEL es su segundo crédito que solicita para la compra de amortiguadores, rotulo, muñequillas, roelling y cremalleras para mantener bien el vehículo el cual le provee sus ingresos
texts.en:
Sr. Santos L. provides taxi services. With the income he earns from this job, he is able to support and feed himself and his mother. He is requesting his second loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy shock absorbers, signage, crankpins, cogs, and rolling parts so that he can keep his vehicle well-maintained and continue generating income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts & supplies for his vehicle

loans.name: Berenise

texts.es: Berenise, de 20 años es soltera, tiene un hijo de un año de nacido, vive en casa de su madre,  Floriza de 45 años y con tres sobrinos. Con la convicción de que cada cosecha, será  la más exitosa, que le generará una buena producción y por ende buenos ingresos económicos, ella, con la ayuda de sus hermanos y su madre, se dedica a cultivar plátanos, piña y café en sus terrenos propios, que le heredó su madre. Lo que más le llama la atención de la agricultura es retirar la maleza de sus campos agrícolas, para mantenerlos limpios, pues así permite que sus plantaciones crezcan de manera libre. Lleva 3 años en está laboriosa actividad, que le permite sacar adelante  a su hijo, quien es el motor de su vida, además puede ahorrar para poder cubrir mas adelante su educación, así como construir su casa e instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles. Por el momento continuará  plantando café de la mejor calidad, ya que es la más solicitada por que brinda granos más grandes. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y gracias a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, aprendió a invertir el crédito que llega  a sus manos, por eso le gusta trabajar con ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para esparcirlos sobre sus cultivos ya que le permitirán nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Berenise is 20 years old, single, and has a one year old child. She lives at home with her mother Floriza, age 45, and her three nephews. With the conviction she demonstrates, she becomes more successful with each crop. Berenise is able to generate good yields and earn a nice income. With the help of her siblings and her mother, she plants bananas, pineapples, and coffee on her own land that she inherited from her mother. She focuses most of her attention on removing weeds since it keeps her fields clean and allows her crops to grow freely. Berenise has been farming for the past three years so that she can succeed on behalf of her son, who is her motivation in life. She also wants to have the ability to save so that she can pay for his future education, build a house, and open a food business. For now she will continue planting good quality coffee since large coffee beans are in high demand.

This is the third time she has received a loan from MFP. Thanks to the members of her Communal Bank, she learned how to invest the loan as soon as she received it. For this reason, she enjoys working with them. With the loan she requested, Berenise will buy several bags of compost to apply to her crops so that she can stabilize production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José de 36 años, vive en el reparto Carlos Nuñez el se dedica a la venta de leña, de la manera más humilde se gana el pan de cada día para mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Por la falta de oportunidades profesionales él comenzó a vender en su casa con la ayuda de su esposa, por lo que es su primer crédito y está muy entusiasmado para empezar este negocio. Por lo que trabaja todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, es necesario ya que tiene mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima y aumentar su inventario. Sueña con seguir adelante con su actividad y proporcionar a sus hijos los recursos más necesarios.
texts.en:
Carlos José is 36 years old. He lives in the Carlos Nuñez neighborhood and sells firewood. He earns his daily bread in a most humbly way, so that he can improve his family’s income. With his wife’s help, he began selling out of his home due to a lack of other opportunities. This will be his first loan and he is very excited about starting this business. He works every day from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. This is necessary because he has to support his family. He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and to increase his inventory. He dreams of moving ahead with his business and of being able to give his children their most needed resources.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nassim

texts.en: Nassim is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has been working in construction as an aluminum expert for 15 years. Nassim sells aluminum doors, windows, kitchens and closets. He was very young when he started to learn this business; it was the family’s needs that drove him to work in order to help his parents earn an income. And he became an expert in his field. This is the first time that Nassim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary material for his business. With this loan, Nassim believes he will be able to expand his work and become well known among competitors, which will increase his income and help in providing a secure life for his family.

loans.use: To buy necessary material for his business

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “CLAVELES”, es un grupo nuevo, consta de nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón,  a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora María Luisa como presidenta. 

La  señora María Luisa, casada, a sus 59 años de edad tiene a su cargo un Kiosko de golosinas, este negocio ha sido su sustento durante los últimos diez años. Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella está ya tres ciclos en su asociación.

La A.C. “CLAVELES” cuenta con integrantes que también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: venta de tarjetas y papel de regalo y juguetes, venta de chompas, venta de golosinas y otros, artículos deportivos, venta de repuestos de autos, venta de ropa, cafetería, confección de chamarras y tejido de manta con lana de vicuña.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Claveles” (Carnations) is a new group consisting of nine members, eight women and one man. The group is headed by Sra. María Luisa who serves as President.

Sra. María Luisa is 59 years old, married, and manages a candy kiosk. She has looked after this business for the past ten years in order to earn a living. Regarding her tenure with Pro Mujer, she has already participated in three loan cycles with her group.

The Communal Association “Claveles” consists of members who have their own businesses which include selling cards, gift wrapping paper, and toys; selling sweaters; selling candy and other treats; selling sporting goods, selling auto parts; selling clothing; managing a cafeteria; manufacturing jackets; and weaving blankets made of vicuña wool.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of candy

loans.name: Soñadoras Group

texts.es:
“SOÑADORAS” es una asociación comunal que está incursionando en su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Santiago II, es considerada  aun nueva, por que ellas todavía no han experimentado todos los servicios financieros y diferentes vivencias que consolidan a los grupos, es por esto que requieren de un cuidado especial de parte de las asesoras de crédito.

La señora Juana es la presidenta de la asociación.  Ella comenta que  conoció a Pro Mujer debido a la movilización del personal. 
El negocio que tiene es “artesanía en cuadro”, utiliza como materia prima las varillas, que son compradas en la zona 16 de Julio, debido a que elabora su producto a pedido, la elaboración y las ventas son realizadas en su domicilio.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que la atención del consultorio.

Los integrantes de la asociación comunal, cuentan con negocios diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de ropa, mecánica electricista, artesanías, imprenta, venta de pollos y costura.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Soñadoras” (Dreamers) is starting its second loan cycle as part of the Santiago II Community Center. They are still considered to be a new group because they have not had the chance to participate in all of the financial services and different experiences needed to unite the members together. For this reason, special care has been taken to provide them with credit counseling.

Sra. Juana is the President of this Association. She says she encountered Pro Mujer as a result from a visit from its staff. Juana has a craft business in which she produces decorative wall hangings. The main material she uses are wooden rods that she buys in the July 16th district. She produces and sells her products from her home according to her orders. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Juana replied that she enjoys the medical services.

The members of the Communal Assocation are involved in different business such as selling clothing, providing electrical services, producing handicrafts, printing, sewing, and selling chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wooden rods for making wall art

loans.name: 2671 (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 2761 esta formado por señoras que se conocen y son de diferentes lugares de la ciudad y cantones de Cuenca, pero se han reunido con un fin en común que es  realizar los créditos para invertir en sus pequeños negocios y así crecer día a día con su trabajo para mejorar su situación económica y entregar a sus hijos un mejor porvenir.

La Señora Ana Llivigañay vive en la comunidad de Zhumir que  pertenece al cantón Paute, este es el  primer crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir y ha sido invitada por su amiga de la comunidad a formar parte de este banco comunal. Nuestra socia  trabaja en un invernadero que es de su propiedad en donde siembra tomates, esta labor la realiza hace 15 años y su producto lo vende en el mercado de Paute y  tiene clientes fijos a quienes entrega. También se dedica a la cría de animales como chanchos, pollos y cuyes los que vende en su propia comunidad.
Doña Ana tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos  de 29, 27, 23, 21, 19, 13 y 9 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos son casados y vive  independientemente, su quinto hijo trabaja y es solo para sus gastos personales y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela.  Su esposo no se encuentra en el país, ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para ayudar en la economía de su hogar. Tiene casa propia fruto del trabajo conyugal.  Su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. 
Su meta es construir una nueva casa por el centro del cantón Paute. 

La Señora Gladys C. vive en la comunidad de Zhumir  que  pertenece al cantón Paute, tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 21, 20, 17, 16, 14, 12, 10 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos estudian en el colegio, a excepción de su cuarta hija que no le gusta  estudiar  pero ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad.
Su esposo trabaja fuera del país, ha migrado en busca de un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Tienen casa propia que es el resultado del trabajo conyugal.
Doña Gladis se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos y cuyes, los que vende en su propia comunidad cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Trabaja también todos los días en  una hacienda en donde se dedica a la agricultura cultivando hortalizas. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.

Su meta es  mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank 2761 consists of women from different places in the city and surrounding area of Cuenca who know each other. They have united with a common goal which is to acquire loans to invest in their small businesses and in this way grow every day through their work to improve their economic situation and provide a better future for their children.

Ana Llivigañay lives in Zhumir, Paute; this is her first loan through Espoir and she was invited by her friend in the community to join this communal bank. Our member works in her own greenhouse where she grows tomatoes. She has done this for 15 years and she sells her product in the Paute market and she has some regular customers to whom she delivers. She also raises animals like pigs, chickens, and guinea pigs that she sells in her own community.

Ana is 43 years old, married, and has 7 children ages 29, 27, 23, 21, 19, 13, and 9 years old. Her first four children are married and live on their own, her fifth child works and is responsible for his personal expenses, and her last two children are in school. Her husband is not in the country, he has migrated in search of a better job to help their household expenses. She has her own house because of their hard work. She is going to invest the loan in buying chickens and feed.

Her goal is to build a new house in the center of Paute. 

Gladys C. lives in Zhumir, Paute; she is 39 years old, married, and has 7 children ages  21, 20, 17, 16, 14, 12, and 10. Her four children are in school, except for the fourth daughter who doesn’t like to study, but she helps with the household chores. Her youngest two children study in a community school.

Her husband works outside of the country; he migrated to seek a better future for their children. They have their own house which is the result of their hard work.

Gladys raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs which she sells in her own community when she has some economic need to do so. She also works everyday on a farm where crops are grown. This is her first credit with the foundation and she is going to invest it in buying chickens and feed.

Her goal is to improve her home.

loans.use: Buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is house rent. 

For over thirteen years, he has operated his retail shop selling to her neighbors and passersby. He faces a challenge of high transport costs in his business. Richard hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of beans, maize, rice and bundles of wheat flour.  He decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from the society.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, maize, rice and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora L. Chavala quiere aprovechar la temporada para producir la mejor cosecha de frijoles en el año, tanto para consumo como para la venta.
Ella tiene 52 años, y toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura en su comunidad Santa Fe de Alajuela, conocida especialmente con su cercanía con la frontera norte del país.
Doña Flora necesita un préstamo de ₡603 000 (seiscientos tres mil colones) para la compra de insumos y para la preparación de suelo de su propiedad. Con esto tendrá la mejor cosecha y muy buenos ingresos para comprar los regalos de navidad para sus 4 hijos. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Flora L. Chavala wants to take advantage of this season for producing the best crop of beans this year for both personal consumption and for sale.  She is 52 years old and has spent her entire life farming in the community of Santa Fe de Alajuela, which is known especially for its close proximity to the northern border of the country.

Doña Flora needs a loan of 603,000 CRC in order to buy supplies and prepare the soil on her property.  She hopes this will provide her with the best crop and better income from which she can buy Christmas presents for her four children.

Flora is a member of the Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing her farmland

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La Sra. Pabla T. es comerciante posee una despensa bien surtida desde hace mas de 3 años, cuenta con una clientela bien formada quienes se encuentran muy conformes con los precios y los productos que se encuentran a la venta en la despensa.
 Vive en el Asentamiento Nueva Esperanza del Barrio San Antonio de la Ciudad de Itá, con su marido y sus hijos, todos ellos asisten a Escuela primaria de la zona. 
Comenzó su despensa en un pequeño salón y hoy cuenta con un amplio local bien equipado. 
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada que gracias a su esfuerzo y su perseverancia ha logrado llevar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como productos de limpieza, lácteos, panificados, carnes, y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs Pabla T. is a saleswoman.  She has a well-stocked grocery store which she has had for more than 3 years.  She has a solid customer base and her customers are very happy with her prices and the products which they find for sale in her store.

She lives in Nueva Esperanza, in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of Itá with her husband and her children who all attend the local elementary school.

She started her grocery store in a small room but today she has bigger, well-equipped premises.

She is a very hard-working, selfless lady who, thanks to her effort and perseverance, has managed to get her family ahead and improve their quality of life.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as cleaning products, dairy products, bakery products, meat and other products.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store (rice, sugar, bakery products, dairy products, meat, cleaning products, etc.)

loans.name: Carlos Alciviades

texts.es:
Carlos de 35 años, es operador de una maquina en una compañía de café. Vive con su esposa y un hijo en una casa de cemento una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.

Para poder mantener a su familia él comenzó a trabajar como operador de una maquina en una compañía que elabora café instantáneo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am operando todo el día una maquina con la que carga el cacao (con esta fruta se elabora el café). Todavía su casa no está bien construida y quiere darle una buena vida a su esposa que trabaja en una fuente de soda y su hijo por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y bloques. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old.  He is a machine operator in a coffee company.  He lives with his wife and son in a cement house in a peri-urban area which is noted for its dirt roads and mountains.

In order to support his family, Carlos works as a machine operator in a company that makes instant coffee.  He works from 8.00am, all day, on a machine which he loads with cacao (from which the coffee is made).

Carlos' house is still not well built and he would like to give his wife, who works in a luncheonette, and his son a better quality of life.  For this reason he will use his loan to buy cement and blocks.  In the future, he would like to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Manweri

texts.en:
Manweri is a thirty-five-year-old married man with four children .He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a cattle trader.

Manweri wants to increase his cattle herd from 6 animals to 15 animals. He also wants to  educate his children and build a permanent house. He wants a loan to purchase cattle for resale.

loans.use: Purchase cattle for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business by acquiring more merchandise.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom belongs to Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan and known for its dairy industry.  She has been living there with her family in a three room brick house for the last 15 years. 
She herself is a seam-stress, stitches clothes for her neighboring clients. Due to her quality of work, she receives good number of orders every month. 
Her husband’s name is A. D. and he works in a vegetable market as a vegetable seller. 
Kalsoom is the mother of two sons, both are young and have not started getting education yet. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetable for selling. He has more than 10 years of experience in his business and Kalsoom is hopeful that an investment will be more profitable for him. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable selling business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes C. has four children, one girl and three boys, and makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells various items such as sugar, vinegar and soy sauce. She works hard to provide her precious children with a decent life, and is applying for this loan for 9,000 PHP to expand her business by buying more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
David has been operating his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 31 years old, married to Joyce Wanjiru, and they have two children.

David was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan amount to stock his shop with flour, sugar and rice.

In the future, David hopes to add farming as a source of income.

loans.use: To stock his shop with flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira P. is 42 years old. Elvira is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elvira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Khongorzul

texts.en:
Khongorzul, 35 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a one bedroom studio apartment which they bought under a leasing contract. Khongorzul's older two daughters attend a local secondary school and the youngest one attends kindergarten.

Khongorzul has operated a spare parts retail business since 2004. She buys brand new new spare parts from China and sells them in the local market. She also sells secondhand parts, which she buys, fixes and restores. Her business is doing very well because brand new car parts cars are very expensive. Khongorzul has her own customers and her products are in good demand. She has already taken out 3 loans from Credit Mongol and has used them appropriately. Knogorzul is requesting a loan to pay the customs duty on spare parts imported from China.

loans.use: to pay the customs duty on spare parts imported from China.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir M. was born in 1984 in Kapan city. He is married and has two children: a two-year-old daughter and a newborn son.  
For about three years Vladimir has been engaged in an auto repair shop. His father helps him in this occupation and from this business they pay for their family’s needs. Vladimir likes his work very much, so he spends a lot of time in his workshop and enjoys his work.   Vladimir needs a $ 1,350 loan to buy the necessary auto spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To buy auto spare parts for his business

loans.name: 02 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hoan N. Thị (4) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hoan is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Đông Vệ (08.04.02 Đông Vệ).

Hoan is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Hoan owns and operates a general store. Hoan has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Hoan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Lê Thị Thuỵ (5) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

2. N. Thị Xuyến (6) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3. Lê Thị Tâm (7) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

4. Lê Thị Thanh (8) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

5. Lê Thị Vân (9) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

6. Lê Thị C. Thạch (1) is a 64-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hoan N. Thị (4) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Đông Vệ (08.04.02 Đông Vệ).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoan kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Hoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Lê Thị Thuỵ (5) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

2.  N. Thị Xuyến (6) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3.  Lê Thị Tâm (7) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

4.  Lê Thị Thanh (8) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

5.  Lê Thị Vân (9) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

6.  Lê Thị C. Thạch (1) là 64 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in renovating her general store.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is 50 years old and married with two children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs. Benigna is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed for her pig fattening business. 

Benigna has been raising pigs for a year and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs and feed for her pig fattening business

loans.name: Diokere Endam Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité DIOKORE ENDAM est créé le 31/05/2007.IL est composé de 13 femmes issues du même quartier.la plupart des membres font du petit commerce.

Madame AIDA en position debout et  à l'extrême droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe.Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants qui sont  élèves,elle est âgée de 40 ans.  

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus thioup et wax.Elle pratique cette activité depuis 04 ans.

Elle a eu à faire la même activité lors du financement précédent.

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des tissus et thioup.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants  tout en augmentant son niveau d'épargne dans le BV.
texts.en:
The DIOKORE ENDAM solidarity group was created May 31, 2007. It is composed of 13 women, who hail from the same neighborhood. Most members are active in retail.

Mrs. AIDA, who is standing all the way to the right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is married and a mother of five children who go to school. She is 40 years old.

She retails thioup and wax fabrics (West-African dyed fabrics). She has been active in this business for four years. She was in the same business for the previous loan.

With this loan, she is going to purchase fabrics and thioup. Her objective is to support her husband in taking care of the children's school expenses and to increase her level of savings in the "Banc Villageois" (loan group).

loans.use: to puchase "thioup" and "wax" fabrics.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 24 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Janice has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for  one year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Janice aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 46-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband supports the family through the income that he earns as a laborer. Tuyet has been supporting her family by earning an income raising and selling pigs for the past 15 years. She would like to take out a loan to buy more pigs to increase the size of her business. 

She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs for raising and selling

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
This is Fely, fifty years old and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Felicisimo, an electrician, and is the mother of five children. By the grace of God, Fely has managed to support her children's schooling. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Fela, as she is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Fely is a sugar retailer. She buys sacks of sugar from wholesalers, repacks them and sells them in 1/4, 1/2, and 1 kilo sizes to individuals, general store owners and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, Fely is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of sugar to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in income from this expansion. 

Fely dreams of giving all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She also hopes to have a store in the community market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of sugar needed in her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a single woman with two children who both graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling baobab fruit, the powdered pith of the baobab nut.  Halima sells at the market to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry summer season, the supply of baobab fruit declines, compared to cold winter seasons. She dreams of establishing a baobab fruit shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Halima wants to purchase sacks of baobab fruit  to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of baobab fruit to sell.

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia, se dedica a la venta D. ropa y refrescos, vive con su esposo  y su hija, ella tiene el negocio desD. hace 5 años, también cuando es temporada D. vender mariscos, instala su puestecito D. mariscos, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora aparte D. que necesita contar con fuentes D. ingreso porque ella sufre una discapacidad para movilizarse. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ropa, específicamente prendas D. adulto como blusas, faldas, vestidos, con esta inversión pretenD. mejorar el negocio y tener variedad D. prendas para los clientes.
Su aspiración es que a través D. financiamientos pueda mantener su hogar  y también ella pueda sentirse útil para su familia.
texts.en:
Zonia has been selling clothing and soft drinks for a living for 5 years.  She lives with her husband and daughter.  She also sets up a small stand and sells seafood when it is in season.  She is a very hard-working woman and needs to have a source of income because she has a physical disability.  

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy clothing, specifically adult clothing such as blouses, skirts, and dresses.  With this loan she aims to improve her business and offer her customers a variety of clothing. 

Her goal is that through financing she will be able to maintain her household, and at the same time, feel helpful to her family.

loans.use: purchase adult clothing such as blouses, skirts, and dresses.

loans.name: Tumu

texts.en:
Tumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a cosmetics business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells handbags and clothes, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and price fluctuation of commodities in her business. 

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to start a cereals business. She will purchase sacks of beans, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, maize flour and wheat flour to start a cereals business

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is the 40-year-old married mother of one son, aged 20 years. She has operated a carpentry workshop store in Kilifi for the last four years. Her business has been doing well.

Penina has been a KADET client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. She plans to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing more stock of timber for her workshop. Penina will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and for her family’s upkeep. Penina’s dream is to become a successful businesswoman in Kilifi.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more timber for her workshop

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four school-aged children. She has 11 years of experience working in selling beauty products and perfumes to local customers. She works from her home where she receives clients. With her requested loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will be able to increase her inventory selection of new cosmetics and perfumes in order to increase her sales and therefore her income. She has high hopes for the future of her business and looks forward to opening her own shop in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory selection of new cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Yuniya's Group

texts.en:
Yuniya's group is comprised of 5 hard-working women. Yuniya is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Yuniya has been working hard to help her mother manage a small shop which sells shoes and other footwear. 

To help expand her business, Yuniya has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes and will help Yuniya to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Yuniya hopes that in the future she will be able to open her own retail business. 

Yuniya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Yuniya's future prospects by helping her to learn more about running a business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Huitzililla Group

texts.es: salieron del grupo el joven santiago y la señora Maribel e ingresaron las señoras Eleuteria va a comprar con su prestamo alimento por bulto de zacate y sorgo molidos para crianza de ganado, la señora Tomasa va a comprar mayonesa, verduras, jitomate, cebolla, chiles en vinagre , queso carnes frias, teleras. La señora Margarita tiene 41 años de edadd ella vive en union libre tiene 4 hijos 2 varones y 2 mujeres ellas estas estudiando una la prepa y la otra la secundaria, ella vende dulces refrescos, tortas, chicharrones preparados, paletas de hielo, zapatos, perfumes y cosmeticos por catalogo, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años es herencia de su suegro y su hijo le enseño a trabajar en las ventas, ella hace tandas de zapatos, tambien sale a ofrecer sus productos con las vecinas y conocidas, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para pagar el prestamo, y para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijas, ella esta orgullosa de su negocio por las ganancias que obtiene para seguir invirtiendo en dulces y zapatos, ella esta planeando vender verduras y lo pienza lograr con las ganancias, ella esta contenta con este prestamo le va a ayudar a surtir su negocio para tener mercancia para ofrecerles a sus clientes, sus sueños y esperanza son que sus hijas estudien. las integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad por sus prestamos por su ayuda de apoyarnos a crecer los negocios.
texts.en:
Santiago and Maribel left the group and Eleuteria joined.  She will use the loan to buy bulk grass feed and ground sorghum to feed cattle.  Tomasa will buy mayonnaise, vegetables, tomatoes, onions, pickled chilies, cheese, cold cuts and bread rolls.  

Margarita, 41, lives in a common law relationship and has four children: two boys and two girls.  One of the girls is in high school and the other is in middle school.
