She sells candy, soft-drinks, tortas [Mexican style sandwiches], chicharrones preparados [fried pork rinds], popsicles, shoes, perfume and cosmetics via catalogue.  She started the business three years ago.  It was passed down to her from her father-in-law and her son taught her about sales.  She also sells shoes in rotating credit plans and also goes out to sell door to door among her neighbors and acquaintances.  

Her business is important because it produces income with which to repay the loan and to cover school costs for her daughters.  She’s proud of her business because of the profits it generates to continue investing in candy and shoes.  She’s planning to sell vegetables and she plans to accomplish this with her profits.  She is happy with the loan that will help her stock her business to have merchandise to offer her customers.  Her dreams and hopes are that her daughters study.  The group members thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loans and for their help in supporting their business’ growth.

loans.use: to buy candy, popsicles, women's, men's and children's shoes to fill orders.

loans.name: Darryl

texts.en:
Darryl is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Darryl is providing motorcycle or "motorela" transport services . He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Darryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Darryl hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 19-year-old single woman from Madab, Jordan. She has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more products for the store.

Majd is looking to improving her store and widen the variety of products she sells.

Due to culturA. issues, her father is photographed here.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the store.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is very happy with her fist loan from GDMPC; it helps her greatly. She was able to sell the pig she raised, and she paid her loan obligation. Genevieve returned to purchase another piglet to raise.  She is still engaged in this line of business of raising domestic animals - like pigs for sale. She has been in this business for thirteen years. She needs funds to purchase feed for her pigs' fast growth. She earns about PHP16,250 a month.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000.00 again; the purpose of this request is to purchase food for the pigs' fast growth and good nourishment. Genevieve hopes that her business will prosper. She plans to buy more piglets to raise to make a good financial return.

loans.use: To purchase pig food for their fast growth.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 30 años, es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá María su papá Lucio en su cada propia, ubicada en el caserío de Vista Alegre. Desde muy joven sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas y alverja, los que comercializa en la feria de Acostambo los días viernes de cada semana. Cuenta con pequeñas parcelas de terrenos productivos, eso lo molesta, pues ahora trabajará con mayor empeño para tener unos propios y de esa manera adquirir más dinero. Por ahora quiere incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de animales, ya que obtiene mayor ganancia en ello. Hasta ahora cuenta con 15 ovejas, 3 cerdos y 2 asnos; que engordará, para luego comercializarlo a un mayor precio y así aumentar su capital para dinamizar su negocio. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Jatum Llacta” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Víctor, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cabezas de animales para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor, 30, is a responsible son.  He lives with his mother, María, and his father, Lucio, in their own house located in the hamlet of Vista Alegre.  From a very young age his parents taught him how to work the land and live off it.  His main crops are potatoes, lima beans and peas which he sells at the Friday farmer’s market in Acostambo every week.  He has small parcels of productive land.   That bothers him so now he will work even harder to have his own fields to earn more money.  For now, he wants to go into the business of buying and selling animals because he earns more profits from it.  To date, he has 15 sheep, 3 pigs and 2 asses that he will fatten up to then sell at higher prices to increase his capital and make his business more dynamic.

He belongs to the “Jatum Llacta” communal bank and this is the first MFP loan where he hopes to get your support to solidify his plans.  He promises to make his installment payments.  He enjoys being part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  If Víctor were to get your support, he will use the requested money to buy several head of animals to stock his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo, de 37 años convive con Teofila de 30 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 04 hijos quienes son estudiantes. Guillermo, es un hombre muy trabajador, con la ayuda de su pareja tiene una tienda, negocio que lleva 12 años realizando, en la que sus clientes no dudan en comprar sus productos como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, conservas, entre otros. En la tienda de Guillermo la gente va a realizar sus compras desde muy temprano ya que  siempre esta abierta desde las primeras horas del amanecer. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atenderlos con mucha amabilidad, para Guillermo no hay nada difícil ya que lo más importante es poder solventar a su familia y sobre todo con los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Con el tiempo piensa en incrementar su negocio comprando más productos como: arroz, fideos, gaseosas, azúcar. Por tanto éste será su crédito número 13 con MFP, esta muy contento por darles una vez más la oportunidad de seguir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y puntual en las reuniones que se realiza.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá incrementar su tienda comprando más productos como: arroz, fideos, gaseosas, azúcar, galletas.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 37, lives with Teofila, 30. They live in their house with their 4 children, who are all students. Guillermo is a hard worker. With the help of his couple, he has had a store for 12 years. His clients don't hesitate to buy products like: rice, sugar, soft drinks, preserved food, and other products. People buy very early from Guillermo's store since it's open from the early morning hours. What he enjoys most about his work is to provide cordial service to his clients. There is nothing difficult for Guillermo given his priority is to support his family, specially the educational expenses of his children.

With time, he hopes to generate more business by buying more products like: rice, noodles, soft drinks, and sugar. This will be his 13th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP). He is very happy to have this opportunity to satisfy his objectives. In his communal bank, he is very happy and punctual in the meetings. With the 1,500 Nuevos Soles (PEN), he will better stock his store by buying more products like: rice, noodles, soft drinks, sugar, and cookies.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, soft drinks, sugar, and cookies.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men is 32 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province. She is married with four single children. Some of her children are now working in various jobs, including a factory worker and a construction worker. She earns a living by cultivating rice crops along with her spouse. In the past few months, Men bought a plot of farmland from her neighbor to increase her rice fruit for more income, yet she has insufficient capital to pay for the land successfully. For this reason, she is now seeking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for her debt. Money from the loan makes it possible for her to sustain her business and living.

loans.use: to pay for a plot of farmland she bought from her neighbor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Meresel

texts.en: Meresel is 34 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no children. She works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing hooks, gasoline and boat maintenance. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and 4 mos. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing hooks, gasoline and boat maintenance.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a married woman. She has two children who depend on her. She has been farming for a period of five years.

She knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She is a good client and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and to hire manpower to aid on the farm. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabanoh Group

texts.en:
Gbassay is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Gbassay was born in northern Sierra Leone, 19 years ago. Gbassay is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. Gbassay sells toothpastes, toothbrushes, soaps, body lotions, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Gbassay and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Gbassay will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leone Leones) to buy toothpastes, toothbrushes, soaps, body lotions, etc., in a larger quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy toothpastes, toothbrushes, soaps, body lotions, etc., in a larger quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business stock.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman was born in the Shusha region of Azerbaijan, he is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). He is now living in Sumgayit city with his wife and four children. Elman began 11 years ago selling clothing and other apparel items. He currently is applying for a loan to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To expand his business by increasing his inventory

loans.name: Olovesi

texts.en: Olovesi is a 36-year old mother of three children. She makes flavored ice-pops and sells them in her village.  Due to the tropical climate, these cold treats are very popular with Samoan children.  She used an initial SPBD loan to purchase a freezer for her ice-pops.  Now Olovesi has two goals in seeking additional loan funds.  First, she wants to buy bulk ingredients to try out a new secret recipe to differentiate her ice-pops from the others sold in town.  Second, she wants to try making home-made, fresh-squeezed juices and sell these as well.  A loan will help this enterprising woman differentiate her products and grow her sales.

loans.use: Purchase bulk ingredients for ice-pops

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Bartolome has his own store where he sells seafoods and meats. He began his business 3 years ago with money he earned from a business he and selling clothing in different sectors of the city. He helps his wife from his stationary store starting at mid-day, and he has seen his business grow with time because of it's good location.

Loan Use

He wishes to use part of the loan to purchase merchandise and the other part to repair and improve his store in order to give a better service to his customers.

Personal Information

Mr. Bartolome is 40 years old and has four children, who all go to school. His home is made of cement. His goal to to see his business grow and one day to hand over his business to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

El señor Bartolomé tiene un local donde vende mariscos y carnes, su negocio inicio hace 3 años con un capital que obtuvo con un negocio de ropa la misma que la vendía en diferentes lugares de la cuidad, en su local le ayuda su esposa a partir del medio día, su negocio a crecido con el pasar del tiempo ya que su ubicación es buena.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar parte de su préstamo para comprar mercadería y otra parte para adecuar su local ya que su intención es dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes

Información Personal

El Señor Bartolomé tiene 40 años y 4 hijos de los cuales tres están estudiando, su vivienda es de cemento, sus metas es que su local crezca y un día sean sus hijos quienes administren su negocio

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to improve his store.

loans.name: Shokat

texts.en: Shokat is 52 years old and lives in Yenikand village with her husband and four children. She has run her own farm for the past 14 years, and has used the income it generates to care for her family and raise her children. Shokat has requested a loan of $475 to buy pesticides and fertilizer, which she will use to improve the size and quality of her crops.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Osana

texts.en: Osana T. is 36 years of age, married with 5 children. Her husband works for a building company in town. Her husband’s salary is not enough to support their family. Osana decided to do something to support the family and to occupy her time. Having lived in the village for a long time, and also living close to the school, she decided to start an ice cake business. Her business is running well and Osana is a happy mother in the Levi Center. She is earning good money and she is developing her family and building an outdoor bathroom and washing place for the family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: I am a newly wedded girl called Abida from a small city Arifwala, Pakistan. I do not go out and work as it is not considered acceptable in the society I live in. My husband is a scrap dealer. He collects various used items and spare parts on his bicycle from different parts of the city. He then sells these things to various scrap yards in the city. At present, his income is very small. Therefore, he wishes to expand his business by buying a large amount of scrap items. Please lend him $200 for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase used goods in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Kheweul Group

texts.fr:
This group of entrepreneurs which calls itself Kheweul has initiated its own special program in the fight against poverty. We intend to sell hand-dyed cloth (batiks) produced by group members. Starting up this joint venture is the reason why we are asking for a loan which will allow us to better care for ourselves and our families by increasing our income and at the same time allow us to protect our environment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Le groupement Kheweul, dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, a initié un programme qui lui est propre; Il s'agit, de la vente des produits de teinture fabriquées par les membres dudit groupement. C'est a cette ocasion que le groupement sollicite un prêt qui leurs permettra de mieux s'occuper, de faire des recettes pour le soutien des familles et aussi pour la protection de leurs environnements.

loans.use:
Sale of local handicrafts (batiks)

Vente de produits artistiques locaux (Tissu batick)

loans.name: Leslie Aime

texts.es:
The young lady Leslie Aime belongs to a communal bank called El Breo. She lives in the region called San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and in district of Juanjui. She devotes herself to the sale of watches and gifts, and the business is located in Jr. Huallaga, number 689.

She needs the loan of 3,000 Peruvian Soles, which she will pay off in six months; she will buy gifts and watches in bulk in order to increase her inventory and sales.

Leslie is 27 years old. She lives with her husband who is supportive of her and knows how to fix the watches. Another reason why people go to their business is because her husband knows how to repair watches. Together they are getting ahead because the business currently has two locations. That goes to show that Leslie Amie’s goals have no limits, and that with hard work and dedication she can achieve all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leslie Aime pertenece al banco comunal El Breo. Vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica al comercio de venta de relojes y regalos y el negocio está ubicado en Jr. Huallaga No. 689.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará regalos y relojes en cantidad para aumentar su producto.

La señora Leslie tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo quien la apoya, ya que él sabe arreglar relojes, es por eso también que los clientes van a su negocio. Juntos están saliendo adelante porque actualmente tiene dos establecimientos del negocio, demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir metas no hay límites y que se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Buy gifts and watches

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.en:
Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas have been members of the community bank “Minke” for five years. In that time they have learned to be punctual and responsible and how to best invest their money.

Alberta is 41 years old. She is separated from her husband and has five children. Alberta sells shish kabobs from her home. She also runs a boarding house for travelers. In addition, Alberta has a small store where she sells food staples such as rice, sugar, and flour.

Beatriz is 38 years old. She a single mother and has two children. Beatriz sells “chicha”, which is a type of juice made from purple corn. She sells the chicha from a cart on a busy intersection in the city of Ayacucho. She also sells her juice at all of the festivals held in the city. Recently her sales have been down, and she plans to start renting a space to use as a store.

Felicitas is 48 years old. She is married and has five children. Felicitas sells candy and fruit during the day. In the evenings she sells “salchipollos” which is a popular fast food dish made from topping french fries with scrambled eggs and chicken.

Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas are asking for loans of 1600, 400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1). Alberta, Beatriz, and Felicitas plan to use their savings to buy land and build homes. Their dreams are to own homes, to develop their businesses, and to provide for their children.

loans.use: To invest in sugar, rice, milk, oil, soft drinks, beer, corn, cookies, candies, and meat.

loans.name: Asiasiaga

texts.en: Running a shop for over six and a half years has heped this member pay off all her loans, and it has improved her business. Asiasiga is a married woman who has two grownup children. Her shop is located in her village, and it’s open from the wee hours in the morning until late at night, because she has a lot of clients. She is one of our very good clients who has shown so much effort in the program and is still going strong. Her personality has kept her relationship with her clients. So with her requested loan, she will buy more stock (inventory) for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her retail shop

loans.name: Marcela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Marcela M. has owned a general store in the South San Rafael municipality of Managua for the past 15 years. She runs the store, which she has developed bit by bit over the years. She is a widowed mother, and is responsible for her school-age son.

Despite the difficult circumstances that Marcela has come across in her life, she has been able to come out ahead, thanks to her efforts and the support provided by Ceprodel in the form of loans. Today, she returns to the institution in order to benefit from a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise to sell in her general store.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la señora Marcela M. desde hace quince largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería del cual es dueña y ha venido desarrollando poco a poco a través de los años. Es madre viuda y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su hijo en edad escolar.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que ha atravesado en la vida, ha logrado salir adelante y lo ha hecho gracias a sus esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel en la entrega de créditos. Hoy en día una vez mas acude a esta institución para ser beneficiada con los créditos que le permitan la compra de su mercadería para ofertarla en su negocio de pulpería en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Damascus 2025-8 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Rose W.. She is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a builder. Rose has 4 children ranging from age 2 to 20, and her children go to school. Rose sells bread, and each week she makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds ($US 49.00) in profits. With the additional profits from her loan, she hopes to open a bakery .

Rose is joined in her small group by Betty K., Roda J., Rose W., and Jenty A.. Betty K. sells bread and wants to use the loan to construct a house. Roda J. and Rose W. sell local beer and each wants the loan to open a bar. Jenty A. runs a hotel and is requesting a loan to open lodgings.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: open up bakery

loans.name: Flor Marleni

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor Marleni F. M. is a member of the interim credit group "Las Flores de María" (Mary's Flowers), and lives in San Martín in the Morales district. She dedicates herself to selling eggs, and also runs a business selling goods that her customers request, like detergent, bleach, toilet paper, ground coffee and charcoal. She runs her store out of her home in the San Martín neighborhood. Her daily customers are also her neighbors from the area.

She told us that she began selling undergarments, but due to her lack of experience, it didn't go very well. As she is optimistic and persevering, though, she decided to change her business, thanks to her mother's push, encouraging her to try something new, as well as her need to generate some income to cover the household expenses and her children's education. She saw that her neighborhood lacked general stores, and since she didn't have a better plan, she started up her business and began to run it a little at a time.

With this loan for $275 that will be repaid in four monthly payments, she will buy cartons of eggs and other products that she needs, including bleach, detergent, toilet paper, charcoal, and whole bean coffee to roast and grind which will then be sold to her customers. This product in particular sells well since most vendors sell ground coffee that's been prepared chemically and put in envelopes.

She is 27 years old and has three children, who are her inspiration to keep moving forward and to fight for her goals. She demonstrates assuredness and self-confidence as her customer base continues to increase, and by taking to heart their suggestions she is able to expand her business little by little as its manager. One of her goals for the near future is to expand and stock her store such that her customers are able to find everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Flor Marleni F. M., es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Flores de Maria” vive en la Región San Martín, provincia San Martín, distrito de Morales, se dedica a la venta de huevos, además implementa su negocio con productos que le piden sus clientes como detergentes, lejía, papel higiénico, café molido y carbón, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su propia casa del Jr. Sucre Nº 61 Barrio San Martín del mismo distrito, sus clientes que diariamente acuden a comprar son los vecinos de su barrio. Ella manifestó que se inicio vendiendo ropa interior pero por la falta de experiencia no le fue muy bien, y como ella es una persona optimista y perseverante decidió cambiar de negocio, gracias a la iniciativa de su mamá quien la motivo a probar de nuevo, además tenia la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su familia y de la educación de sus menores hijos. Ella vio que en su barrio no hay muchas bodegas no tuvo mejor idea que empezar su negocio de esta manera y que poco a poco esta implementando. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que pagará en 4 cuotas mensuales, comprará huevos en casilleros, y demás productos que vende como: lejía, detergente en cajas, papel higiénico, carbón, café en granos para tostar y moler, luego ser vendidos a sus clientes, por que este, es un producto que tiene buena salida, en vista que la mayoría de negociantes lo venden en sobres y preparados químicamente. Tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, quienes la motivan a seguir adelante y luchando por sus metas y objetivos, ella demuestra tener mucha seguridad y confianza en si misma por que sus clientes va en aumento y de acuerdo a las sugerencias de ellos va implementando poco a poco su negocio, pues ella es quien la maneja, una de sus metas en un futuro cercano es ampliar y surtir su negocio, para que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase eggs wholesale. Buy various cleaning products.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with a 6-year-old child. She became a clothes seller in 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Selina now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is 25 years old and married. Since 2004, she has worked at her own small general store where she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zena now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her stock.

loans.name: Alicia Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Agustina U. A. tiene cuarenta y ocho años y vive en el caserío Buenos Aires del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La  Libertad  Perú.
Alicia Agustina estudió primaria completa pero no contó con apoyo económico para poder continuar.
Tiene su pareja desde los treintaicuatro años y de ese compromiso tiene dos hijas y dos hijos los aun son estudiantes.
Tiene una bodega y también compra ovejas y cerdos, los que los vende en carne, es una mujer muy dinámica por lo que no realiza un solo tipo de negocio, también fabrica pan en horno de leña  y es el mejor de la zona.
Manuela Ramos le prestó 300 soles por primera ves con los que amplió su negocio, devolvió el préstamo en cuatro meses y fue muy cumplida.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000 soles, el cual será  pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará animales para venderlos al por menor (carne) y artículos para su bodega. 
Ella manifiesta estar muy agradecida del Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le enseño a disciplinar su vida y administrar bien su negocio.
Alicia Agustina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache.
Sueña con tener una gran bodega con la que pueda abastecer a todo su caserío y aledaños.
texts.en:
Ms. Alicia Agustina U. A. is a 48-year-old woman who lives in the Buenos Aires residential development in the Mache district, in the Otuzco province, in La Libertad Perú. Alicia Agustina finished elementary school but was unable to continue her studies due to a lack of financial support. She and her 34-year-old partner have two daughters and two sons, who are all in school. She owns a general store and also buys sheep and pigs, which she sells as meat. She is a very dynamic woman which is why she does not only dedicate herself to one type of business. She also makes bread using a wood-burning oven, and she is the best in the zone. Manuela Ramos lent her 300 PEN the first time, with which she expanded her business. She repaid the loan in 4 months and was very punctual. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be rapaid in 4 installments, she will purchase goods for her general store and livestock to be sold as retail meat. She says that she is very appreciative of the Manuela Ramos movement because it has helped her to lead a disciplined life and administer her business well. Alicia Agustina is a member of the Mujeres de Mache (Women of Mache) microfinance institute. She dreams of having a large general store that will meet the needs of not only her residential development, but also the ones in surrounding areas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock for meat and assorted goods for general store

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Christina M. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependant because her parents can not take care of her. Christina has been running a cloth material and tailoring business since 2003. She works at the business for eight hours a day, six days a week and is assisted by her husband. Christina currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase an additional sewing machine and additional stocks of cloth. Christina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Amir M.aslam Group

texts.en:
Amir baji is the wife of M., and they reside in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. Amir baji is 27 years old, and she has a 3-year-old daughter. Amir baji’s husband is a driver by profession: specifically, he drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle), and he has been in this line of business for the past 25 years.

Meanwhile, Amir baji herself is a seamstress by trade, but she proudly states that she dutifully performs her duties as both a wife and mother. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he can keep all of his earnings (rather than pay over much of his earnings to the rickshaw's owner). Amir baji is joined in her loan group by three other members: Safia baji seeks a loan to buy leather for her (car) seat-making business; Muniran baji requests a loan to buy materials (e.g., colored threads and sketches) for her carpet-making business; and Zareena baji would like a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To increase her husband's business' profitability by purchasing a rickshaw (rather than continuing to rent a rickshaw)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad Francisca, aun convive con el padre de sus seis hijos, de los cuales cinco viven con ella. Las manos agrietadas de Francisca son muestras de una mujer que labra la tierra tan igual como su esposo, se levanta a la 4.00 am preparar el menú del día y luego alistar a sus hijos para la escuela, a eso de las 9.00am carga el almuerzo sobre sus hombros con destino a la chacra. A ella le agrada su labor, comenta que anteriormente gastaban más en los fertilizantes, pero ahora con la asesoría de un agrónomo están más orientados sobre qué remedios deba utilizar en sus sembríos. 
El año pasado han invertido 400 soles en remedios y ahora con la misma cantidad de siembra solo invirtió 280 soles, gracias a la orientación del agrónomo. Ella está muy feliz y ahora que va a sembrar nuevamente papa lo hará con los insecticidas que le recomienda el profesional. Es la cuarta vez que Francisca tiene un préstamo con MFP, y en los pagos no tuvo dificultades. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de remedios y abonos, ya que tiene la semilla lista y sin el abono no hay siembra.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, Francisca still lives with the father of her six children, 5 of which live with her. Francisca's cracked hands are a sign of a woman who works the land as hard as her husband. She gets up at 4:00am to prepare the meal for the day and then get her children ready for school. At 9:00am she carries the lunch up on her shoulders, heading to the farm. She appreciates her work, and comments that she previously spent more on fertilizers, but now with the consultancy of an agronomist they are more focused on what alternative products she should use in her crops. Last year she invested 400 Soles in products and now, with the same quantity of seeds, she only invested 280 Soles thanks to the guidance of the agronomist. She is very happy and now that she is going to plant potatoes again, she will do it with the insecticides that the professional recommends. This is the fourth time Francisca has a loan with MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA, a Kiva field partner), and has not had difficulty with her payments. The money she is now requesting is to purchase the alternative products and fertilizers, since she already has the seeds ready and without the fertilizer she will not have a crop.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and medicine for her crops

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Née le  07 Décembre 1972, Mme Essi B. est mariée à un charpentier et est mère de trois (03) enfants. N’ayant appris un métier après avoir abandonné ses études, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de « cuire dents », un bois très prisé et habituellement utilisé en Afrique pour se brosser les dents. Cette activité lui rapporte beaucoup de bénéfices lui permettant de faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Pour augmenter encore davantage ses revenus et mieux satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite un crédit pour afin d’aller s’approvisionner suffisamment dans les pays voisins notamment au Ghana où ce bois abonde.
texts.en:
Born on December 7, 1972, Mrs. Essi B. is married to a carpenter and the mother of 3 children. Having never learned a job after dropping out of school, she started selling "cuire dents" (a wood used to make chewing sticks), a wood highly sought after in Africa and used to clean one's teeth. This business brings in a great deal and enable her to provide for her family. To increase her income and to better meet customer demand, she's seeking a loan to purchase sufficient supplies in the surrounding countries, in particular in Ghana where this wood is found aplenty.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies of "cuire dents" (a wood used to make chewing sticks)

loans.name: Aiub

texts.ru: Аюв мужчина в возрасте 51 года , отец троих детей.Жена домохозяйка.Сам Аюб работает кассиром в колхозе района Утконсой.С молодости Аюб занимается откормом и продажей скота.На данный момент у него дома  4 коровы и 10 коз.Жена Аюба занимается продажей козьей шерсти.Из-за сезонности Аюб хочет закупить скот.Ему понадобилось 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Aiub, 51, is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker and Aiub works as a cashier at a collective farm in Utkonskiy region. Since his youth, Aiub has been raising and selling cattle. At present, he has 4 cows and 10 goats. Aiub's wife sells goat wool. Aiub needs this loan to purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Tujisaidie Group

texts.en:
A clothing and bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for the past four years, Riziki works at her business for 16 hours per day, currently earning an average monthly profit of $80. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more clothes for her business, hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business, save money for future use and pay her children’s school fees.

Riziki, 46 years old, is divorced and has five children aged 20, 9, 6, 5 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Salma and Mwanakhamis, each of whom has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sai Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Sái Thị V. năm nay 45 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang đi học  tại xã Tân Hưng huyện Sóc Sơn  Hà Nội. Chị V. là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1996. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị V. đều đang chăn nuôi lợn, vịt, cá tại gia đình. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư cốn mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Sái Thị V. is 45 years old. She is living with her husband and two school-aged children in Tân Hưng village, Sóc Sơn district, Hà Nội. Ms. V. has been a patron of TYM Fund since 1996. Today, the couple are raising pigs, ducks, and fish. This is also the family's main source of income providing 5,000,000 VND per month. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND to purchase animal feed for their livestock rearing activities.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed for rearing livestock

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 56 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their eight children. Mona has been selling home accessories products for four years. She sells coffee cups, mugs, dishes and a lot of other products. Mona requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. This is the first time that Mona has requested a loan. 
Mona is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to work and supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving by purchasing a shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie V. is a 38-year-old mother of six who lives in Pandan, Antique Province.  Pandan located on the coast at the north end of Antique, on the Philippine island of Panay.  The area's economy is heavily dependent on fishing, farming, and trade.  Virgie has four daughters and two sons; the eldest is an 18-year-old daughter who attends high school, and the youngest is a five-year-old son who's not in school yet.  Her husband, Rodgrigo, is a carpenter.

Virgie's main source of income comes from selling firewood and bamboo, the latter is used as a construction material.  She's been doing this for about three years.  Virgie also earns money by preparing and selling dried nipa leaves, which are used as roofing; nipa is a kind of palm tree that grows in wet, swampy areas.  Virgie plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more firewood and bamboo for resale.

Virgie hopes she'll be able to send her children to college some day.  She also would like to have enough money to be able to build a more durable house for her family.

loans.use: To buy firewood and bamboo for resale.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin has been selling car accessories since 1995. He also sells car cleaning products. Yasin is known for the quality of his merchandise. His clients are his friends and neighbors. His business has been successful from the start. Yasin is 25 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his parents. 

Yasin has requested a loan of $1500 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories and cleaning products

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Назралиев Зафар проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Зафар имеет торговую точку на рынке "Мехргон". Он занимается торговлей. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается более 3 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы закупить сезонные овощи для прожажи.
texts.en:
Zafar N. lives in the Yavan district. He is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Zafar has a vendor space at the Mehrgon market where he sells vegetables. He has worked in this type of business for over three years. He is requesting a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Dumy Evangelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dumy S. R. is from the San Agustin district of San Estanislao. She has two children. Additionally, she is the owner of a hair salon which she runs from her home. She has many of the tools she needs and has a well-established clientele, which generates a good income.

This client is applying for a loan in order to buy articles for her hair salon in order to meet the needs of her clients. She hopes to increase her clientele and, through this, her income.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for her hair salon

loans.name: Zouhir

texts.en:
Zouhir is 40 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bint Jbeil. Zouhir has been working as a stone carver for 15 years. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a car for his work. This is the first time that Zouhir has requested a loan.

Zouhir is successful in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Zouhir set up as a stone carver because he had experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business into a new region.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his work

loans.name: Ruthcel

texts.en:
Ruthcel Y. is from the town of Aloran. She is thirty-two years old and married with three school-age children. To make a living, Ruthcel owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Ruthcel has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately $110 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ruthcel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Норкулбой

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Норкулбой – мужчина , который занимается откормом и продажей скота. Он сам работает в колхозе на поле по поливу урожайной земли. Вместо денег колхоз платит ему продуктами питания, поэтому он имеет доход с животноводства. На полученный кредит Норкулбой планирует купить ещё пять молодых баранов и откормив их продать с прибылью.

loans.use: отком и продажа скота

loans.name: Kamela

texts.en:
Kamela and her son, Issam, own a small piece of land they use to plant vegetables, especially eggplant and tomatoes. They started planting the land two years ago in order to increase their income. Since Issam is an employee and getting married, but his salary is not enough to cover daily expenses, they thought of planting the land to increase their income.

Kamila appears in the photo taking care of her plants.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita E. 58 years old and a widowed, says that their life is the picture of a very poor family. Because of lack of income their children get a low level of education. Her eldest son Jonathan 34 years old finishes a vocational course but now working as a farmer, Salvacion the only daughter age 31 attain only grade 3 in primary level, and the youngest is Jose 20 years old not finish high school, they have their own family right now.

Before sources of their income is comes from selling different kinds of vegetables that gives them a small income that is not enough for their daily expenses. When Clarita joined in Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she used the loan that she gets to put up a hog fattening or raising feeds business. Comes from the revenue of that business that she saves, she put up another business which is variety store. Now, the two businesses are now giving her income that helps her whole family. But she wants this business to grow, so she decided to use her second loan in ASHI to buy things that needed in her two businesses like piglet and feeds for the piglet, rice, canned goods, detergent, soap and other groceries.

Clarita is really caring for his children and their family, she wants to help them in her simple way. That’s why she is concentrating in her business so it can give her more income for them.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and hog fattening (pig raising) business

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie C. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 40 years old. Josie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Josie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and to be able to engage in expanded business activities. Josie is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Earlou Rey

texts.en:
Earlou Rey R. is from the village of Barangay 6, Gingoog City. He is 26 years old, is married, and has one infant child.

Earlou Rey owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling fruit "lanzones" in the local community. He has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Earlou Rey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina M. is currently in the business of selling fresh fried fish on the street during evening hours. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies of tomatoes and onions to sell.  Sabina is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. Sabina has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase supplies tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Nanett

texts.es:
La señora Nanett, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Nanett, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, es una mujer que poco a poco, fue incrementando su negocio y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Aleydith, vende sus productos de belleza de diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. También se dedica a la venta de golosinas, ubicada en su misma casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá, en la compra de golosinas como: bolsas de  caramelos, chupetines, chocolates. 

Nanett,  a su edad es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nanett is a member of the “Mujeres de la Colina II” community bank, in the district of La Banda de Shilcayo, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is 39 years old, lives with a partner, and has two dependent children. Nanett’s business is cosmetics sales. She been growing her business little by little and getting known by more clients. The business is going well. She sells several beauty product lines, such as Unique, Esika, and Avon, and is happy with the results. Nanett also sells candies from her home. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase beauty products for her stock, such as perfumes for women and men, creams, compacts, lipstick, nail polish, and also another display case. She will also invest part of the money in candies, such as bags of caramels, suckers, and chocolates. Nanett, at her age, is setting an example for many women who start a business and, with perseverance, achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for helping her start her and other women start and grow their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: T. Evelyne

texts.fr: A. T. Evelyne  est née en 1949 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Evelyne vit depuis environs 20 ans à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. C’est une veuve qui a six enfants à charge, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Evelyne vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Evelyne n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Evelyne vend depuis près de 15 ans, des céréales (maïs, etc.) à son domicile, et aussi par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Evelyne s’approvisionne. Evelyne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’accroître davantage son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en ces période de préparation des fêtes de fin d’année, Evelyne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Evelyne T. A. was born in 1949 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has lived in Cadjèhoun in Cotonou for the last 20 years. She is a widow with six children in her care, four of whom are her own children. Some of these children attend school. Evelyne lives on her own with the children and she alone provides for them. She herself did not go to school. In order to cover their daily needs, for the last 15 years Evelyne has sold cereals (e.g., corn) from her home and also through the distribution system. She stocks up in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Evelyne is a former client of Kiva Field Partner, ALIDé, having already received two loans that she has repaid without any problem. In order to grow her business and increase her sales leading up to the year-end holiday period, Evelyne is asking for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50-kilogram sacks of corn

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is from the village of Pandan Camiguin Province. She is 37 years old. Fe is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business . 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anayo Bethrand

texts.en: Mr. O. was born in Enugu, Nigeria but now works in the Kégué region of Lomé, Togo. He works selling spare auto parts and has been in the business for over a year.  He is married and has one child. This will be his first loan with WAGES. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of auto parts for resale. The profits from this loan will help Mr. O. reinvest in his business and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of spare auto parts

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
R. Abdukayum is 42 years old. He is married with three children. Abdukayum is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the raising and sale of large livestock at the local market. 

Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today Abdukayum is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 4,000 Somoni (TJS) in his business. In order to receive this amount, Abdukayum has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education. Mary cooks banku and okra soup for sale at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a teacher. Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize for her banku business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to build a house.
 
To prepare her banku, she makes sure she gets her corn dough (maize that has been milled and left to prove. After milling the maize, is not used immediately but left until the following day before it can be used.) and cassava dough.
She makes a mixture with the cassava and corn dough in a porridge form, stirs on fairly hot heat for sometime to get a firm but fine texture, firm enough to be eaten.

The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce of your taste such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind. 

She wasn't cooking as at the time the picture was taken. She was therefore asked to demonstrate how the Banku is prepared.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize for her banku business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old and operates a butcher shop, and he also sells plastic items. He employs two people. He worked as a driver before he started his current businesses which have been running for four years.  He also earns extra income from farming.   Since he joined Faulu Kenya, which is a partner of Kiva, he is able to meet his financial obligations.  

He previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES, and he plans to take out a loan of 40,000 KES to buy meat, buckets and basins to add to his stock.  He hopes to open another butcher shop in the future.  He dreams of creating employment for ten more people.  He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add to his stock of meat, buckets and basins

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
"El banco de Emprendimiento BELEN, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias  como presidenta esta:

La Sr. Claudia quien es la lider del grupo tiene 2 hijos pequeños, como negocio tiene la venta de comida  en la Av. S., es una persona responsable y dinamica, el dinero del grupo lo uyilizara para la compra de viveres.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra. Maria del Carmen quien es casada y tiene su negocio de artezanias en las fiestas patronales es una de las socias mas antiguas y que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, el dinero del credito es para la compra de herramientas para la realizacion de sus productos.

La Secretaria es la Srta. Eliana  quie es soltera y tiene su negocio una tienda de barrio  en su propio domicilio es una persona joven y muy activa, el dinero del credito es para la compra de refrescos y asi poder surtir su tienda.

Es un grupo muy responsable en sus pagos, viven en un mismo Barrio, donde se conocen bien, las socias que son estrictas en su cobranza, son muy unidas entre ellas. Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Belen Communal Bank is in their third cycle. It is comprised of responsible and hard-working people. This bank is represented by the following members. The president is: Claudia is the leader of the group. She has two small children. Her business is selling food on S. Avenue. She is a responsible and dynamic person. She will use the money from the group to buy supplies. The treasurer is Maria del Carmen. She is married, and her business is making handicrafts for the national holidays. She is one of the oldest members, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments. The money from the loan is to buy tools to make her products. Eliana is the secretary. She is single, and her business is a neighborhood store in her house. She is a very active young person. The money from the loan is to buy soft drinks in order to be able to stock her store. It is a group that is very responsible with their payments. They live in the same neighborhood, and they know each other well. The members are strict about their collections, and they are very united. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is 45-years old married woman. She belongs to a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Her husband name is J. A. who runs a beauty salon in the community. He specifically deals with men. He offers his services by cutting and facial treatments. He has two workers in his salon and he pays them on monthly basis. 

Nowadays he has short by some facial products and his services has become limited just on hair cutting. So She is applying for a loan to buy those items so that her husband able to start the work and earn good income.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Shazia wants a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, tube lights) for her electric shop. Sakina wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.use: To buy the facial products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice and beans for her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Juana es casada, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Juana se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Orcasitas.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Los sueños de Juana son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de los Milagros” (Lord of the Miracles). She is 51 years old, married, and has seven children. Juana manages a handmade brick business in the community of Orcasitas.

She needs a loan of 1000 PEN so that she can pay her workers. Juana dreams of improving her business and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her workers

loans.name: Apai

texts.en:
Apai Frabchiska is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, sugar, and charcoal,  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Apai is 46 years old and is widowed.   She has seven children, and three of  her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family and pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Enrique Rafael

texts.es: El Sr. Enrique   tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente, su conyugue se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una moto taxi el cual presta servcio de trasnporte urbano en el ambito de la ciudad, el se dedica a este negocio hace 8 años  se inicio como chofer, ellos viven en la casa de sus suegros, casa de campo, ellos tienen metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder adquirir mas vehiculos, con el dinero que solicitan invertiran en el mantenimiento de su moto taxi.
texts.en:
Enrique, 28, lives with his life partner; his spouse is a farmer. He has a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to provide passenger and cargo transportation services) with which he provides urban transportation services in the city. He has been in this line of work for 8 years; he started out as a driver. They live in their inlaws’ house which is out in the country. They have goals and objectives one of which is to own more vehicles. They will use the requested funds to for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Kaniza's Group

texts.en: Kaniza is the wife of A. A.. They live in a three-room house with their four children in Borewala, city of shrines, in Pakistan. Both husband and wife are very hardworking. They operate their own businesses and their children stay at home with their grandparents. Kaniza has an animal sales business. She buys young animals, grows them, and sells them at a profit. Her husband is involved in selling clothes, He buys clothes from Faisalabad (which is famous for its textile industry) and sells them in different markets of the city. Kaniza is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest in her husband’s business because he wants to vary his stock with high-quality fabrics which can make him more money.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty J. lives in the village of Manticao in Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Betty makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) retail store where she sells food and other products people buy daily. She has been in this line of work for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a new loan for 5,000 PHP which she will use to buy additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue made possible by the loan to continue to expand her small shop. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her field and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all of them are at school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She owns a stall in Kasubi market selling second-hand clothes.   She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda and uses public transport to and from shopping.  She has been in this business for ten years.  She has no additional income. 

Sarah sells to all  categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living.  Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She is aspiring of building her own house.  Sarah Joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. She  resides in  and rents a two-roomed  house and the family has  electricity  but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses  are  school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: 02.01.15 Group

texts.en:
Nhu H. T. (51) is a 61-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Nhu is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 15 (02.01.15).


Nhu is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Nhu operates a family member's business raising cattL. for saL..  Nhu has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Nhu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nhu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nhu from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nhu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Oanh (10) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  T. T. De (25) is a 34-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  H. T. Hoi (39) is a 27-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nhu H. T. (51) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Nhu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 15 (02.01.15).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Nhu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nhu kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2006, Nhu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nhu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. oanh (10) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  T. T. de (25) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  H. T. Hoi (39) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame B. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high school. Her husband is a driver.

Maame sells slippers by moving from one area to another at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase additional slippers to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to invest in the cooking of rice for sale which is going to serve as an additional trade.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Ney Laurentino

texts.es:
Ney de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas, tiene un puesto de venta de encebollado (plato típico del ecuador). 

Desde pequeño el comenzó a preparar encebollado para tener su propio negocio. Con esfuerzo obtuvo un puesto de comida en una principal comercial. Poco a poco a mantenido a su familia, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 00h00pm. El encebollado contiene pescado, cebollas, yucas, llevar, es común en el desayuno.    

Para poder hacer mas encebollado el quiere comprar con el préstamo pescado y un congelador. En el futuro quiere tener un local y ser reconocido en el mercado de comidas típicas.
texts.en:
Ney is 36 years old and lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas,” (The Orchids) named so because there were many orchids in the area when it was first discovered. He has a food stall where he sells “encebollado” (a typical Ecuadorean dish). He’s been cooking encebollado since he was very young, so that he could have his own business. With great effort, he obtained his food stall in a main commercialized zone. Little by little he’s been able to support his family. He works from 8:00 AM to midnight. Encebollado is made with fish, onions, and yucca and is a common breakfast food. He wants to use the money from this loan to buy more fish and a freezer. In the future he wants to have a small eatery and become known in the food market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish and refrigerator

loans.name: Miriam
