Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir ropa y subir sus ventas.

loans.use: To Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en: Solmaz Q., 56, is a very active and passionate woman. She started her business in 1986 and since that time she's become a well-experienced and skilled woman and many people of her village come to ask her advice about keeping livestock. Her primary activity is to sell dairy products and calves for meat production. Solmaz find herself more dedicated to selling dairy products and she would like to expand her activity in this filed. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of $800 USD. She will use this loan to purchase a cow for milking. Let's help her reach her goals!

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milking

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Anna M. from Mbeya. She is widowed and has three children between the ages of 14 and 20. Anna has been selling rice since 2007. She buys rice from farmers and sells it in towns. She works at the business for eight hours a day, six days a week and is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $325 USD to purchase additional rice. Anna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.en: S. Tavakal always feels great satisfaction when people enjoy his delicious fruits and vegetables, since he puts enormous effort into growing them. He possesses beautiful land where he grows his crops in the company of his family, which is the reason why he works the way he does. He is proud of his farm because it has allowed him to feed and educate his children. Tavakal is aware of the needs of his family, and for this reason wants to open a grocery store in his house, so that this new business can cover part of the family’s daily expenses. In order to achieve this wish, he is seeking a loan to increase his production of wheat and potatoes. Please consider supporting Tavakal’s goal of improving his life and the life of his wife and family members.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a woman who is contented with her simple life in her community. She lives with her three children: Riden, who is 18 years old; Imee, who is 17 years old; and Joseph, who is 16 years old. Her children only finished their education through high school because she could not afford to send them to college. Soledad's husband is Elger. He is a farmer in their village. They enjoy living in Antagan because it is peaceful and rich in agricultural land with a good water supply. A sufficient supply of water is essential for their farming business.

The family farms rice and corn. Their rice field is located in the lowland while their corn field is in the upland.

Because of the ever-changing price of farm inputs, they sometimes cannot afford them. Soledad has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to help maintain the farm. The loan will enable her to purchase their needed inputs. Some of the loan will also be used to compensate the laborers who help them during the planting season.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 37 años, es madre de 2 hijos y vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, pan, entre otros productos de consumo masivo) en la tienda que implementó en su casa, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace un año, y le gusta mucho atender al público y hacer amigos. En su zona es la única que vende estos productos, por lo que son sus vecinos sus principales clientes. Con éste, ya son 12 créditos que obtiene María de MFP, y se ha caracterizado por ser una clienta muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita ampliará su bodega y la ambientará adecuadamente para que sea más atractiva a la vista y tenga una buena distribución de sus productos.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old, has two children and lives with her husband who helps her as much as he can. She sells staples such as rice, milk, and bread in the store she opened in her home. She has been doing this for a year and she enjoys taking care of the public and making friends. She is the only one selling these products in her area, and her clients are her neighbours. This will be the 12th loan María has received from MFP and she has always been very punctual with her payments. She will use the loan to expand her store, to decorate it so that it will be more attractive, and to better display her wares.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Saidamir

texts.en:
Saidamir U. is 49 years old. He is married with 4 children. Four years ago, Saidamir decided to start his own business selling carpets. Saidamir began his business with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many customers, and his business keeps growing. In order to increase the range of carpets he has on offer, he now needs a loan in the amount of 2000 Somoni which he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repaying this amount within 11 months. Be a part of this business and of Saidamir's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of carpets in his inventory

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu H. makes and sells a corn drink at Abura. Adamu has received no formal education.  She is single and has no children. Adamu has been selling this corn drink for about 4 years. She is responsible for paying paying rent, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more corn to increase the sale of corn drinks to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest for the expansion of  her little business.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her buy more corn

loans.name: Thi Ngung

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Ngừng  năm nay 55  tuổi, gia đình chị có hai con đã trưởng thành và có việc làm ổn định. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ đầu năm 2007. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều chăn nuôi và trồng trọt tại nhà. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị  là 2.000.000.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 2 con bò giống về nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thi Ngung, 55 years old, has 2 grown-up children who already have stable jobs. Mrs. Ngung joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Currently, both her husband and her rear cattle and grow vegetables at home. Her family's monthly income is 2 millions VND. This time, she would like to borrow 9 millions VND to purchase 2 more cows to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cows

loans.name: Koumba

texts.fr:
Madame  Koumba C. est âgée de 45 ans,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit chez son   époux  avec ses  enfants au quartier Pelengana Sud  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Aide soignante de profession, elle s’est initiée au  commerce par l’entremise d’un commerçant de la place pour qui elle vendait en détail et en ambulant des habits et ventilateurs  pendant plusieurs années. Forte de cette riche expérience elle décida  de s’installer à son propre compte depuis maintenant  8 ans en menant les mêmes activités. Elle jouit d’une grande  réputation et notoriété car ses marchandises hautes de gamme sont très prisées et ses clients sont très nombreux.
Dans l’intention de renforcer son activité afin de réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en relation depuis 4 ans. Après  4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème  prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 20 paires de chaussures et 20 pièces de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières en Guinée Conakry. Madame  Koumba C. vend au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et aider son mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
Son ambition est d’ouvrir un magasin de stockage de céréales à Ségou.
texts.en:
Mrs. Koumba C., 45, is married and the mother of 3 children; she lives with her husband and children in the Pelengana Sud district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Practical nurse by profession, she got into the business world through a merchant where she lives, for whom she used to sell, retail and door-to-door, clothing and fans for several years. With this excellent experience, she decided to set herself up in the same sort of business 8 years ago. She has a good reputation and is well-known since her first-class merchandise is much sought after and she has numerous customers.

With the intention of bolstering her business so as to make more profit, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is has been working for 4 years. After 4 solidarity loans and 2 individual loans, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her third individual loan.

She intends to use this loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes and 20 lengths of fabric. She does her buying of raw materials in Guinée Conakry. Mrs. Koumba C. sells retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which she will use to reimburse the interest on the lan and help her husband support the family.

Her ambition is to open a warehouse for cereals in Ségou.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase shoes and fabrics for re-sale

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. is forty-two years old. She is married and has two little kids who are currently in the basic school. Akosua lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, a quite appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Akosua is one of these women who actively produces palm oil. She has been in business for five years. Her husband is a farmer.

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the food of the palm fruits which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (thus the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content. She desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruits in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Adehyee Mma” (Translated Royals) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Djiguifa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguifa est constitué de neuf  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 33ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative  de la république du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et d’amitié.
Ce groupe fait essentiellement le commerce de poissons. En plus du poisson certaines d’entre elles font parfois le commerce d’oignon et de bois de chauffe à domicile.
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir remboursé correctement leurs trois premiers prêts solidaires, elles sont à leur 4ème  qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 60 corbeilles correspondant à 900 kg de poisson frais. 
Elles se ravitaillent en poisson sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango. Une partie du poisson est séchée dans un coin de la maison à l’aide d’un séchoir traditionnel et l’autre moitié est vendue à l’état crue. Le poisson ainsi séché est revendu au comptant et en détail dans les foires de Konobougou, Sansanding et Siribala à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles  envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51 000FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt et pour l’épargne. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir chacune un congélateur pour pouvoir conserver le poisson pendant les périodes de mévente.
texts.en:
This Djiguifa group is made up of nine married women, mostly from monogamous families, with an average age of 33 and 4 children, on average. They all live in the Djaka kin neighborhood of Kirango Markala (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and they met because of being neighbors and friends.

This group essentially sells fish. Besides fish, certain of them sometimes sell onions and firewood out of their homes. So as to increase the volume of their money-earning activities, they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having reimbursed their first three solidarity loans correctly, they are on their 4th, which will be used to buy 60 baskets, corresponding to 900 kg of fresh fish.

They buy their fish on the banks of the Niger River at Kirango. Part of the fish is dried in a corner of the house on a traditional dryer and the other half is sold raw. The dried fish is sold retail and on a cash basis in the market fairs of Konobougou, Sansanding and Siribala to a clientele composed mainly of women. They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 51,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and to add to savings. Their ambition is to each have a freezer so that they can keep the fish during periods where sales are slow.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish to sell

loans.name: Amor Y Paz - Group 3

texts.en:
Milagros C. is the group coordinator for this group of five in the Amor y Paz Bank of Hope in San Pedro de Macoris. Some of the people in her community are Haitian immigrants. Because they don't have Dominican documentation and don't speak the language well, their employment opportunities are limited, so they start their own businesses.

Milagros sells different food items at her house. Most of her sales come from basic lunch products like rice, beans, oil, and spices used to flavour food. Usually she sells small quantities from larger amounts that she purchases. She will use this loan to be well stocked in these products in order to meet the demands of her clientele.

One of Milagros' biggest challenges is collecting payments from the customers she sells to on credit. A lot of them get paid weekly or biweekly so it takes longer for her to see profits. She hopes to be able to set up a real convenience store one day.

Please help us support Milagros and her friends with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase daily sales products like rice, beans, oil and spices

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es: Sandra Margarita M. C. D. P. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Lourdes Colón junto a sus cuatro hijos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar y su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante. Ella posee un comedor y también una venta D. ropa en su casa. Sandra solícita un préstamo con el fin D. poder pagar todos los gastos relacionados a sus negocios, así como también comprar ropa al mayoreo, D. manera que tenga mucho más productos que ofrecer y así obtener más clientela lo cual la beneficie a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Margarita M. C. D. P. is 43. She lives in Lourdes Colón with her four minor children who go to school and her husband who is a businessman. She has a dining room, and she also sells clothes in her home. Sandra is asking for a loan to be able to pay the business expenses. She will also buy clothes wholesale. That way she will have a lot more products to sell. Then she will have more customers, which will benefit her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Las Dos Juntas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está compuesto por dos personas la sra. Juana C. que se dedica a la venta de comdimentos y la sra. Virginia B. que se dedica a la venta de crema chantilli(crema de leche). Ambas venden en la calle 23 de marzo, ubicada en la zona de Pampahasi, se conocen hace mucho tiempo y son muy buenas amigas. Doña Juana vive en la final de la calle 23 de marzo, con cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar, su esposo se queda en casa ya que tuvo un accidente y quedo paralítico, sin poder trabajar. Doña Virginia vive en la zona de Kupini, ella hace chantilli,hecha de leche batida manualmente con azúcar y limón, batido de bicervecina y frescos hervidos de manzana. Invertirán el crédito en incrementar su capital, doña juana en compra de condimentos,y doña Virginia en compra de leche por mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of two people. Juana C. sells condiments, and Virginia B. sells Chantilly cream. They both sell on 23 de Marzo Street, which is located in the Pampahasi zone. They have known each other for a long time, and they are very good friends. Juana lives at the end of 23 de Marzo Street with her four school aged children. Her husband stays at home. Since he had an accident, he has been paralyzed. He cannot work. Virginia lives in the Kupini zone. She makes Chantilly, which is made of milk whipped by hand, sugar, and lemon; whipped “bicervecina” (dark beer); and drinks made from boiled apples. They will use the loan to increase their capital. Juana will buy condiments. Virginia will buy a larger quantity of milk.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies, vegetables and repairs to the boarding house

loans.name: Mukhtar Begum Muhammad Hanif Group

texts.en:
Mukhtar begum baji is the wife of M. H. and they have lived in a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 19 years. She never got an education because her father was a farmer and had the responsibility for a big family. Her husband is involved in animal husbandry. He feeds various animals such as goats and buffaloes and sells them at the animal markets. He has been doing this work for over 5 years. Mukhtar baji is applying for a loan to buy animal feed to expand her husband’s animal-selling business.  

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy another bike for her bike rental business.  Munir baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Mukhtar baji is standing in the middle of the baji's in this photo.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for their animal-selling business

loans.name: Addah

texts.en:
Addah is strong businesswoman with a desire to excel in any area where she sets her foot. She started her retail business with a loan of Ksh 20,000 from SMEP and repaid it successfully. She then took another loan of Ksh 50,000 to increase her stock of cereals and repaid it, too.

Addah is married and has two young children. She operates her retail business in the rural area of Kakamega-Shinyalu trading centre. With a strong zeal to expand, she has now requested her third loan for Ksh 90,000 to enable her buy a motorbike and to increase her stock of cereals.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and to increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Babayor

texts.en: K. Babayor is 57 years old and is married with two children. For more than thirteen years Babayor has been selling vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, etc. His elder son helps him with the business. Babayor’s business begins in the early morning at 5:00 a.m. He buys vegetables from the local farmers at wholesale and sells them in the market. Moreover, he is trading in a market that is known among people because of its attractive prices. All this allows Babayor’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for his family. Today, Babayor is planning to purchase new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of his produce. For this purpose he requests 4,000 Somoni. Having a positive credit history with IMON, Babayor promises to repay the current loan promptly as he did the previous loans. The well-being of his family is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of his vegetables

loans.name: Ilolo Kati Group

texts.en:
Rechois a member of the Ilolo Kati borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 38 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children.

Recho has owned a shop business selling  commodities like rice, cooking oil, salts etc for 5 years. she works 6 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Recho`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Recho hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Happy and Aida are another member of the same borrower group, they also requested the loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for  shop business

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es: Mario Ernesto A. G. reside en San Salvador. Vive solamente con su mamá la Sra. Elsa de 84 años de edad. Mario es buen hijo, se ha quedado al cuido de su madre quien ha sido olvidada por todos sus hijos pero con el apoyo y cariño de Mario es feliz. Mario cuida de su madre con los ingresos que percibe de su  negocio una tienda de productos de consumo, El crédito es para surtir su tienda con sopas, gaseosas, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en:
Mario Ernesto A. G. lives in San Salvador with his 84 year old mother, Elsa. He is a good son. Mario was left to care for his mother because she had been forgotten by her other children. She remains happy thanks to his love and support.

Mario is able to provide for his mother out of his earnings selling consumer products from his grocery business. He will use his loan to restock his store with soaps, sodas, basic grains, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 37 years old, is married to Pauline Wangeci, and they have one school-going child. Peter has been running a bakery shop in Ndunyu Njeru town, in the outskirts of Naivasha town, for the last six years. Peter was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He plans to use this loan to diversify his source of income by buying a motorbike which he will operate as a taxi. In future, he plans to expand both businesses and have a stable source of income. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Erla

texts.en:
Erla T., who is 39 years old, is a rice farmer. She has five children. Her eldest child is only 17. She is doing the best she can to be able to save money to pay for the college education of her children. Farming is their only livelihood. The income she makes now from rice farming is what helps her family buy adequate food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying additional necessities and seeds.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Y. lives in Ta Saom village in Takeo province. She is 36 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The others are attending the local school. Mrs. Sok Y. sells traditional medicine. Mr. Koem Pech, is a construction worker and a farmer. He owns a small plot of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Sok Y. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.  This will help her diversify and improve her income and provide better for her children. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Seyi

texts.en: Seyi is 34 years old. She is married with a child. Her husband is a photographer. She runs a salon where she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells salon materials like shampoo, hair extensions and cream. She has been in this business for a long time. She is happy because profits will increase in the upcoming festive season. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 NGN; she will use the money to purchase more salon materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more salon materials to sell

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann S., age 20, operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Rose Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. She is married and has a baby, and she lives in the village of Baybay Panalsalan Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Rose Ann joined GDMPC earlier this year to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rose Ann is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her fish vending business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rose Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital for her fish vending business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is only thirteen years old. Her children go to school.

Josefina works hard to support her children's needs and education. She is involved in rice farming. She said that failure is really not absent when it comes to farming, especially if you lack financially.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to its financial service. She applied for a loan of Php10,000. This loan will be used for farm inputs, like seeds, fertilizers, and crude oil for the tractor.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers, and crude oil for the tractor.

loans.name: Ashaa

texts.en:
Ashaa T. is 56 years old. She is a mother of six grown children. Ashaa operates a cafeteria at the Kilifi town bus stage and has been selling food for two years. Her business has been a success because of the high number of workers in her business location and the good service she offers her clients.

Ashaa serviced her first loan from KADET well and is now glad to be borrowing a second one. With this loan, Ashaa plans buy a charcoal cooker, kitchen cutlery and more food stock to meet the needs of her customers.

She hopes to expand her cafe to be able to cater to the increasing number of customers.

loans.use: To buy a charcoal cooker, kitchen cutlery and food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bundles of used tee shirts, pants, children's clothing, and sheets

loans.name: Maximeno, Sr.

texts.en:
Maximeno F. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 70 years old, is married, and has six adult children.

Maximeno owns and operates a business providing party services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over forty years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maximeno joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating his business.

Maximeno is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in renovating his business. This loan will be his 5th PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating his business

loans.name: He Is Able Group

texts.en:
Abraham M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called 'He Is Able'. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children who range from 5 to 20 years old. He was only able to attend school through high school.

For 4 years, Abraham has been running his food shop at the Du-Port Road Junction in Paynesville. He sells good food and has a nice manner of interacting which keeps customers returning.  

Abraham plans to use his 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 41,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods.  His goal is to grow his business into a restaurant and to improve his family's living conditions.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Abraham is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Bertha Claudia

texts.es: Bertha Claudia tiene un negocio que es a venta de hot dog, gaseosas y otros. Por lo que tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio porque anteriormente se dedicaba a vender comida, por las noches su vivienda estaba muy llena de clientes, pero con el paso del tiempo las ventas fueron disminuyendo por lo que decide iniciar con otro negocio como es la venta de hot dog, hamburguesa entre otros productos a ella siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Es así que decide realizar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es establecer otro negocio que sea mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
Bertha Claudia owns a business selling hot dogs and cold drinks, among other things. She has operated the business for more than 6 years. She used to sell prepared meals, her house full of customers night after night, but business gradually fell away so she decided to start this business selling hot dogs, hamburgers, etc., work that she has long enjoyed. It's for this business that she's applying for a loan. She needs working capital so that she can buy basic supplies. Her goal is to establish another, larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for her business.

loans.name: Alba Virginia

texts.es: la sra. habita en la ciudad de villanueva en el sector siete, ella es soltera con tres hijos los cuales ha criado sol y actualmente trabaja como barrendera en la alcaldia municipal de villanueva, esta solicitando este credito ya que el techo de su casa es ta mal por lo tanto su salario nu le alcansa para comprar lo de una ves
texts.en:
la sra. habita en la ciudad de villanueva en el sector siete, ella es soltera con tres hijos los cuales ha criado sol y actualmente trabaja como barrendera en la alcaldia municipal de villanueva, esta solicitando este credito ya que el techo de su casa es ta mal por lo tanto su salario nu le alcansa para comprar lo de una ves

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para la compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is happy in his foodstuff business. He was selling electrical parts before he started his foodstuffs business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. Charles lives in Edo State, Nigeria. He is 39 years old and married to a teacher. They are blessed with 2 children. His children and doing well at school.

Charles needs the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Madame Khoudia F. est sociétaire de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 5 ans. Elle est âgée de 30 ans et habite dans le quartier de Darou Salam. C’est une ménagère, mariée et mère de 4 enfants et elle s’active dans la vente de pain et de petit déjeuner  devant chez elle au profit des maçons et travailleurs qui sont dans les environs. Elle capitalise une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce petit commerce. Ses bénéfices  peuvent  varier en moyenne entre 500 et 1000 frs CFA journalièrement, ce qui lui permet de participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Aussi ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son fond de commerce et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khoudia F. has been a shareholder-member of the savings bank in Dalifort for the past five years. She is 30 years old and lives in the district of Darou Salam. She is a housewife, married and mother to four children. She sells bread and breakfasts in front of her home, to builders and workers in the surroundings. She has more than five years' experience in this small business. Her profits can vary on average between 500 and 1000 francs a day, which allows her to participate in the management of the daily expenses. This loan will allow her to increase her business and meet her customers' needs. She is requesting a loan of 75,000 francs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Soyolmaa

texts.en: Soyolmaa D. is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2005, she started her own small business selling flour at the local food market. She buys flour from wholesalers and resells it at retail to local residents. As her business grew, she increased her inventory to include rice and sugar as well. Soyolmaa's husband transports her flour, rice and sugar from the wholesale market. To increase the household’s income, her husband also runs a car transport service for other wholesalers. Soyolmaa's daughter Oyuntugs just graduated from high-school. Since she founded her business, her living conditions have improved. Now she had owns house with a yard and a car. Soyolmaa is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar and noodles to increase her inventory. She is a humble, shy and hard-working person. She says, "I have a dream to have my own grocery store one day to ensure my only daughter's future life."

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and noodles to increase her inventory

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia D. R. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old. Cornelia is widowed. To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cornelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Cornelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to expand the business

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El  Sr. Felix V. A.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, tiene 68 años de edad, es Viudo. El tuvo  6 hijos  quienes  ya son mayores de  edad, trabajan en forma independiente de su padre. 
       Se dedica en la producción y venta de productos agrícolas, producción y venta de leche y queso, con clientela formada, en los negocios del mercado de   Santani.
El cuenta con un ingreso estable, gracias a las atividades que realiza, actualmente desea adquirir desmamantes para engorde que le dejara un buen buen ingreso. 
Quiere incursionar en esta actividade ya que hay mucho mercado donde puede vender sus productos, y por ello que desidio invertir en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix V. A. is from the town of San Estanislao. He is 68 years old and is a widower. He has 6 children now grown up and working independently from their father.

He produces and sells agricultural products for a living: producing and selling milk and cheese to regular customers at the Santini market.

He has a stable income thanks to his work and now he would like to buy calves to fatten up and earn a good income.

He wants to start up this business because there are many markets where he can sell his products. It is for this reason that he has decided to invest in this enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves for fattening and selling

loans.name: Angela Del Pilar

texts.es: Ángela Del Pilar  tiene 32 años de edad,  hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Ya que sus inicios se dan desde hace mucho tiempo, pues poco a poco es que ha ido mejorando su negocio. Por lo que sus clientes siempre están solicitando diferentes productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas trajes y vestidos, ella con mucho esfuerzo y como toda madre luchadora ha demostrado que puede mejorar sus condiciones.  Por lo que sus 3 hijos son su mayor felicidad y siempre está buscando la amera de proporciónales lo necesario. el financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Pilar is 32 years old. For more than four years, she has been in the business of selling general merchandise. Since the beginning she has gradually been able to improve her business. Ángela tries very hard to satisfy her customers since they are always requesting different products such as trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses. Like any determined mother, she has demonstrated that she is able to improve her conditions. Her three children are her greatest joy, so she is always looking to provide them with what they need.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine L. is currently in the business of selling fruits such as oranges, pineapples, lemons and guava at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more oranges to sell.

Josephine is 47 years old and is married to a soldier. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a pub.

loans.use: To stock more oranges to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan S. is married. His family lives in Korolyovo. Ivan sells household cleaning products and personal products in the central marketplace of his small hometown. Small ventures like Ivan’s become the only source of income for families in remote parts of Ukraine. Ivan has been in the trade for 8 years. Currently, his inventory amounts to 40,000 Grivnas; his income is about 5,000 Grivnas a month. 

Ivan’s business is characterized by stability and positive performance. Inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and other household products. Ivan wants to see his business growing in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase his turnover capital. Ivan’s business goal is to start one more business location in the nearest future.

loans.use: To increase inventory capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una madre D. familia D. 50 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Chepén, una zona agrícola D. movimiento comercial considerable. Pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a mas D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida junto a su esposo vendiendo huevos sancochados D. codorniz, esta actividad la realiza en un pequeño carrito con el que suele recorrer algunas calles D. su localidad, su esposo también trabaja D. la misma manera. Los huevos D. codorniz tienen bastante demanda debido a su elevado nivel D. nutrientes.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas huevos D. modo que sus ventas se puedan incrementar y pueda recibir mas ganancias, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Sus vecinos y conocidos dan muy buenas referencias D. su persona. Su negocio siempre cuenta con clientes debido al buen trato con el que son atendidos.
texts.en:
María is a 50 year old mother who lives with her husband in Chepén district, an agricultural zone with considerable commercial activity. It is part of Chepén province, La Libertad region, located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She and her husband earn their livelihood selling boiled quail eggs from a little cart that wanders through some of their locality’s streets. Quail eggs are in high demand due to their high level of nutrients. María wants to expand her business buying more eggs so that her sales will increase thus earning higher profits. To reach her goal she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. María is a calm, responsible woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances give her very good personal references. Her business always has customers due to the pleasant way she treats them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quail eggs.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Laynas del distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, se encuentra ubicada a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina en la cual se ofrece servicio de transporte). El brinda su servicio durante todo el día dentro de su distrito y en las principales zonas aledañas. Estos vehículos son bastante solicitados por la población de la zona ya que constituyen una alternativa rápida y barata para transportarse.

Lamentablemente, el continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil y el mal estado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Isidro es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, los pobladores de la zona le consideran alguien de confianza. Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas
texts.en:
Isidro is a 36-year old father who lives with his family in the Laynas sector of the La Matanza district in the province of Morropón.  This area is located more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For more than three years, he has dedicated himself to providing transportation services for passengers with a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a passenger cabin attached, used to provide transportation for riders).  He provides his service all day within his district, as well as in neighboring areas.  These vehicles are in high demand, as it is a quick and cheap mode of transportation for residents of the area.

Unfortunately, continuous use and the bad state of the area’s roads have resulted in his vehicle having some mechanical problems.  These require urgent repairs in order to continue functioning reliably.  For this reason, he has turned to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 Peruvian soles.

Isidro is a responsible and hard-working person.  His greatest desire is to see his family enjoy a better quality of life.  Area residents consider him a trustworthy person.  He has previously had a loan with Edpyme Alternativa, and he demonstrated his responsible nature from the moment he assumed his payments.

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance expenses for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Yanelisa

texts.es:
Yanelisa es una microempresaria dedicada las ventas de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos, carteras entre otros. Su negocio se encuentra en la ciudad de Hato Mayor, una ciudad dedicada a la agricultura al noreste del pais. Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque necesitaba invertir en su negocio Es una joven soltera que vive con su madre, con la cual comparte su tiempo libre y apoya economicamente. Nos dice que su reto mas dificil por cumplir es poder terminar la universidad, pero que mientras se esfuerza para lograrlo, disfruta de la lectura y salir a pasear.

Yanelisa está muy emocionada de recibir su quinto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 5 años, el cual inició con su primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza. Va a invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Productos Miscelaneos (zapatos, carteras, ropas, cosmeticos). Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y ahorrar. Su sueño es poder convertirse en profesional.
texts.en:
Yanelisa is a small business woman who sells clothing, cosmetics, shoes and wallets among other items. Her business is located in the city of Hato Mayor. The city is primarily made up of a population of agriculturists and it is located in the northwest region of the country. She is a member of Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner) and she joined having seen the need to invest in her business. She is a young, single mother who lives with her Mom, with whom she spends her time and supports her financially. She states that her goal is a very challenging one, in that she dreams of completing her university studies. She also enjoys reading and touring. 

Yanelisa is very excited to be in receipt of a fifth loan from Esperanza International, having repaid the previous loan successfully. With the help of the past loan she took one step forward in the development of her business. She has had the business for about 5 years. She started the business with her first loan from Esperanza. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of miscellaneous products (shoes, wallets, clothing, and cosmetics). She will use the profits to reinvest back into the business and to put away in savings. Her dream is to have a professional career.

loans.use: To purchase miscellaneous merchandise.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, tiene una panadería, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, junto a su familia su esposa, sus dos hijos, la primera de 5 años y la ultima de 8 meses aproximadamente y que dependen económicamente de él, la panadería la tiene ubicada en su casa de residencia y realiza las ventas tanto en su casa como a domicilio. Su producción es en diferentes clases de pan, tiene un empleado que le ayuda a la preparación y  ya tiene 2 años de atenderla trabajando  mañana y tarde, no tiene dificultades  en sus ventas ya que está en una zona accesible.
Él quiere comprar latas para hornear el pan y mejorar el local por lo que solicita un  préstamo que le ayude a realizar esta inversión ya que quiere mejorar su producción aumentando la cantidad de pan que prepara a diario, con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos para el hogar.
La aspiración de él es expandirse más con la panadería, atender a más clientes de la zona, darse a conocer y contar con la preferencia de varias personas, que sus ingresos sean mayores y la estabilidad económica en su hogar sea cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Julio has a bakery.  He lives in Puerto el Triunfo in Usulután together with his family his wife and his two children.  His eldest child is 5 and his youngest is 8 months.  They depend on him financially.  His bakery is in his own house and he sells his products both from his house and as deliveries.  He produces different types of bread.  He has one employee who helps him to make the bread and he has been serving in the bakery for 2 years, morning and afternoon.  He has no problems with sales as he is in an accessible area.

Julio would like to buy bread pans and also improve his premises which is why he is requesting a loan which will help him to achieve this.  He would like to improve his production, increasing the quantity of bread which he makes each day with the goal of improving his sales and his household income.

Julio's aspiration is to expand his bakery, serve more clients in the area, become known by more people and become the favorite bakery of more people.  He would like to increase his income and improve the financial stability of his household.

loans.use: To purchase baking tins for making bread and to improve the bakery premises

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira A. is married with two children. She is an aspiring entrepreneur from Agsu city. Tahira runs a business selling office supplies and other household items in the central marketplace. Her enterprise is well-known for a flexible discount system she offers to her customers. 

Tahira has always wanted to be self-employed. Her husband has been very supportive of the idea, which is why she ventured to make her dream come true about 3 years ago. 

Tahira wants to keep her enterprise running to be able to provide for her family and support her elderly parents. She has many bright ideas she is hoping to implement along the way.  Tahira is a lively optimist and tries to mirror that attitude in her work as well. She is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN  and is hoping to repay the loan as successfully as the first one.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to increase income

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana K. makes Fante kenkey (a type of sourdough dumpling) for sale in Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is an electrician. Nana has been in kenkey production for seven years. She assists her husband with feeding, clothing and educating her dependents. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey to distribute to her growing number of customers. She hopes to educate her dependents with her profits.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare kenkey (a type of sourdough dumpling) to distribute to her customers

loans.name: Tojiddin

texts.en:
Tojiddin T. is 36 years old.  He lives in Isfara town. Tojiddin processes and sells dried fruits in the central local market. Together with the help of his brothers who are currently in Russia, he also sells his products in Russia. He is experienced in the business of making dried fruits. He purchases dried fruits from local farmers as a wholesale and after processing sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Tojiddin to make his business successful, which provides a stable income for his family. Currently, he needs a loan of $3,000 loan to buy supplies so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Tojiddin expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for dried fruit

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, a mother of five, is 54 years old. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who wants to be able to help her family. Working closely with her husband, she makes and sells ready-to-eat food. She started the business 15 years ago to help her family meet its education expenses, as well as water, electricity and food expenses. All of these items are very expensive. 

Now, Nenita has requested 20,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business. She is positive that her business will grow, since she already has regular customers in her local area submitting orders. Specifically, the loan will be used to buy more ingredients. She is pleased because, in the past, she has used the loans to invest in her business.

With working capital, Nenita's business will continue to grow and she will be able to provide excellent products to her regular customers. With the support of Kiva lenders, Nenita hopes to improve the standard of living for herself and her family and lift them out of poverty. 

She dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her food in order to earn a much larger income. She also dreams of her children completing college. Nenita is glad to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

During the course of her membership in ASHI, Nenita has been a model member, dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: will be used to buy more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 40 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados como vacas, ovejas, la socia compra para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes especialmente a los restaurantes de Cusco y Poroy, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja llevan años en este negocio siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más ganado para así poder distribuirlo a sus clientes y tener más ingresos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Mama Simona” communal bank, located in the Poroy district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married and has three children.  She buys livestock such as cattle and sheep, and then distributes them to her customers, particularly to restaurants in Cusco and Poroy.  She and her husband work together.  They’ve been in this business for years, making it possible to move their family ahead.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more livestock, deliver it to her customers, and increase her income.  She is happy about this loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
The desire to help does not depend on one's circumstances. Our CCT* Community Partner, Michelle F., 27, does not emphasize the fact that she is in need, but seeks first to help others meet their own needs. Michelle is a single parent. She reached college, and with her current business she raises three dependents.  One child is already in elementary school, and two are not studying yet. Her family resides in Caloocan City.

Michelle buys and sells clothes in the Ready To Wear (RTW) business. She sells clothes like shirts and pants to her business connections and friends. Also, Michelle sees a future in selling peanut butter, which she makes herself. This business is a hit primarily because Michelle gets the taste that favors the appetites of her customers. Monthly, Michelle is able to earn an estimated net income of around Php10,500.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requests a Php15,000 loan. She will add this loan to the money she currently has in order to purchase more clothes and accessories, as well as ingredients for peanut butter, sugar and peanuts.

She recognizes that exhaustion keeps her down and becomes her major struggle, but she is determined to overcome the tiredness mentality, get enough rest everyday, and grow her business. She sees her business as a way to help her family and her community. Her hope is to give her children a bright future, and one step toward that is to be able to send them to school, up to college.
	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for peanut butter-making, and apparel to sell

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years and employs two farmhands. Her mixed farm, which is located in the county of Nyamira in western Kenya, produces tea, maize, milk and sorghum, which are all sold locally. She also earns income from her cereals store in the same region.

Callen is 41 years old and married with 8 children.

She has requested a loan of 45,000Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her expand her farming business. She would like to have at least 3 dairy cows in the next 5 years. Lack of proper markets and animal diseases have been her biggest challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ratna Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu A. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. Ni Putu A. is the "Ratna S." group leader, a 15-member group loan offered by MUK. Ni Putu A. is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Putu A. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 

Ni Putu A. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities. Ni Putu A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,400,000 IDR from MUK. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She has a dream of supporting her children's education from the profit that she get from this business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua K. is a single parent taking care of two children. She has senior high background of education. Akua sells cooking utensils at Nkroful near Takoradi. Akua uses her income to take care of her children. Akua will add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business. She anticipates building a shop to sell her wares in.

loans.use: Akua will add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Janith

texts.en:
Janith P. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 26 years old. Janith is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Janith buys and sells coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) and coco charcoals in the local community. Janith has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Janith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Janith is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and charcoal to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Janith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a farmer in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years. She employs three farmhands and sells her products of tea and milk to the local market. She also operates a small shop in the same region.

Janet has requested for a loan of KES60,000 through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help in paying school fees for her children and providing for the basic needs of her family.

Janet is 34 years old and is married. She has 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kavule Effort  Development Group B

texts.en:
Teddy N., 50, has been operating a general merchandise retail shop for the past 10 years in Nabuti-Mukono. The happily married mother of three says she was inspired by her husband to start this business. 

At her shop she sells a wide variety of general retail commodities such as sugar, rice, soap, beans, rice, maize flour, basins, etc. She says this business generates 100,000 UGX weekly as profit.

With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ar: عزيزة امراة متزوجة وهي ام لولد لها من العمر 45 سنة هي امراة عاملة نشيطة ومحبة للعمل لها في عملها 3 سنوات تعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية والاكسسوارات تريد ان تحسن في وضعها المادي والاجتماعي وان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لولدها فهي امراة عطوفة وتريد ان ترقى بعائلتها الى احسن الاحوال تعمل منذ وقت وقد استطاعت من خلال القرض السابق من المجموعة الى استاجار محل خاص بها والان تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل لدعم عملها وتحسين وضع المدخول تعاني من بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تحول دون تطور العمل ولكنها وبفضل المثابرة والعمل الجيد والتمييز بالاسعار وخبرتها في العمل وزبائنها تستطيع وبفضل الدعم المادي من خلال القرض ان تزيد من مدخولها وتحسن وضعها
texts.en: Aziza is 45 years old and married with a son. She is an active working woman who loves her business. She has been running a clothes, shoes and accessories store for three years. She would like to improve her financial and social situation and secure a good future for her son, as she is a compassionate woman who wants to progress for herself and her family. The last loan assisted her in renting her own shop, and with this loan she wants to purchase new stock, support her store, and increase her income. She suffers some financial issues which prevent the development of her business. However, with perseverance, good work, competitive prices, her experience with the business and her customers, as well as with the financial support from the loan, she is able to increase her income and improve her circumstances.

loans.use: to buy new stock for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 29 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, he runs a green grocery store.  He also does farming to supplement his income. Isaiah works hard in his business to provide for his family and educate his two children.  His desire is to open other outlets for his business in the surrounding area, due to the high competition.  Isaiah has requested a loan for 60, 000 Kes to buy more onions, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: buy onions, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Zedekia

texts.en:
Zedekia is 43 years old, married, and has 5 children, ages 10 to 22. He runs a carpentry business with 2 employees and has been working in this business for 10 years. Zedekia plans to use the loan to purchase more timber and a machine to help shorten timber. 

In the future, Zedekia hopes to expand his business even further. He also hopes to develop a plot of land and build rental houses. Zedekia describes himself as visionary.

loans.use: to purchase more timber and a machine to help shorten timber

loans.name: Saadiyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. Saadiyeh has had a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs . Her market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Saadiyeh is requesting a $1800 loan to buy a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her market. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soft drink, bread, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Nelly Margoth

texts.es:
Nelly Margoth tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	NUEVA INSPIRACION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz y arroz.

Nelly se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Agripac y los vende en el Comercial Carlos Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente a suplir sus necesidades y a mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.

Le gusta realizar actividades domésticas.
texts.en:
Nelly Margoth is 22 years old.  She and single and lives with her parents in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province. 

The members of the communal bank Nueva Inspiracion (New Inspiration) are located in the Anchoveta Precinct of Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural projects, like growing corn and rice.

Nelly makes her living in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  She purchases her products from Agripac and sells them in the Carlos Castillo Stores.

Nelly is requesting the loan to purchase corn seed.  The loan would help her financially to meet her needs and to improve her agricultural activities.  She faces challenges such as plant diseases like "cinta roja" (an emerging disease known as "red stripe") in the corn.  Nelly's dream is to purchase a plot of land.

Nelly likes housework.

loans.use: to purchase corn and rice seed.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria es productora lechera; su producto lo vende directamente a la  empresa industrializadora  de leche PIL. Victoria   también se dedica al cultivo de la tierra y su esposo ayuda con  trabajos de agricultura a otras familias del pueblo donde viven. El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de una vaca lechera; así podra aumentar la capacidad de producción y por ende sus ingresos. Victoria y su esposo viven en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja del  departamento de La Paz y tienen tres hijos. Esta es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter social del mismo se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria is a milk producer. Her product is sold directly to the PIL dairy plant. Victoria also cultivates her land. Her husband performs farm work for other families in the town where they live. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow. This will increase her production capacity and eventually her income. Victoria and her husband live in their own home in the town of Laja in the Department of La Paz. They have three children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO. Her character references qualify her to receive the funds through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bema

texts.en:
Bema is married with one child. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. Sema is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. 

She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase feeds for her pigs. Bema has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Native de Sikasso et âgée de 29 ans, Fatoumata est une divorcée et mère de deux garçons. Elle vit dans une grande traditionnelle élargie à Médine- Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Fatoumata s’est initiée  à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles d’alimentation depuis plus de cinq années. Elle mène son activité devant son domicile à Médine, Sikasso, où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux années et elle a déjà bénéficié de trois prêts qui ont été remboursés avec succès.
Ainsi, elle sollicite un quatrième prêt pour acheter auprès de ses fournisseurs de Sikasso mais aussi de Bamako,  45 paquets de boissons NBB, 50 casiers de boissons BRAMALI, 72 cartons d’eau minérale, 10 cartons de lait Candia, 32 cartons de boisson en canette de différentes qualités (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc), 17 paquets d’eau minérale en sachets, des cartons de biscuits de qualité différentes, etc.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
A native of Sikasso and 29-years-old, Fatoumata is a divorcée and the mother of two boys. She lives in a large traditional extended area of Médine- Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). 

After having conducted many businesses without success, Fatoumata started in the business of buying and selling groceries more than five years ago. She conducts her business in front of her home in Médine, Sikasso, where she is sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. 

To satisfy her growing number of customers, she decided to rejoin the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than two years ago and she has already received three loans which have been successfully repaid. Thus, she requests a fourth loan in order to buy from the suppliers from Sikasso and also from Bamakano, 45 packets of NBB beverages, 50 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 72 cartons of mineral water, 10 cartons of Candia milk, 32 cartons of different kinds of canned drinks (Malta, Vimto, Ivorio, etc.), 17 packages of mineral water in pouches, boxes of different types of biscuits, etc.
